description: OAKDALE, L. L, Oct. 3 The marriage of Miss Janet Alice White to Ens Michael Edward Foster, U.S.N., took place in the chapel of La Salle Military Academy here today. Msgr. Edmond F. Hammer, uncle of the bride, performed the Roman Catholic ceremo ny.

title: 3 Justices Sitting in Queens Prison Grant Paroles
description: Six solemn prisoners sa tas observers in an unusual jail house judicial procedure yes terday while three State Su preme Court ustices ruled on applications for the reduction of the bail of other prisoners.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Many critics beside myself have called Ellery Queen's Mystery Magazine the best of its kind today. Perhaps only those who remember Black Mask (which played a vital role in the formative years of that inherently American mani festation, the hardboiled detec tive story) will challenge the assertion that E.Q.M.M. is the best in history. The Queen magazine beganif tentative in spirit, decidedly solid in con tentin the fall of 1941, with seven reprinted stories by the likes of Hammett, Allingham, Stribling and Woolrich. The quarterly became bimonthly, then monthly, increased in size; and, over the years, became the repository of the finest short stories in the genre.

title: RIOTING SPREADS TO A FOURTH JAIL; 5 HOSTAGES FREED
description: Rioting spread to the fourth city prison in three days yes terday when hundreds of in mates seized three guards as hostages and took over most of the Brooklyn House of Deten tion. However, counterattack ing guards wielding police billies broke through barricades on the fifth floor of the building early this morning and rescued the three men.

title: No. Rockland Sinks Ramapo, 306
description: Rockland County's list of un beaten and untied teams was reduced to two yesterday when North Rockland shattered pre viously undefeated Ramapo, 30 6. In other Public School Ath letic League games, Suffern de feated Nanuct, 300; Spring Valley upset Pearl River, 147, and Tappan Zee blanked Clarks town 180.

title: Protest Sent to Nixon
description: LONDON, Oct. 3 (AP) Twentyfive Greek exiles sent a letter to President Nixon to day protesting what they called the United States Government's blatant distortion of the truth about the situation in Greece.

title: Margaret Baer Wed in Scarsdale
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Oct. 3  The marriage of Miss Mar garet Ann Baer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry M. Baer, to J. Garrett De Graff Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. De Graff of Scarsdale and Clinton Corners, took place here this afternoon.

title: President Signs Starfish Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP) President Nixon has signed a $4.5million bill authorizing re search aimed at protecting coral in the tropical Pacific Ocean from Crown of Thorns starfish. The bill sets up a star fish eradication program.

title: Senate RollCall Peak Recalls Cromwell Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP) The Senate has already set this year a record in the num ber of rollcall votes for a single session of Congress.

title: Mrs. Minarik Wed To Homer Bigart
description: NOTTINGHAM, N. H., Oct. 3Mrs. Else Holmelund Min arik, author of the Little Bear series for children, was married here this evening to Homer W. Bigart, a staff member of The New York Times. The ceremony was performed in the presence of of the immediate families at the bride's farm by Justice of the Peace John Perkins.

title: Food, $150
description: SINCE WE were on a fairly tight budget during our journey, we kept tabs of our expenditures. The total cost of the tripapprox imately six weeks and 11,400 mileswas about $650. (Our route took us from Pittsburgh to North Dakota to the state of Washing ton, down the West Coast to Taos, N.M., and then directly to the Great Smokies and Virginia.)

title: Familiar Name Dominates Paris Thoroughbred Scene Nijinsky
description: PARIS, Oct. 3The hotels are packed, the streets are teeming with people, the traffic is maddening and the autumnal mood seems per fect for a horse race often called the world's most test ing championship.

title: NORMAN GRAHAM SR.
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Oct. 4 Norman Graham Sr., chairman of the Plastic Carton Corpora tion of America, died yesterday in St. Elizabeth Hospital, after a brief illness. He was 60 years old and lived at 750 North Broad Street.

title: End of Umpires Walkout A Mixed Blessing for Berry
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Oct. 4 (UPI)Charlie Berry, 66year old retired American League umpire who worked in yester day's opening game of the play offs, said today he was glad the regular league umpires had settled their strike and returned to work.

title: Consumer Drive at a Critical Stage
description: Don't dial 9642525 unless you want to hear Bess Myer son Grant tell you all about the fictitious itinerant Wil liamsons, perhaps the coun try's bestknown homeim provement swindlers.

title: PITCAIRN ISLAND REFUGE FOR FEW
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Oct. 4 Pitcairn Island, the lonely ref uge of the mutineers from the British ship Bounty and their descendants, is gradually but inexorably losing its population.

title: Austrian Socialists Add Seat
description: VIENNA, Oct. 4 (Reuters) Austria's governing Socialist party won an extra seat in Par liament from its opponents to day in special elections for 16 seats, according to unofficial returns. They now have 82 seats against 78 for the People's party and 5 for the Freedom party.

title: Perpetual Prison Crisis
description: City and state leaders as well as the judicial system itself share in the blame for the worst in the city's long series of prison crises. While the focus of attention at the moment is necessarily on the rampaging prisoners in the city's jails  and more important, on the safety of the guards who are being held hostage  the issues remain those of a sluggish system of justice, slipshod hail procedures and disegraceful orison conditions.

title: Art Exhibition to Help A Hospital in Peru
description: The fourth annual preview exhibition of works of con temporary painters will be held Wednesday at the Salamagundi Club, 47 Fifth Avenue.

title: Horse Show Results
description: AT SLEEPY HOLLOW C. C.

title: ALLIES REPEL FOE SOUTH OF DANANG
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Monday, Oct. 5 (AP)United States and South Vietnamese troops repelled a companysize North Vietnamese attack on an outpost south of Danang yester day, killing 11 enemy soldiers, the United States command said.

title: Nijinsky Suffers First Setback of His Career
description: PARIS, Oct. 4Mighty Ni jinsky was beaten today. By the margin of a bobbing head, this pride of a $15million thoroughbred empire and a 25 choice at fashionable Long champ suffered his first defeat in 12 starts. Nijinsky wavered at the finish of a stirring stretch duel and the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe was won by Sassafras.

title: Reds and Orioles Triumph and Capture 20 Playoff Leads as Umpires Return
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 4 With the regular umpires back at their stations after a oneday strike, the Cincinnati Reds de feated the Pittsburgh Pirates for the second straight time to day, 31, and moved within one game of the National League pennant.

title: Gordon Lightfoot Sings His Friendly Tunes
description: Canadian folk singer Gordon Lightfoot gave a rare concert Saturday evening at Carnegie Hall, and he was well received by a devoted audience.

title: STRANGLED WOMAN FOUND IN L.I. WOODS
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I, Oct. 4 A 24yearold woman found strangled in a wooded area here yesterday was identified today as Mrs. Ellena P. Scarborough of Avondale Drive, Centereach.

title: ASHE DOWNS RICHEY IN PACIFIC NET FINAL
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Oct. 5 (UPI)  Arthur Ashe and Nancy Richey took the singles titles in the $35,000 Pacific Coast international tennis open today.

title: A Host of Pianists Star in Library Benefit Concert
description: The audience entering the Hunter College Auditorium on Saturday night saw eight grand pianos spread diagon ally over the stage. Four were Steinways and four were Baldwins. The Interna tional Piano Library, which was sponsoring the concert, was not out to make en emies.

title: Tinbergen Reassigns Industry Rationally
description: THE HAGUEThese are trying days for believers in free trade. A bill before the United States Congress would authorize a series of import quotas, and one result would be to encourage the uneco nomic production of protected goods.

title: Crash Fatal to 13 Athletes Investigated
description: SILVER PLUME, Colo., Oct. 4 (UPI)Half of a 30man inves tigating team climbed 11,500 feet up Mount Bethel in the Rocky Mountains today to a ski basin where a 20yearold Mar tin 404 crashed Friday, killing 29 persons, including 13 mem bers of the Wichita State Uni versity football team.

title: New Guidelines Limit Size Of White House Protests
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 (AP) The Department of the Interior announced today that new regu lations, limiting demonstrations in front of the White House to 100 persons, would take effect Oct. 31.

title: Four Killed in 3Car Crash On Cross Island Parkway
description: Four men were killed early yesterday in a threecar acci dent on the Cross Island Park. way in the Whitestone section of Queens and the wife of one of the victims was critically injured.

title: GREECE STRESSES LOYALTY TO WEST
description: ATHENS, Oct. 4  Leaders of Greece's military  backed regime have reassured the United States Secretary of De fense, Melvin R. Laird, of their continued loyalty to the West ern alliance.

title: JONES'S MUSTANG WINS COAST RACE
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Oct. 4 (UPI)Parnelli Jones of Tor rance, Calif., and his Mustang teammate, George Follmer, of Arcadia, Calif., finished one, two today in the Mission Bell 200, the 11th and final Trans American sedan race of the year.

title: Ciro Leads Fiery Troupe
description: There are two natural stars in Ciro and his Ballet Flamen co: Ciro himself and Rosa Montoya. He is the crafts man, calling up blizzards of rhythmic heel taps to create a mood, and she the tiny emotional tornado spinning off waves of animal energy. The company appeared at Alice Tully Hall on Saturday evening in a program that de manded fire and cool control, both of which it had in abun dance.

title: Bridge
description: Next year's world cham pionship for the Bermuda Bowl, to be played in May in Taipei, Taiwan, will be contested by six teams, more than ever before.

title: REPORT ON KENT SCORES STUDENTS AND GUARDSMEN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4The President's Commission on Campus Unrest declared today that students who committed and encouraged violence shared responsibility with the Ohio Na tional Guard for death and in jury at Kent State University last May. Candidates of all sorts put in obligatory appearances yester day at the Pulaski Day parade, the annual fall salute to Polish Americans.

title: Sanudo Scores 67 for 269 to Win Azalea Open by Shot
description: WILMINGTON, N.C., Oct. 4 (AP)Cesar Sanudo of San Diego won the $60,000 Azalea open golf tournament by a stroke today from Bobby Mitchell of Danville, Va., who had bogeys on the last three holes.

title: ISRAEL WON'T FREE TWO ALGERIAN AIDES
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 4  Israel said today she would not free two senior Algerian officials as ransom for hijacked airline pas sengers recently repatriated by Arab guerrillas.

title: Further Advance Is Seen In Bond Interest Rates
NEW CURB SOUGHT ON AD FALSEHOOD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4The Federal Trade Commission is trying to fashion a new weapon against false advertising and has chosen two of the coun try's largest corporations as ad versaries for test cases.

title: 1917 Book on Eugenics Reprinted
description: Given the success of the 1897 Sears Roebuck catalogue in facsimile edition, it was inevitable that others would pitch their sales tent on the same campground.

title: Postmasters Honor Farley
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 4 (AP) James A. Farley, former Post master. General and a chief strategist of Franklin D. Roose velt's first two Presidential vic tories, was honored here today at the 66th convention of the National Association of Post masters of the United States. Mr. Farley, 82 years old, headed the Post Office Department from 1933 to 1940.

title: Celtics Snap Losing Streak, Trouncing Knicks, 129102
description: UTICA, N. Y., Oct. 4The Boston Celtics handed the New York Knickerbockers their sec ond straight National Basketball Association exhibition loss to night, 129102, and snapped their own fourgame losing streak.

title: Horse Show Results AT EQUITATION LODGE
POWELL L. BEYLAND
description: Powell L. Leyland a partner in the law firm of Davidson, Dawson & Clark, 63 Wall Street, who specialized in trust, estate, real estate and tax law, died yesterday of cancer at his home, 140 Cooper Avenue, Upper Montclair, N. J. His age was 34.

title: The Authentic Voice
description: LONDON, Oct. 4When Senator Hugo L. Black was about to take his seat on the Supreme Court in 1937, amid bitter criticism, a friend told him that the publisher of a lead ing newspaper had sworn to print an antiBlack editorial every day as long as he was there. He replied: I'm 51 years old, and I think my health is good. Before I get ready to quit, the naner would be bankrunt.

title: General's Aide Comments
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Oct. 4 (AP)Gov. James A. Rhodes and Maj. Gen. Sylvester T. Del Corso, adjutant general of the Ohio National Guard, declined to comment today on the Presi dential Commission's report.

title: Garaialde Beats Nicklaus By Stroke in Volvo Open
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 4 (AP) Jean Garaialde of France won the $40,000 Volvo open invita tion golf tournament today by a stroke from Jack Nicklaus of the United States.

title: London
description: LONDON  In any indus trial city in the British north, the slummiest road will prob ably be called Coronation Street a long, low, gray huddle of cottages, jerry built by speculative builders just after the death of Queen Victoria, with a barracklike pub on the corner, a few all purpose oneman shops, a church hall, and a pall of industrial smoke, like a spider's web, hanging low over the roofs.

title: Laying Down the Line
description: What is a Republican and when does he leave his party? If it was imprudent of Vice President Agnew raise such questions in the midst of a political campaign, it was downright rash of him to answer them.

title: The Mutual Fund Bill
description: The House of Representatives has passed a mutual fund bill that is a diluted version of the diluted version passed by the Senate. It will do very little to reduce the costs of buying and owning mutual fund shares, costs that independent scholars and the Securities and Exchange Commission alike have time and again found to be excessive.

title: Political PollVaulting
description: In September of 1946 an un known lawyer named Jacob K. Javits, the Republican candi date for Congress on Manhat tan's Upper West Side, paid Elmo Roper a few hundred dol lars to conduct a private poll of voter opinions in his district. The poll, believed to be the first ever used to plan cam paign strategy, was considered such a novety that The New York Herald Trib une published an editorial saying: This repre sents a considerable advance over the old torchlight proces sions, the streetcorner tub thumping and rabblerousing, which used to constitute the major weapons in a political campaign.

title: Church Bars Black Listener
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Oct. 4 (AP)  The Harbor Baptist Church of West Columbia re fused today to admit Negro minister who wanted to hear a speech by Gov. Lester G. Maddox of Georgia. Later, Mr. Maddox shook hands with the minister, the Rev. Arthur FitzRitson, but said he could do nothing about local church policy.

title: City U. Considering a WorkStudy Program
Airlines Nearing Accord On International Fares
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 4  After more than three weeks of de bate, delegates to a conference here appear near agreement on fares that will affect 105 mem ber airlines of the International Air Transport Association.

title: PAUL MACDONALD
description: DARIEN, Conn., Oct. 4Cir cuit Court Judge Paul Macdon ald died yesterday at his home, 5 Rabbit Lane. He was 61 years old. Judge Macdonald under went open heart surgery last July, and was on leave of ab sence.

title: Luncheon to Aid Cardiac Leagues
description: The Associated Cardiac Leagues, which maintain Sprout Lake Camp for Chil dren at Verbank, N.Y., will hold their biannual benefit luncheon on Oct. 14 at the Roof of the St. RegisShera ton.

title: ItalianAmericans, ItalianItalians
description: Departure for Italy from the East Sixties, one afternoon of early sum mer, was complicated by a parade of Americans of Italian descent march ing up Third Avenue to picket the F.B.I. They were protesting the carica turing of all ItalianAmericans as sec ondclass citizens, even as Mafiosi: as Wops, in facta word whose Neapoli tan original, guappo, is also a pejora tive.

title: CEN. LI TIENYU
description: HONG KONG, Monday, Oct. 5 (UPI)The Peking Radio an nounced today the death on Sept. 27 of Li TienYu, a dep uty chief of the general staff of the Communist Chinese armed forces. He was 57 years old.

title: 30,000 REGISTERED IN VOTER CAMPAIGN
description: More than 30,000 voters were registered in New York City on Saturday in what election of ficials described as a light turn out on the opening day of a threeday registration period.

title: Rabbi Named Provost of Yeshiva U.
description: The appointment or Dr. Emanuel Rackman, an Ortho dox rabbi, to the newly es tablished post of provost of Yeshiva University, was an nounced last night by Dr. Samuel Belkin, the president of the school.

title: Jordan Now Controlling Zeraa, Guerrilla Center
description: ZERQA, Jordan, Oct. 3The first Western correspondents to enter this battered city since Jordan's civil war began on Sept. 17 found it entirely in the grip of the army, with Pales tinian women bewailing the fate of men taken off to de tention camps.

title: Women Flee Nashville Jail
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Oct. 4 (AP)  Two women escaped from the women's prison in Nashville tonight after attend ing church services. The women, both maximum security prison ers, were identified by prison officials as Margo Freshwater, 23 years old, and Faye Cope land, 38.

title: Tanzanian SelfHelp Villages Crowded
description: KEREGE, Tanzania  We have too many people here, leader of Kerege Ujamaa Vil lage said. Everybody wants to join the ujamaas.

title: Samuel Riker Dies at 65; ExAide of Jersey Zinc
description: Samuel Riker, a member of an old New York family who retired as an officer and a di rector of the New Jersey Zinc Company at the end of 1965, died Wednesday in Mackay, Queensland, Australia, after a brief illness. Mr. Riker, who was 65 years old and lived in Tucker's Town, Bermuda, had been on a visit to Australia.

title: Paisley to Be in Australia During Visit of Pope Paul
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Oct. 4 (Reuter)  The Rev. Ian Paisley, the militant Northern Ireland Protestant leader, is to be invited to Australia at the same time as Pope Paul VI in Novemher.

title: Blast Near Field Marshal's House Alarms Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Oct. 4 The sounds of fighting were heard around the house of the com mander of Jordan's Army last night, a few hours before trucks appeared in Amman to ferry Arab commandos to new en campments in the countryside.

title: TV: Cable Viewers to See Powerful King Heroin
description: Storefront television? Neigh borhood television? Whatever one calls it, it's here. At 9 P.M. Wednesday the Tele prompter Corporation will present the season's first the atrical premiere on cable television. It is Al Fann's King Heroin, a lean and uncompromising study of the drug scene in Harlem.

title: SALT After Suez Missile Cheating
description: Moscow's violation of the missile standstill along the Suez Canal has thrown a somber shadow across all aspects of SovietAmerican relations. But in preparing for the third round of the strategic arms limitation talks (SALT), which opens in Helsinki four weeks from today, the White House insists that it remains cautiously optimistic. And recent press briefings have emphasized fundamental differ ences between the cheating at Suez and violations of a SALT agreement.

title: Football Scores
description: The following scores in volve teams not listed in the table below.

title: California Fire Toll Now 14
description: LOS ANGELES. Oct. 4 (AP) The death toll in California's brush and timber fires rose to 14 today with the finding of three bodies in a fireravaged area of San Diego County. The authorities said the unidenti fied victims might have been Mexican nationals caught in windwhipped flames that black ened nearly 200,000 acres near the United States border last week.

title: CHARLES RADO, 71, OF PHOTO AGENCY
description: Charles Rado, founder and president of the Rapho Gull lumette photographic agency, died yesterday at the New York University Medical Center of a heart attack. Mr. Rado, who was 71 years old, lived at 971 Lexington Avenue. His studio was at 59 East 54th Street.

title: Cambodian Hamlet Attacked
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 4 (Reuters)  Vietcong forces aboard sampans attacked a ply wood factory 16 miles southeast of here today, bringing their harassment on Route 1, which links Pnompenh and Saigon, closer to this capital.

title: Peter Guille, Silversmith And Art Curator, 59, Dies
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Oct. 4 (AP)Peter Guille, a retired New York silversmith and art curator, died at a hospital here yesterday after a long illness. He was 59 years old.

title: Oilers Top Bengals On Johnson's Pass In 4th Period, 2013
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 4 (AP) Charlie Johnson completed six passes for 77 yards in a fourth quarter, 80yard touchdown drive that brought the Houston Oilers a 2013 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals today. The winning pass traveled 28 yards to Alvin Reed.

title: Black Colleges Dissatisfied With Level of Federal Aid
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 4 (AP)The presidents of 36 Negro colleges said today that they were en couraged by the Nixon Adminis tration's progress in funding black schools, but were not yet, satisfied with the level of Fed eral support.

title: FALCONS WIN, 2120, AS 49ERS MISS KICK
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 4 (UPI)  Bruce Gossett missed a 19yard field goal with only three sec onds left today and the Atlanta Falcons were able to hold on for a 2120 victory over the San Francisco 49ers.

title: Budge to Speak Here
description: Hamer H. Budge, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, will address the annual report awards dinner on Oct 28 in the grand ballroom of the New York Hilton Hotel, it was announced yesterday by Richard J. Anderson, editor and publisher of the Financial World, which offers the awards each year.

title: KENNEDY BARS RACE FOR PRESIDENT IN '721
description: BOSTON, Oct. 4 (AP)Sena tor Edward M. Kennedy said to day on the National Broadcast ing Company's television pro gram Meet the Press that he would not seek the Presidency in 1972 because the uncertain ties of higher office would place a great burden on my family.

title: Hostages' Wives Waited Tensely For 4 Hours Outside Tombs
description: For four and a half hours last night the narrow, darkened streets that encircle the Tombs were permeated with successive waves of tension that emanated from tiers on the 11th floor of the jail where 17 hostages were being held.

title: Colson Wins College Tennis; Team Crown to Columbia
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Oct. 4 Bill Colson of Princeton suc cessfully defended his Division A single title today by beating Bob Odasz of Columbia, 60, 62, in the final of the Eastern College Athletic Conference fall tennis tournament.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: KIDNAPPING STIRS ANGER IN SARDINIA
description: NUORO, Sardinia, Oct. 4 Three hundred volunteers are helping strong police forces search the mountains south of here for a 56yearold woman kidnapped for ransom by ban dits last Tuesday.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The City University is con sidering the creation this year of a new academic degree tentatively called the bachelor of liberal artsto give stu dents greater freedom in de signing their own scholastic programs.

title: Chile's Christian Democrats Fail to Decide on Presidential Vote
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 4  A national convention of Chile's Christian Democratic party to day set aside, at least for now, political maneuvers that might keep Dr. Salvador Allende, Marxist, from becoming the country's President next month.

title: Snell Weeps in Locker Room; Fears Injury Ends His Career
description: BUFFALO. Oct. 4Almost symbolically, the only noise above the hushed voices in the Jets locker room was the hiss of water in the shower room.

title: SINGERS ENHANCE UN BALLO AT MET
description: The Metropolitan Opera came up with a winner on Saturday with its first per formance this season of Verdi's Un Ballo in Maschera. Al most all the singers were new to their roles with the com tany, but they produced a quantity of highlevel singing that brought rousing applause with cheers from the audience on several occasions.

title: Hayes, St. Francis Prep Win Openers
Israelis Plan Elections on West Bank
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 4 Israeli leaders indicated last week that they were formulating plans for elections in some towns of the occupied areas on the west bank of the Jordan River.

title: Giants and Jets Lose; Reds and Orioles Win
description: Football: The Giants and Jets both lost yesterday, the Giants bowing to the Saints at New Orleans, 1410, and the Jets dropping a 3431 decision to the Bills at Buf falo. (Page 60.)

title: Astronauts Meet in Germany
description: KONSTANZ. Germany, Oct. 4 (UPI)A United States astro naut, Col. James A. McDivitt of the Air Force, met with three Soviet astronauts today as more than 1.000 aerospace scientists and engineers assembled for the 21st International Astronautical Congress. Colonel McDivitt, who took part in the Gemini 4 and Apollo 9 missions, met his Soviet space colleagues aboard a Lake, Constance cruise ship, used as the press center for the congress.

title: NAPOLES AND TORO TO FIGHT TONIGHT
description: The Eastern debut of Jos (Mantequilla) Napoles of Mex ico City, the world welter weight champion, and the first flyweight (112 pounds) bout in Madison Square Garden (old or new) in 43 years will mark the Garden's boxing program tonight.

title: West Germany Enters Show
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 (AP) West Germany will compete in the Washington International Horse Show later this month for the first time since 1963. West Germany joins Ireland as the European representatives in the show.

title: U.S. Hopes to Begin Work Soon On Fast Atom Attack Warning
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 (AP) The Federal Government hopes to begin construction soon on a new fastwarning system to be used in the event of an enemy nuclear attack.

title: UMPIRES ACCEPT ORIGINAL TERMS
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 4Sup ported solidly by local labor unions, major league umpires reached a temporary agreement with baseball owners and re turned to work today. At the same time, however, they raised the threat of another strike at the World Series.

title: DR. LEONARD HARRIS
description: SPRINGFIELD, N. J., Oct. 4 Dr. Leonard Harris of 40 Cot tage Lane, an orthopedist, died yesterday at Overlook Hospital, Summit. He was 56 years old.

title: 2 Antinarcotics Programs Get $304,934 From State
description: ALBANY, Oct. 4Governor Rockefeller today announced awards totaling $304,934 to two institutions in New York City to finance antinarcotics programs.

title: Best & Company Closing Is Assayed by President
description: Which can provide a better returnretailing or real estate? Best & Company, the Fifth Ave nuebased specialty store chain due to cease operations after 91 years next month, is a casualty in the constant competition that exists in every company for the best use of funds.

title: JOHN HARRIS GIVES TOWN HALL RECITAL
description: During the better moments of his recital at Town Hall late Saturday afternoon, John Har ris sounded as though he might have had some experience in musical comedy singing. In songs in English, especially Ives's The Circus Band, the baritone's voice took on a focus it had lacked elsewhere, and that focus had the somewhat nasal quality commonly asso ciated with Broadway.

title: Mayor Waits for 2 Hours For Inmates to Respond
description: This is Mayor Lindsay speak ing to the men on the Tombs's 11th floor . . .

title: Eban Feels Mideast Truce Can Last Beyond 90 Days
description: Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel says he expects the Middle East ceasefire to extend beyond 90 days.

title: Ethnic Group Ties to Blacks Sought
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 4 An ef fort organized by the Roman Catholic Church is under way here to direct a newly awakened feeling of cultural identity among white ethnic Americans into a coalition with the urban black community.

title: U.S. Family Studies the Dyaks in Jungles of Borneo
description: KAMPONG PUEH, Malaysia, Sept. 26In this jungle village in northwestern Borneo, one mile from the South China Sea and eight miles from any road, Mary and William Schneider are living with their son, Dan iel, who is almost 3 years old, and about 600 Dyak tribesmen. Mr. Schneider is writing his doctoral dissertation on the Dyaks.

title: Cambodian Linguists Creating a Vocabulary to End the Long Reliance on French Words
Janis Joplin Dies; Rock Star Was 27
description: HOLLYWOOD, Oct. 4Janis Joplin, the rock singer, was found dead in her Hollywood apartment tonight. She was 27 years old.

title: Agreement Averts a Strike Against Frontier Airlines
description: DENVER, Oct. 4 (UPI) Frontier Airlines and the Air Lines Employees Association have reached agreement on a new contract, averting a strike scheduled for midnight tonight by 1,350 station reservation, ramp and ticket counter per sonnel.

title: Mr. Brewster Talks Back
description: The barnstorming trip currently being made by Kingman Brewster Jr., president of Yale University, is more than a fundraising routine; it is an effort to dramatize the American university crisis.

title: Gov. Burns wins Hawaii Democratic Primary Race
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 4  Gov. John A. Burns, who put to gether Hawaii's Democratic party organization 16 years ago, staved off a potentially divisive challenge by his Lieu tenant Governor to win nom ination to a third term in the primary election here yester day.

title: Ch. Killeshandra Is Judged Best at Irish Setter Show
description: ALLAIRE, N. J., Oct. 4  A 5yearold Irish setter, Ch. Kil leshandra Michael Seamus, won best of breed today at the Eastern Irish Setter Association specialty show.

title: Newsmen Honor Governor
description: Special to The New Tart Time GARDEN CITY, L. I., Oct. 4 The Nassau County Press Association, at its annual din ner tonight, presented its Grass Roots Award to Governor Rockefeller for his support of the state's freedom of informa tion bill for newsmen. The Gov ernor signed the bill into law this year. The law makes it possible for newsmen to keep The names of their sources of information confidential.

title: Marcuse Says Repression Has Intensified Under Nixon
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 4 (AP) Dr. Herbert Marcuse, often called the father of the New Left, says that repression of dissent has been intensified since the Nixon Administration took office. He predicts that the President will be reelected.

title: PH.D. CINEMA COURSE APPROVED FOR N.Y.U.
description: The first Ph.D. program In cinema has been approved at New York University by the New York State Board of Regents.

title: Two Share Golf Medal
description: Special to The New York Times

title: MRS. EDWARD P. M'GRORY
description: Mrs. Mary McGrory, mother of Mary McGrory, the Washing ton political columnist, died of a heart attack Saturday at Dea coness Hospital in Boston. She was 81 years old. Mrs. McGrory was the widow of Edward Pat rick McGrory, deputy superin tendent of the South Boston Post Office.

title: Salient Facts Given About 3d District
description: POPULATION: About 582, 000 (a growth of 120,000 in last decade) Broad economic background with large black populations in principal cities, Long Branch, Asbury Park and Freehold.

title: Three Explosions in Italy
description: TRENTO, Italy, Oct. 4 (AP) Bombs exploded today in three theaters in this northern Italian city, injuring one per son. Police were seeking leftist extremists for questioning.

title: Jumper Title to Traveller
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Presidium Endorses Plan
description: BELGRADE, Oct. 4 (AP)  The Presidum of the Yugoslav Communist party today en dorsed President Tito's proposal for reorganization of the na tion's top leadership. Speakers representing the Communist parties of all the Yugoslav re publics gave full support to Marshal Tito's proposal, and it was expected here that a for mal proposal for constitutional changes would be submitted to the federal parliament early in 1971.

title: McLuhan Calls Work on Media Lonely
description: TORONTO, Oct. 4 Marshall McLuhan, whose theories about communications have made him one of the most widely quoted Canadians ever, finds that be ing a metaphysician of the media is lonely work.

title: CANADA SEEKING A WIDER GAS ROLE
description: TORONTO, Oct. 4Addition al millions of cubic feet of Canadian natural gas, enough to heat hundreds of thousands of American homes, will begin flowing into the United States on Nov. 1.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
description: Oct. 5, 1970 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Miss Claudia Lichtblau Is Wed To Bruce L. Payne, Teacher
description: Miss Claudia Lichtblau, a student at Kirkland College in Clinton, N. Y., was mar ried here yesterday to Bruce L. Payne, an instructor of government at Kirkland and a doctoral candidate at Yale.

title: Eisenhowers Go Politicking
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 4 (UPI)  David and Julie Eisenhower spent several hours in Chi cago today campaigning for Joseph I. Woods, candidate for president of the Cook County Board. Mr. Woods's sister, Rosemary, is President Nixon's secretary.

title: POMPIDOU TO VISIT SOVIET TOMORROW
description: PARIS, Oct. 4  President Pompidou will begin an eight day visit to the Soviet Union Tuesday as part of a longstand ing French effort to maintain a balanced position between the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: Four Terrorist Bombings
description: SANTIAGO, Oct. 4 (AP) Terrorist bombings shook San tiago early today. Three blasts damaged the homes of two rightwing politicians and the facade of a bank. A fourth bomb exploded an oil drum in the city's main soccer stadium and caused no damage.

title: Brown U. Gets New President
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Oct. 4 (AP), Dr. Donald F. Hornig was inaugurated today as the 14th president of Brown Uni yersity.

title: Telephone Co. Will Give Scores Daring Playoffs
description: New York's baseball fans will get the latest scores of major league division play offs by dialing 6371212 the telephone company's time bureau.

title: Chess
description: Among the highest rated players in the world, Grand master Svetozar Gligoric of Yugoslavia is near the top. That he is an entertaining and informative writer, how ever, is not well known. His first book in English ap peared in this country from the David McKay Company of New York. The title is Se lected Chess Masterpieces, a stimulating compendium of 45 modern games.

title: SNOW STARS AS RAMS TOP CHARGERS, 3710
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 4 (UPI) Jack Snow caught two touch down passes today and the Los Angeles defenders intercepted four passes as the Rams over whelmed the San Diego Charg ers, 3710, for their third straight victory.

title: Day's Developments In City Jail Crisis
description: Following is a summary of rioting in four houses of de tention and a reformatory:

title: Munich's Oktoberfest Draws Record Crowds
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Oct. 4 (AP)Oktoberfest, the world's biggest beer festival, ended today and police in the Bavarian capital said they counted a record of six million visitors during the 16day event.

title: Navy Magazine Destroyed To Prevent Embarassment
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Oct. 4 (AP)  The Navy destroyed about 10,000 copies of its CruiserDestroyerman magazine to prevent embarassment over a mistaken identification of a ship in its July issue, according to reports published today.

title: ALFRED DASHIELL, JOURNALIST, DIES
description: CROTONONHUDSON, N.Y., Oct. 4  Alfred Sheppard Dashiell, former managing edi tor of Scribner's Magazine and The Reader's Digest, died yes terday of a heart attack at his home at Franklin Avenue. He was 69 years old.

title: Three Biologists to Share $25,000 Prize From Columbia
description: Columbia University an nounced yesterday the award to three biologists of the fourth annual Louisa Gross Horwitz Prize for important contribu tions to our knowledge of the function and fine structure of cells.

title: 3 Candidates Views Similar in Jersey's 3d District
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Oct. 4 A threeman race for the House of Representatives in New Jersey's Third Congressional District, made up of Monmouth County plus one Middlesex County township and three townships of Ocean County, has stirred little more than gentle ripples of voter interest.

title: Two Israelis Killed by Mine
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Moody's Fund Vote
description: Dun & Bradstreet, Inc., an nounced yesterday that 1,549, 249 shares of Moody's Capital Fund, Inc., had been voted in favor of its proposal to sell the management rights of the fund to Vance, Sanders &. Co., Inc., another fund manager. A spokesman said this was 66,202 shares more than the minimum needed.

title: Malaysia Says She Is Ready To Recognize Red China
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Oct. 4 (Reuters)Malaysia an nounced today that she was ready to establish relations with Communist China as part of an effort to bolster the neutrality of Southeast Asia.

title: PRESIDENT MEETS BRUCE AND HABIB ON VIETNAM AIMS
description: KNOCKLONG, Ireland, Oct.  President Nixon conferred privately today with David K. E. Bruce and Philip C. Habib, his two negotiators at the Paris peace talks.

title: 48 Died at Nasser Funeral
description: CAIRO, Oct. 4 (Reuters) Fortyeight persons died in Cairo and other Egyptian cities during mass demonstrations which accompanied President Gamal Abdel Nasser's funeral Thursday.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SOCIAL CON'TRACT. A Personal Inquiry Into the Evolutionary Sources of Order and Disorder. By Robert Ardrey. With drawings by Berdine Ardrey. 405 pages. Atheneum. $10.

title: Auto Talks Focus On Local Matters Blocking Main Pact
description: DETROIT, Oct. 4 (UPI)  In tensive efforts to work out local settlements that are hold ing up bargaining on a national agreement between the United Auto Workers and the General Motors Corporation continued today, the 20th day of the auto motive strike.

title: British Football
description: RUGBY LEAGUE

title: The Bank That Tells It Like It Is
description: As of now only the readers of yesterday's New Bruns wick (N.J.) Home News know that they've got themselves a bank that tells it like it is. None of this friend stuff. And none of this youcancallusIrving firstname familiarity.

title: YUGOSLAVS PLAN ROTATION OF RULE
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 4An authoritative Communist official announced here today that the collective presidency that Marshal Tito has proposed as his eventual successor would be headed by a different man each year.

title: Leaders in Cairo Reported Opposing Strongman Rule
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 4 Reports are circulating in sev eral quarters that a number of powerful figures in the Govern ment of the United Arab Repub lic, some little known abroad because they have avoided the limelight, are trying to prevent, the quick emergence or any single strongman who would succeed to the power and posi tion of President Gamal Abdel Nasser.

title: Patricia A. Kilcullen Bride of A.H. Birdsall
description: NEW VERNON, N. J., Oct. 4Miss Patricia Agnes Kil cullen and Alfred H. Birdsall were married here yesterday in the Roman Catholic Church of Christ the King by the Rev. John F. Carr.

title: Personal Finance: Painless Transfers
description: Despite the sluggishness of the economy, an estimated 400,000 persons  mostly young executives on their way upwill pull up stakes this year and move to a new community at company ex pense.

title: NEW BAND HELPS JOHNNY WINTER
description: If the recent blues revival served only to unearth Johnny Winter and his various associ ates, it might have been worth it for that alone.

title: Dispute Continues on Popular Election of Judges
description: The election of judges to fill vacancies in Supreme, Civil, and Surrogate courts in New York State next month comes at a time when the courts, their administration, and the system of judicial elections are all under attack.

title: CARDS TURN BACK COWBOYS BY 207
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 4 (AP) Jim Hart, who was booed for inept passing in the first half, pierced the Dallas Cowboys defense for two touchdowns in three plays today in lead ing the St. Louis Cardinals to a 207 triumph.

title: Leaders Plan Assembly
description: CAIRO, Oct. 4 (Reuters) The Cabinet met today to dis cuss problems facing Egypt, and Mohammed Labib Shukair, Speaker of the National Assem bly, conferred with regional groupings on setting a date to convene the 360member legis lative body.

title: Records of College Football Teams for This Season and Schedules of Their Remaining Games
Most Students at Kent State Agree With the Panel's Report
description: KENT, Ohio, Oct. 4 (UPI) Students at Kent State Univer sity agreed today that a Presi dential commission report ex pressed their general feeling about the slayings of four stu dents by National Guardsmen on the campus last May 4. A few denied that the students should share the blame.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: NOTICE OF 97th CONSECUTIVE QUARTERLY DIVIDEND

title: SmallTown Pitcher, A BigTown Hitter Do the Job for Reds
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 4A pair of Cincinnati Reds from such distant and contrasting points as Lynn, Ky., and Los Angeles sent the Pitts burgh Pirates to the brink of elimination in the National Leazue playoffs today.

title: Landlords Reminded of DataRequest Deadline
description: Landlords who need a city history of their lease increases were reminded yesterday to have requests postmarked by midnight on Wednesday if they want rent increases under the new rentcontrol law retro active to Aug. 1.

title: Kinfolk Hail Mrs. Nixon
description: BALLINROBE, Ireland, Oct. 4 (AP)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon found. more cousins than I knew about today on a Sunday morning tour of the Irishhomeland of her grand parents. She was greeted with tears of excitement, gifts of crystal vases, a cup of Irish tea and homemade raisin bread.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetIng for the week follows:

title: Michigan Primary Candidates Stress Being Nice, Leaving Challengers Little to Attack
description: DETROIT, Oct. 4  After years of political sturm and drang the nice guys are inherit ing Michigan politics.

title: BALTIMORE WINS FROM TWINS, 113
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Oct. 4The Baltimore Orioles saved their sevenrun inning until the ninth today, after nursing a 43 lead from the fourth inning on, and took an Iron grip on their second straight American League championship by beat ing the Minnesota Twins, 113.

title: DOROTHY V. SMITH
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Collectors Are at Home in Folk Art Setting
description: WILTON, Conn.  The 18thcentury farmers who built Stewart E. Greg ory's weathered barn and the Howard Lipmans' red clapboard farmhouse here, would certainly not recognize the in teriors of these buildings today.

title: Conclusion of the Commission's Report on Kent State
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4  Following is the text of the conclusion of The Kent State Tragedy, a special in vestigative report released today by the President's Commission on Campus Un rest:

title: Fulbright Assails Reports Of Submarine Base on Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 (UPI)  Senator J. W. Fuibright, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, charged today that the Administration was hoodwinking the Ameri can people by warning of pos sible construction of a Soviet submarine base in Cuba. He also said there was little doubt that the United States maintains nuclear weapons at sites bordering the Soviet Union.

title: ExHead of Ohio College Sued for Libel by Trustee
description: WILBERFORCE, Ohio, Oct. 4 The former president of Cen tral State University, who was dismissed Sept. 10 after his board of trustees refused to ac cept his resignation, has been named defendant in a $500,000 libel suit.

title: Fittipaldi, a Rookie, Wins U.S. Grand Prix in LotusFord
TOMBS PRISONERS FREE 17 AS MAYOR WARNS OF FORCE; TWO OTHER JAILS RETAKEN
description: The city began crushing the fourday prisoner rebellion in the municipal jails yesterday, retaking prisons in Brooklyn and Kew Gardens by force in the morning and the Manhattan House of Detention peaceably last night under a mayoral ulti matum that freed 17 hostages.

title: Month of College Football: Ivies Gain Strength, Power Shifts in Southeast
description: If the first four weeks of the college football season may be used as a yardstick, signifi cant changes have taken shape for the sport in the new decade.

title: BIG BOARD TO SHUN TOTALAID STAND
COLTS TURN BACK PATRIOTS BY 146
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 4 (UPI)Touchdown passes by Earl Morrall in the second quar ter and John Unitas in the final two minutes gave the Baltimore Colts a 146 victory over the Boston Patriots today.

title: Not a People, Not a Nation
description: The United states should now de dare its support for the establishment by Palestinians of a sovereign state of Palestine. It should make clear its intent to enlist the cooperation of other states, Israel and Jordan in par ticular, and indicate its readiness to underwrite the new state with sub stantial aid.

title: 1,000 March in Dublin Protest
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Miss Twiss Fiancee Of James Dickovick
description: VERGENNES, Vt., Oct. 4 Mr. and Mrs. A. Robert Twiss have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Deborah Jeanne Twiss, to James Gary Dickovick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence E. Dickovick, of Glen Cove, L. I.

title: U.S. Admiral Tours Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Oct. 4  Adm. John S. McCain, the United States commander in the Pa cific, toured Cambodian military installations today and attended a luncheon in his honor given by Premier Lon Nol.

title: JAMES WARNER, 79, EARLY OCEAN FLIER
description: HAYWARD, Calif., Oct. 4 (AP)James W. Warner, last surviving member of the first plane journey across the Pacific Ocean, died Thursday at the Livermore Veterans Administra tion Hospital. He was 79 years old.

title: Lynn Barwell Becomes Bride
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Oct. 4The marriage of Miss Lynn Barwell to Roger John Padwe, son of the late Mrs. Margaret Padwe French and the late Walter W. Padwe, both of New York, took place here today. Rabbi Lawrence Schwartz performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs Basil B. Barwell, parents of the bride.

title: CommunistLed Government Takes Power in Indian State
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 4 (AP) A Communistled government, supported by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Congress par ty, assumed power today in Kerala state.

title: Packers Triumph, 13 to 10, Over. Vikings as Hampton Scores on a 101Yard Kickoff Return
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 4  The Green Bay Packers wheeled out aging Bart Starr today, aching ribs and all, and the 36year old quarterback reached back for yesteryear's skill and cour age in County Stadium.

title: Union Backs Health Program
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 4 (AP) The American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employes urged Congress to day to enact a comprehensive program of national health insurance and health security.

title: 14 Spaniards Drown
description: LA CORUNA, Spain, Oct. 4 (AP)Fourteen crewmen of the Spanish fishing boat Laisla were feared drowned when the craft sank today, port authori ties reported. One crew mem ber hung onto a chunk of wood for more than six hours and was rescued.

title: BRONCOS TRIUMPH OVER CHIEFS, 2613
description: STATISTICS OF THE GAME

title: SOLUTION CAPTURES DENMARK CUP RACE
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Oct. 4 Thor Ramsing's 50foot sloop, Solution, out of the Indian Har bor Yacht Club in Greenwich, won the Denmark Cup on Long Island Sound today. The annual StamfordDenmark Friendship Race was held off the Stamford Y. C.

title: Meadowbrook Poloists Beat Bethpage in Final, 9 to 3
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Oct. 4 Alan Corey 3d scored six goals to lead the Meadowbrook polo team to a 93 victory over Bethpage today at Bethpage State Park in the final of Shaw W. Robinson memorial tourna ment.

title: Taxes Too High, Mayor Planning to Leave Jersey
description: UPPER FREEHOLD TOWN SHIP, N. J., Oct. 4Mayor Walter Polhemus of this Mon mouth County community, un like most citizens, is doing more than merely complaining about high taxes. He is moving out of the state.

title: ORDERS FOR STEEL FEEL AUTO STRIKE
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 4Order rates of steel mills continue to lag.

title: Shultz Forced to Campaign Sidelines
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4  When the White House was planning its 1970 Congres sional campaign strategy, a major role was supposed to have gone to George P. Shultz, director of the new Office of Management and Budget. The former Secretary of Labor was popular among many labor lead ers, a significant factor in the Re publican appeal to blue  collar Democrats to support the Nixon Admini stration. He was also re garded as a logical spokes man for the White House in disputing Democratic cam paign charges that the Presi dent's economic policies were producing inflation and re cession.

title: Indians on Reservations in State Are at Odds on Goals
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y. A newly created legislative subcommittee looking into the problems of Indians on the reservations in the state is finding that there are deep divisions among the Indians over how the problems should be met. Generally, these fac tions can be labeled as fol lows:

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
A Palestinian Solution
description: The hiatus in efforts to promote a comprehensive Middle East peace settlement caused by the death of Egypt's President Nasser and by continuing uncer tainty in Jordan should not forestall all attempts to break the ArabIsraeli deadlock.

title: MRS. CARLL PROUTY
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Oct. 4 Mrs. Mabel S. Prouty, widow of Carll R. Prouty, died yester day in a nursing home in Somers, N. Y. Mrs. Prouty, a Bronxville resident for 38 years, lived at 1440 Midland Avenue. She was 82 years old.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Theater

title: They Go on Shopping Spreesfor Other Women's Clothes
News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, OCTOBER 5, 1970

title: ALEX LESNOR
description: Alex Lesnor of 25 East 83d Street, president of Carillon Im porters, Ltd., 745 Fifth Avenue, distributors of wines, liqueurs and spirits, died yesterday in a nursing home here after a long illness.

title: Advertising
description: Jerry Firestone, the media director of Richard K. Man off, Inc., thinks he's come up with a new way of using media buying services. As a matter of fact, he's already tried it and so far he likes it.

title: Signs Accuse the Vatican Of
description: ROME, Oct. 4 (AP)Placards accusing the Vatican of terror ism and votebuying in its fight against divorce in Italy ap peared today at the edge of St. Peter's Square during Pope Paul's noon blessing of the crowd.

title: Inmates Flee Oklahoma Jail
description: MIAMI, Okla., Oct. 4 (AP) Seven prisoners in the Ottawa County jail overpowered a jail ler early today and escaped, car rying knives taken from the kitchen. The jailer was not in jured. Deputy Sheriff H.C. Klaus said most of the prisoners were dangerous.

title: 100 LEAD LOST AT NEW ORLEANS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 4Fail ure, wretched failure, follows the Giants wherever they go. They lost another lead today and their third straight game, 1410, to the hometown Saints, who had not previously won.

title: Lincoln Hall Ball Is Set for Oct. 23
description: The sixth annual Lincoln Hall Ball will be held in the Grand Ballroom of the Pierre on Oct. 23. The dinner dance will follow a cocktail recep tion in the Garden Foyer.

title: Abrams Out of Hospital
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 4 (UPI)  Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, United States com mander in Vietnam, left the hospital today to return to duty, spokesmen announced. He became dizzy during an Australian military ceremony last Wednesday and entered the hospital. The general is 56 years old.

title: Profits at Fedders Hit a New High
F.T.C. SEIZES BERETS RATED FIRE HAZARDS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 The Federal Trade Commission ordered today the seizure of 6,000 women's and children's Italianmade berets as danger ously flammable. But Federal agents found only 96 left in a New Jersey warehouse.

title: Headless Body Found Upstate
description: FLEISHMANNS, N. Y., Oct. 5 (AP)The, State Police said today that troopers had found the headless body of an uniden tified woman last night near this village, 31 miles northwest of Kingston

title: MassMutual Sets Offering Of $100Million for Today
description: MassMutual Mortgage Realty Investors, a newly formed real estate investment trust, is ex pected to raise $100million to day through the sale of $50 million of 20year convertible debentures and 2.5 million shares of beneficial interest.

title: Manhattan Marine Killed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) The Pentagon today identified eight servicemen as having been killed in the war in South east Asia, including Pfc. Ignacio Montero of Manhattan, a member of Marine Corps.

title: Adams, Blaming Governor, Predicts Big Budget Deficit
description: Dr. Paul L. Adams, Con servative party candidate for Governor, predicted yesterday that the next Governor of New York would find the state saddled with a $1billion budget deficit.

title: Advertising: Ford's Pinto Goes to College
description: The Detroit crowd has long been interested in win ning hearts on the college campus. After all, that's where many present and fu ture car buyers are.

title: U.S. Troop Strength Drops
description: SAIGON, Oct. 5 (Reuters) United States troop strength in South Vietnam fell by 3,900 men last week, with 390,200 servicemen in the country as of Thursday, the United States command said today.

title: Ta Wee Wins Sprint With Record 142 Pounds
description: Not a bad filly. That was the outrageously facetious comment at Belmont Park yesterday after Tartan Stable's Ta Wee made racing history by winning the $27,100 Interborough Handicap under 142 pounds.

title: Honeywell to Lay Off 300
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (AP)About 300 technical workers and en gineers at Honeywell, Inc., will be laid off in Billerica, Waltham and Framingham in the next few days, the company said today. The layoffs came as result of a merger with the General Electric Company's computer manufacturing divi sion Sept. 18, a sopkesman said. The merger involved more than 8,000 employes.

title: V.F.W. Selects Minneapolis
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Oct. 5 (AP)The national council of. administration of the Veterans of Foreign Wars of the United States voted today to award the 1972 national convention to Minneapolis.

title: UNIONS PRESSING ALLENDE'S CAUSE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 5 The Communistled Chilean La bor Confederation has been explaining to nervous business men the aims of a leftist gov ernment that would include Chile's Communist party, and warning against attempts to, block such a government.

title: Irwin Dubrow, 39, Dead; Operator of Cafeterias
description: Irwin M. Dubrow, a cafeteria operator, died yesterday at his office, 515 Seventh Avenue. He was 39 years old and lived at 35 Winding Way, Woodcliff Lake, N. J.

title: Periodic Tests Are Vetoed
description: Gov. Lester Maddox of Georgia vetoed a bill that would have required vision examinations and tests on rules of the road every tour years for drivers, the magazine Fleet Owner re ports. Similar bills have failed in New York and Kentucky.

title: Barclays Plans to Form A New Banking Unit Here
description: Barclays Bank of London which heads the largest bank ing group in the world outside the United Statesplans to start a new banking subsidiaryin New York City. Barclays Bank D.C.O., a Barclays sub sidiary that operates largely outside of Britain, last week filed with the State Banking Department a notice of inten tion to organize Barclays Bank of New York.

title: Ohio State Widens Lead Over SecondPlace Texas in Football Poll
description: Topranked Ohio State wid ened its lead over Texas in the weekly Associated Press college football poll made public yes terday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Muskie Urges Strict Rules To Curb Industrial Pollution
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (AP)Sena tor Edmund S. Muskie, Demo crat of Maine, said today that the country must deal with the problems of industrial pol lution with businesslike preci sion, with fixed targets and with tough performance stand ards.

title: Winning in Jersey's 4th Requires Wide Appeal
description: TRENTON, Oct. 5An all out effort to defeat a Democrat with a liberal voting record has marked the Republican drive in New Jersey's Fourth Congres sional District, an area that combines urban, suburban and rural characteristics.

title: FUTURES PRICES RISE FOR GRAINS
description: Fears that the 1970 corn crop would not meet the nation's needs continued to haunt the grain and soybean futures pits at the Chicago Board of Trade and buying was heavy, sending prices upward yesterday.

title: Duty of Press to Theaters Examined by Drama Desk
description: How Can the Press Better Serve the Theater and Theater going Readers? was the sub ject of discussion yesterday at a meeting of the Drama Desk, the organization of theater writers and editors, held in the Belasco Room of Sardi's Reg taurant.

title: Rumanian Chiefto Visit U.S. in October
LONDON MARKET IN UPWARD MOVE
description: Prices on the London stock exchange moved ahead yester day in moderately active trad ing. Sentiment was helped by Friday's strength on Wall Street.

title: 91Day Rate Climbs to 6.025% At Week's Treasury Bill Sale
Napoles Stops Toro at 2:32 of Ninth Round in Welterweight Bout at Garden
800,000 HERE BUY U.S. FOOD STAMPS
description: About 800,000 persons, main ly relief recipients, bought $17,726,036 in food stamps here during September, the first month of the city's participa tion in the national food stamp program.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: WINIFRED B. CLARK
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Oct. 5Winifred Bartlett Clark, a poet, author and landscape painter, died of a heart ail ment Sept. 18 in a hospital here. She was 79 years old and lived on Fishers Island, N. Y.. and in Greenwich, Conn.

title: Cambodia to Become a Republic Friday
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 5 The Cambodian Parliament voted unanimously today to proclaim the nation a republic on Friday.

title: SADAT IS CHOSEN BY EGYPT'S PARTY TO BE PRESIDENT
description: CAIRO, Oct. 5  Acting President Anwar Sadat has been recommended to succeed Gamal Abdel Nasser as the new leader of Egypt, it was an nounced here tonight.

title: Hero of Youth in Vietnam Assails War
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 5Trinh Cong Son, a guitarist and composer whose antiwar songs have made him a heroic figure to many young Vietnamese, expects the war to stretch on and on.

title: Market Summary
description: Monday, Oct. 5, 1970

title: Death of Janis Joplin Attributed To Accidental Heroin Overdose
description: I'd rather not sing than sing quiet. The words are those of Janis Joplin, the raspyvoiced rock singer who was found dead in her Hollywood hotel apartment Sunday night of what a coroner has determined to be an acci dental overdose of heroin.

title: Symington Confident of Success In Heavily Democratic Missouri
description: HANNIBAL, Mo., Oct. 4 Senator Stuart Symington climbed onto the Victorian bandstand in this old Missis sippi River town last night still handsome at 69 years of age, still so slim that he wears suit jackets with no vents, con fident almost to the point of cockiness, the picture of a man for whom success is a habit.

title: CURTIS M. TURNER, RACING DRIVER, 46
description: PUNXSUTAWNEY, Pa., Oct. 5 (UPI) Curtis M. Turner, an auto racing driver, was killed yesterday in a crash of his private plane in Bell Township .near here. He was 46 years old and lived in Roanoke, Va.

title: Unbeaten W. Virginia First In Lambert Trophy Voting
description: West Virginia, which re mained undefeated through four games by beating Indiana, 1610, last Saturday received all eight firstplace votes for 80 points to lead the second week of balloting for the Lam bert Trophy, that goes to the outstanding major college foot ball team in the East.

title: MICHAEL J. QUINLAN
description: Michael J. Quinlan, an elec trician in the engineering de partment of The New York Times since 1965, died yester day. He was 62 years old and lived at 649 Palisade Avenue, Jersey City.

title: CORPORATE BONDS SHOW A RATE RISE
description: Interest rates rose yesterday on corporate bonds and they declined on taxexempt bonds as investment bankers tried to assess the strength of demand for this week's new issues.

title: Agnew Indirectly Endorses Buckley at Luncheon Here
News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, OCTOBER 6. 1970

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Sept. 29.

title: Reds 11 10 Choice in Series
description: LAS VEGAS, Oct. 5 (AP) Cincinnati is an 1110 favorite to beat Baltimore in the World Series and 1110 to take the first game, according to Jimmy (The Greek) Snyder, Las Vegas oddsmaker.

title: SETON HALL STUDENT KILLS SELF BY FIRE
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J. Tues day, Oct. 6 (AP) A 19yearold prelaw student at Seton Hall University died today after he apparently set himself afire.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE IN AMEX TRADING
description: The American Stock Ex change continued to move along the comeback trail yesterday as most stocks advanced in brisk trading.

title: Brooklyn Man, 67, 3d Victim in Series Of Knife Slayings
description: A 67yearold man was stabbed to death in downtown Brooklyn early yesterday, be coming the third victim in a series of what the police termed senseless stabbings.

title: Marta Milinowski, Pianist And Vassar Professor, 85
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Oct. 5  Marta Milinowski, profes sor emeritus of music at Vassar College, died of a heart ail ment yesterday in a hospital here. She was 85 years old and lived on the Vassar campus.

title: Yugoslav ExKing Peter III
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 5 (UPI) Former King Peter II of Yugoslavia was reported in critical condition today, suffer ing from pneumonia. The con dition of the 47yearold ex monarch has ranged from fair to critical in the past week in a hospital. Peter became the nominal King of Yugoslavia at the age of 11 when his father, Aleaxnder I, was assassinated. He fled to London when Ger man troops overran his coun try in April, 1941.

title: National Gallery In Capital Fills Expansion Posts
description: The National Gallery of Art in Washington, which will break ground for a new build ing next spring, has announced three major staff appointments to man its expanding facilities. Effective Jan. 1, the gallery nas named Charles P. Parkhurst, di rector of the Baltimore Mu seum of Art, assistant director; Dr. Konrad Oberhuber, a cu rator of the Albertina Museum in Vienna, research curator for the graphic arts department; and Dr. Alessandro Contini Bonacossi, art historian and Renaissance scholar, director of a new photographic archive.

title: Scientists in Varied Fields Join In Attacking National Problems
description: The use of large teams of scientists from different disci plines, brought together under Federal funding, is emerging as a new approach to basic scien tific research on matters of pressing national concern.

title: Catalyst for Scientific Research
description: When William David Mc Elroy talks about his first love in science  the bio chemistry of fireflies, phos phorescence and other such creatures that blink, glow and flash in the nighthis face lights up with enthu siasm. As director of the National Science Foundation, he is responsible for funding much basic research in this country as well as convinc ing Congress to foot the bill. But, Dr. Mc Elroy, an advocate of the interdisciplinary approach to solving problems, says rue fully that he has not had much time lately to devote to his scientific projects.

title: Frelinghuysen Favored Over Vigorous Democratic Foe in Jersey's Fifth District
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J. Oct. 5 A young, earnest, liberal Democrat is challenging an ex perienced, moderate Repub lican incumbent in New Jer sey's historic Fifth Congression al District, and the suspense is bearable; the incumbent is expected to win again as he has since 1952. Consisting of Mor ris and Somer set counties, 774 square miles of rolling country side blending rural estates, new industry and expanding suburbia, the centrally located Fifth has become one of the most steadfastly Republican districts in the state.

title: GUNTHREAT SUSPECT RELEASED FOR TRIAL
description: A man accused of trying to shoot a Housing Authority patrolman was released in his own recognizance yesterday in Brooklyn Criminal Court.

title: OTTINGER KEEPING HIS EYE ON AGNEW
description: Campaigning among the fear ful aged of Manhattan and the disquieted middle class of Long Island, Representative Richard L. Ottinger was distracted much of yesterday by Vice President Agnew's visit to New York.

title: ISRAEL ACCUSES U.A.R. OF TORTURE
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 5Israeli authorities charged today that the United Arab Republic had tortured an Israeli airman to death and then tried to conceal the wounds before returning his body.

title: Lindsay Speaks in Buffalo for Goodell
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 5  Mayor Lindsay flew here today to campaign for the election of Senator Charles E. Goodell to a full sixyear term and he car ried the feud between Vice President Agnew and the in cumbent Senator with him.

title: Treasury Statement
description: Special to The New York Times

title: ExChief of Biafra Says He Is Still Ready to Fight
ALFRED J. SWAN, 79, TEACHER OF MUSIC
description: HAVERFORD, Pa.. Oct. 5 Alfred J. Swan, former head of the music department at Haverford College. composer and author of works on music history, died Friday at his home here of a stroke. He was 79 years old.

title: STRIKE SCHEDULED AT THE POST TODAY
description: Negotiators for The New York Post and the Newspaper Guild sought last night to work out an agreement that would avert a strike threatened for today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 5If the brighter minds in baseball had plotted their new fangled postseason play with sufficient foresightedness, they would have inserted the proper ingredients of high drama into the script. But they let the boys adlib it and the actors raced through each show as if they were afraid the curtain would come tumbling down atop them.

title: Elizabeth Shires Engaged to Wed Walter Maguire
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 5  The Rev. Dr. and Mrs. Henry Millis Shires have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Millis Shires, to Ens. Walter Terry Maguire, U.S.C.G., son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Wyatt Maguire of Huntington, L. I.

title: Lebanese Leader Denies Entry To Iraqi Plane With Guerrillas
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 5A plane with guerrillas from Iraq was turned back at Beirut air port today In an unusual dis play of toughness by the new President of Lebanon, Suleiman Franjieh.

title: DR. GEORGE A. SELKE, AGRICULTURE EXPERT
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Oct. 5 (AP) Dr. George A. Selke, an edu cator who served under both Democratic and Republican na tional administrations, died Fri day in a Portland rehabilitation hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: Executive Changes
description: J. Paul Lyet has been elected executive vice presi dent and a director of the Sperry Rand Corporation.

title: Benefit for Cancer Center
description: The Junior Committee of the Society of Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Cen ter is sponsoring a supper dance on Thursday at the Spanish Institute, 684 Park Avenue.

title: National Conference
description: EASTERN DIVISION

title: Laird Assigns a High Priority To Modernizing Greek Forces
description: ATHENS, Oct. 5Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird of the United States said today that the modernization of the Greek armed forces had a high priority in current efforts to improve the strength of the At lantic alliance.

title: Quebec Separatists Kidnap British Aide
description: MONTREAL, Tuesday, Oct. 6 James Richard Cross, the senior British consular officer in Quebec Province, was ab ducted at gunpoint from his home yesterday by French Canadian separatists.

title: Forget Me Not Ball on L.I. Oct. 17
description: GARDEN CITY, LI., Oct. 5  The Committee of One Hundred, comprising Long Is land social, business and com munity leaders, is working on plans for the 18th annual For get Me Not Ball on Oct. 17. It will benefit the Nassau Cerebral Palsy Treatment Center at Roosevelt.

title: Miss Dolecka Wed To Arthur P. Dodge
description: The marriage of Miss Mary sia Nina Dolecka to Arthur Parrish Dodge, a descendant of Commodore Cornelius Van derbilt, took place here on Saturday. Civil Court Judge Pelham St. George Bissell 3d performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Washington Dodge, parents of the bridegroom.

title: Bomb Explodes at College
description: BLUEFIELD, W. Va., Oct. 5 (AP)A bomb exploded in a men's rest room at Bluefield State College today, causing extensive damages but no re ported injuries, the state police reported.

title: Where Other Schools Failed, This One Works
description: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y.  I was a dropout for nine months  actually it was closer to two years because I wasn't doing well in school before that, Pete Pizzutiel lo, a cleancut 17yearold from New Rochelle, said re cently between classes.

title: EXHIBITION BASKETBALL
description: MONDAY'S GAMES

title: ABACUS FUND HITS ROYAL BANK LOANS
description: The Abacus Fund, Inc., a closedend investment company that owns 24.9 per cent of the Security National Bank, Hunt ington, L. I., charged yesterday that last year approximately onefifth of the loans at the Royal National Bank lacked satisfactory credit data. Aba cus has been opposing a pro posal that Security merge with the Manhattanbased Royal.

title: Police Act in Sierra Leone
description: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone, Oct. 5 (Reuters)The police said tonight that they had oc cupied the town of Port Loko, 38 miles to the northeast, be cause politial violence broke out there yesterday. A state of emergency was declared Sept. 14 when tension built up after the resignation of two cabinet ministers.

title: Governor Posts Cup For State's Top Club
description: Governor Rockefeller will award a Governor's Cup to the New York State pro foot ball team with the best won lost record this season.

title: Times and Chicago News Services to Share a Wire
description: The New York Times and The Chicago Daily News and Sun Times announced plans yester day for the joint distribution of their respective news services on a shared, 24hour, nation wide news wire.

title: Couve Is Off to Peking
description: PARIS, Oct. 5 (Reuters)  Former Premier Maurice Couve de Murville left today for Pe king on a private visit at a develop when France is striving to develop her links with Com munist China. Mr. Couve de Murville, who now holds no of ficial post, plans to spend three weeks in China.

title: Hesburgh Says Universities Face Crisis of Confidence
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Oct. 5 (AP)The Rev. Theodore M. Hesburgh, president of the Uni versity of Notre Dame more than 18 years, told his faculty today that American universi ties face an unprecedented crisis of public confidence.

title: Parsons Group Sells Block Of Cleveland Bank Shares
description: DETROIT, Oct. 5 (Reuters) The Parsons group of Michigan investors sold today a block of 34,000 shares of Commerce Bank of Cleveland out of a total 492,503 shares of the bank held by the group.

title: Market Place:
description: ROCHESTER, Oct. 5Has the space age brought rich technical dividends to the economy? Not recently, said Jacob E. Goldman, the Xerox Corporation's senior vice president for research and development, in an inter view today.

title: C.I.T. Announces Lease
description: The C. I. T. Leasing Corpora tion anounced yesterday its lease of 19 locomotives and 1,576 freight cars valued at $35million to the Southern Pacific Transportation Com pany.

title: Shipments of Mobile Homes Climbed Slightly in August
description: Shipments of mobile homes edged up during August from the level a year earlier, the Mobile Homes Manufacturers Association reported yesterday.

title: Seoul Reports Basic Accord With the U.S. on Arms Aid
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 5 A top South Korean military official said today that the United States and South Korea had reached substantial agree ment on a program to modern ize Seoul's armed forces to offset the planned cutback of American forces in this country.

title: Shrinking Bride Set Nov.23
description: The Shrinking Bride, a comedy by Jonathan Levy, with songs by William Bolcom, will open on Nov. 23 at the Mercury Theater. 134 East 13th Street. Phil Foster will be starred. David Margulies has been signed by John Fink and Tony Capodilupo, the producers, to direct.

title: Amex Names Governor
description: The American Stock Ex change announced yesterday that George Reichhelm, a stock specialist and partner in L.D. Babcock & Co., had been named to the exchange's board of governors to fill a vacancy cre ated by the resignation of Ed win J. Wheeler. Mr. Reichhelm, 36 years old, will act as a floor governor following the ex change's next annual election in Februray.

title: Redemptions Top Sales Of U.S. Savings Bonds
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI)United States savings bond redemptions exceeded sales by more than $25mil lion last month for the 21st time of the last 22 months in which savers made net with drawals, the Treasury re ported today.

title: Debate on Divorce Will Begin Today In Italian Senate
description: ROME, Oct 5 As the Italian Senate prepares for a decisive debate on a bill that would in troduce divorce in Italy, groups favoring divorce are charging that unethical pressures are be ing brought to bear to influ ence some Senators.

title: High Court Convenes New Term And Admits 45 More Lawyers
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Chief Justice Warren E. Burger opened the 1970 Supreme Court term today with a brief cere mony that included no action on pending cases.

title: 9 PRIVATE SCHOOLS TO ADMIT NEGROES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP)  Nine private schools in Mis sissippi have given public notice that they will admit Negroes, the Internal Revenue Service said today.

title: Reds, Orioles in Series
description: The Cincinnati Reds and Baltimore Orioles captured league playoffs yesterday and will meet in the World Series, beginning Saturday. (Details on Page 62.)

title: Chicago Trial Is Dramatized on B.B.C.
description: LONDON, Oct. 5 The British Broadcasting Corporation de voted three hours of prime television time last night to a dramatization of the Chicago conspiracy trial.

title: Odedo Due for St. Marks
description: The Negro Ensemble Com pany will open its fourth sea son at the St. Marks Playhouse, 133 Second Avenue, on Nov. 24 with Odedo, a musical writ ten and staged by Joseph A. Walker. The show traces the history of the black in musical terms from early Africa to present day.

title: 3 Pittsburgh Doctors Charged With Violating Law on Abortion
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5Three Pittsburgh doctors were charged today by District Attor ney Robert W. Duggan with conspiracy to commit an abor tion.

title: First of Sonmy Trials Opens Today in Texas
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) A 30yearold Army sergeant will enter a courtroom at Fort Hood, Tex., tomorrow to defend himself against charges that he shot about 30 Vietnamese in the tiny village of Sonmy.

title: Unitas Long Pass No Hit With Coach
description: Remember the retort of the player who, after making a 90yard touchdown run, was balled out by the coach for running the wrong play? But coach, how was it for dis tance?

title: State of U.S. Education Deplored by Scribner
description: Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, the city's new school Chancellor, declared yesterday that the conditibm of American public education was intolerable and he called for new efforts by educators, parents and others to turn our schools around and make them work for all our children.

title: First Major Tory Bill Sets Reform of Labor Relations
description: LONDON, Oct. 5The Conservative Government pro duced its first major legislative proposal todayfor Britain's first comprehensive law regulating labormanagement relations.

title: 3 Dead and 40 Hurt as Tornado Hits 6 Blocks in Shawnee, Okla.
description: SHAWNEE, Okla., Oct. 5 (AP)  A tornado ripped through six downtown blocks in this central Oklahoma city today spreading death and destruction.

title: BIG BOARD SUED FOR $3BILL1ON
description: An organization of small in vestors filed a multibilliondol lar damage suit against the New York Stock Exchange and seven other defendants yesterday, charging violations of the Fed eral antitrust laws by setting minimum fixed commissions.

title: Wetlands Subsidy Program Sent to Senate by House
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) The House passed today a new subsidy program geared to preserving wetlands in migra tory waterfowl nesting and breeding areas.

title: Eurodollar Rate Rise Is Seen As Curb on U. S. Interest Drop
description: PARIS, Oct. 5  A bulge in rates in the world's biggest money market, that of external ly held dollars, may exercise a restraining force on the de cline of interest rates in the United States, financial specialists said.

title: Mobil Fined $10,000 For Dumping Waste Into Buffalo River
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 5 (AP)  A judge fined the Mobil Oil Cor poration $10,000 today on the ground it had failed to halt the discharge of industrial waste into the Buffalo River.

title: Union and General Motors Say Progress Is Slow
description: DETROIT, Oct. 5 The Unit ed Automobile Workers and the General Motors Corporation conceded today that they were making only slow progress in their efforts to solve plantlevel problems.

title: Plane Engines to Be Dismantled For Study of Crash in Rockies
