title: FLORENCE CHAPIN, 44, NURSE AND TEACHER
description: Miss Florence Margaret Chap in died in New York Hospital on Friday after a long illness. She was 44 years old and lived at 55 Westminister Court, Todt Hill, Staten Island.

title: MUNICIPAL BONDS GENERATE CHEER
description: Investment bankers who deal hi taxexempt bonds decided Friday that their market must be in robust health since it stood up so well all week in the face of a big supply of new financing.

title: Taylor Tops Newcombe
description: MIDLAND, Tex., Oct. 11 (AP) Roger Taylor of Britain took the Midland Racquet Club's professional tennis tournament today by beating topseeded John Newcombe of Australia, 26, 76, 61, in the final.

title: The Cities: The Lower Class
description: The tangle of social pathologies that people mainly have in mind when they speak of the urban crisis arises principally from the presence in the inner districts of the central cities and of their larger, older suburbs of a small lower class the defining fea ture of which is its inability (or at any rate failure) to take account of the future and to control impulses.

title: CONSUMER AREA ATTRACTING RCA
description: A spokesman for the RCA Corporation said yesterday that the latest acquisition move by the $3billion broadcasting and electronics giant simply shows again that we are serious about getting into areasespecially consumer areasthat are grow ing faster than some of our traditional markets.

title: The Same Old Reds
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 11Pete Rose, searching so hard for an optimistic thought his eyes nearly rolled back, finally said: Some time it helps a team to lose a few in your home town; you try so hard in your own home town, mother and father, all your relatives around. Now I didn't feel that way, but maybe it did affect us. Baseball is a lot mental. The words fell out of his mouth like stones, but he shrugged and plunged on. It's mental. You pick up a paper and read you're in a slump; that prolongs the slump. Finally, he dropped his hands to his sides. Well, both games went down to the last out. You wouldn't classify the last two days as a buttwhipping, would you? You only got to win this game by one run.

title: Motorcyclist Escapes Injury
description: WENDOVER, Oct. 11 (AP) A California motorcyclist, Cal Rayborn of San Diego, deceler ating after being clocked at 212 miles an hour, overturned three times today but escaped un injured.

title: CARDINALS RALLY TOPS SAINTS. 2417
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 11 (UPI) Jim Hart passed 49 yards to Jackie Smith for a touchdown with 5:38 remaining to break a 1717 tie and give the St. Louis Cardinals a 2417 decision over the New Orleans Saints today for their third straight victory.

title: Atlanta. Police Use Tear Gas to Quell Riot in Hippie Area
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 11 (UPI) The police said they exchanged gunfire with snipers early today in a hippie area along Peach tree Street in a riot. They said the riot was touched off when a teenage girl was arrested for selling narcotics.

title: Colonels Acquire Hamilton
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct. 11 (AP)  The Kentucky Colonels of the American Basketball As sociation announced today the acquisition of 6foot8inch Dennis Hamilton from the Pittsburgh Condors in exchange for a future draft choice. Hamil ton averaged 6.2 points a game for Pittsburgh last season.

title: Catholic Church in Bolivia Offers Support for Leftist
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Oct. 11 (AP) TheRoman Catholic Church in Bolivia tendered its support today to the new leftist Govern ment of Gen. Juan Jose Torres but said it was opposed to Marxiststyle socialism.

title: Campus Unrest Panelist Says Agnew Looks to 76
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11 (AP) The youngest member of the President's Commission on Campus Unrest said today he believed Vice President Agnew wanted to be President and was beyond the control of President Nixon.

title: School Scores
description: School Scores

title: Plane Kills Man in Auto
description: GRAND SALINE, Tex., Oct. 11 (UPI)A plane in trouble In relay, windy weather at tempted a landing today on a busy highway west of Grand Saline and collided with an au tomobile carrying six persons. The driver of the car was killed. His wife and three children and another passenger escaped with lacerations and minor injuries. The pilot suffered minor injur ies. The dead man was Morris B. Gary, 47 years old, of Quit man, Tex.

title: STEEL OUTPUT CUT AS DEMAND DROPS
description: PITTSBURGH. Oct. 11Sag ging demand is starting to show up in steel production and steel prices.

title: U.S. Filling of Public Posts on Delegation to U.N. Stirs Complaints
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 11In this 25thanniver sary year of the United Na tions, complaints are being heard here that the Nixon Ad ministration selected people for public posts on the United States delegation more on the basis of Republican party loyalty than of personal dis tinction.

title: CITY HOSPITALS LIFT OUTPATIENT RATES
description: Rates for patient visits in the city's municipal hospitals, based on ability to pay, have gone up to a maximum of $32 in clinics and $26 in emergency rooms.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: New Corporate Bonds

title: South Korean Warships Sink a Red Espionage Boat
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 11 The Defense Ministry an nounced today that South Ko rean naval vessels sank a North Korean spy boat last night in the Sea of Japan 20 miles south of the demilitarized zone.

title: RAFIKI CAPTURES HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: ST. JAMES, L. I., Oct. 11 The Mill Pond Farm's Rafiki swept the division to score 20 points and win the regular working hunter championship at the Glen Head horse show today. The event was held at the Hollandia Farms here.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Quester Wins in Germany, But Regazzoni Gets Title
description: HOCKENHEIM, West Ger many, Oct. 11 (UPI)Dieter Quester of Austria drove his Brabham to victory at the Hockenheim Motordome today at an average speed of 116.3 mils an hour to win the last race of the Formula Two sea son.

title: 3 Reggio Calabria Policemen Wounded in New Violence
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, Oct. 11 (Reuters)  Three po licemen were woundedin two shooting incidents hi new vio lence here tonight, the police said.

title: COPILOT IN CRASH DEFENDS THE CREW
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Oct. 11 (AP)The copilot of an air plane that crashed in the Colo rado Rockies Oct. 2 with a loss of 30 lives including those of 13 members of a college football team said yesterday that the plane had been airworthy and the pilots qualified.

title: Payless Municipal Paydays?
description: No amount of City Hall denials can divorce Mayor Lindsay's warning of the possibility of payless paydays, pay cuts and even layoffs from the new round of collec tive bargaining the city has just begun with the first the unions representing its 300,000 employes. Labor costs account for well over half of the $7.8 billion municipal budget, and these costs have been going up at an astro nomic rate in recent years with no perceptible dividends in improved public service.

title: ORIOLES TOP REDS IN 2D SERIES GAME
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 11The Baltimore Orioles took a two game lead in the World Series today. They scored five runs in the fifth inning and defeated the Cincinnati Reds 65.

title: Leber Katz Partners Is Agency's New Name
description: Leber Katz Paccione, which has lost its creative partner,. Onofrio Paccione, has chang ed its name to reflect the loss Leber Katz Partners. Inc.

title: Major Issues Reported in the Week Ended Oct. 10, 1970
description: Major Issues Reported in the Week Ended Oct. 10, 1970

title: WICHITA ST. VOTES TO COMPLETE SLATE
description: WICHITA, Kan., Oct. 11 (AP) Wichita State University's new football coach, Bob Sea man told a news conference to night that survivors of the plane crash in Colorado and members of the university's athletic corporation have voted to continue their football schedule.

title: Browns Beat Bengals, 3027
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 11 (AP) Bill Nelsen returned to the lineup today following an in jury and led the Cleveland Browns 80 yards to a fourth quarter touchdown and a 30 27 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals in an American Con ference game.

title: BRODIE'S PASSING PACES WINNERS
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 11 (UPI) John Brodie scored on a 12 yard run in the second quarter, then broke up the game with a 59yard touchdown pass to Gene Washington in the third quarter as the San Francisco 49ers upset the Los Angeles Rams, 206, before a crowd of 77,272 today.

title: Major Independents
description: Major Independents

title: Revue Shifts Opening Date
description: The opening of the Israeli American musical revue To Be or Not to Be  What Kind of Question Is That? has been switched from tomorrow to next Tuesday at the Barbizon Plaza Theater.

title: Orioles Lead in Errors
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 11 (AP) Despite Brooks Robinson's he roics at third base, the suppos edly superior Baltimore Oriole fielders have committed four errors to none by the Cincinnati Reds in the two World Series games.

title: VIETNAM HAMLET A SANITARY MODEL
description: NHONHOA, South Vietnam, Oct. 3  Health Is Gold, a little sign tacked onto a coco nut tree says in Vietnamese. Sanitation Makes the Hamlet Cheerful.

title: Man Seized at O'Hare
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 11 (UPI) Ronald E. Talbott, an unem ployed entertainer from Day ton, Ohio, was arrested by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation last night at O'Hare International Airport after he allegedly tried to carry a loaded .22caliber pistol aboard a Trans World Airlines flight to Los Angeles. He was charged with the Federal of fense of carrying a concealed weapon aboard an aircraft. A hearing was scheduled for to morrow.

title: ORIOLE CATCHER FOOLED BY PITCH
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 11 (UPI) Elrod Hendricks, the other catcher in the World Series, said with a grin today:

title: U.S. JET IS MISSING ON LAOTIAN MISSION
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. Oct. 11 (Reuters)An American Air Force reconnaissance jet dis appeared on a flight over Laos and is presumed to have crashed, the United States com mand said today.

title: Camera Shop Blasted
description: OAK BROOK, Ill., Oct. 11 (AP)  A blast police think was caused by a homemade time  bomb caused $10,000 damage when it blew out a display window and doorway of the Morrison Camera Com pany, Inc., camera shop in this Chicago suburb last night. No one was injured. Everett Nee dleman, manager of the store, told authorities he could think of no reason for the bomb.

title: PAUL POWELL, 68, ILLINOIS LEADER
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Oct. 11 (AP)Secretary of State Paul (Powell, a strong man in the Democratic party of this state and threetime Speaker of the Illinois House, died yesterday in Rochester, Minn., where he was an outpatient at the Mayo Clinic. He was 68 years old. A successor will be appointed by Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie to serve until January, 1973.

title: OpenAdmissions Policy Taxes City U. Resources
description: A month after the start of its openadmissions program the City University is clogged with students, short of space and funds and beset with ma jor uncertainties.

title: Youths in Pnompenh End Celebration of Republic's Proclamation With a Demonstration Against Vice
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 11Three days of re publican fervor reached a high point here today as youths staged a demonstra tion against corruption, gam bling, prostitution and opium.

title: Londonderry Catholic Area Sees New Night of Strife
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Monday, Oct. 12 (AP) Troops and rioters skirmish ed in the Roman Catholic dis trict of Londonderry through most of the night. More than 100 persons surrounded three policemen in a post near the district and set fire to a police car before soldiers moved in.

title: Advertising: Strike Gloom Fills Detroit
description: Usually there's football, the World Series and cars selling like crazythis is the nice time of the year, said Lee H. Wilson, executive sec retary of the Adcraft Club of Detroit, thinking about other times, strikeless times.

title: Newspaper Photoengravers Authorize a Strike Here
description: Union photoengravers voted yesterday to authorize a strike against the city's four major newspapers to win better con tract protection against job loss from the installation of Inew machinery and automation.

title: New Quakes in South Italy
description: MIGNANO MONTELUNGO, Italy, Oct. 11 (UPI)Two more earth tremors shook this south ern Italian village today, the 25th and 26th recorded in re cent days. Several of the 5781 buildings damaged previously were reported to have been damaged again.

title: Texas, Missouri, Georgia Tech and Penn State Lose Star Players by Injury
description: Before this college football season ends, the No. 1 team in the country may be decided more on health records than wonlost figures.

title: The Issues of 1970
description: Vice President Agnew and many other Republican party leaders are involved in a major political effort to win control of the House and Senate in November through the exploitation of fear, anxiety, and frustration.

title: Blast at New York Hilton
description: An explosion in a flower pot on the first floor of the New York Hilton Hotel at 53d Street and the Avenue of the Americas early this morning did little damage, the police reported. They said that the blast, which occurred at about 2:35 A.M., knocked out win dows, but caused no injuries.

title: PORSCHE TEAM WINS LAST RACE OF SERIES
description: ZELTWEG, Austria, Oct. 11 (Reuters)  Porsthe scored its ninth victory in the 1970 world sports car championship today when Jo Siffert of Switzerland and Brian Redman of Britain won the Austrian. 625mile event, 10th and final race in the series.

title: Israel Still Ready to Extend CeaseFire
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 11The Israeli Government reaffirmed today its readiness to continue the present Suez Canal cease fire indefinitely, following a re ported United Arab Republic warning that the truce might not be extended past the 90 day period agreed upon last August.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: Theater: Trelawny of the Wells
description: The news that the New York Shakespeare Festival was to produce Pinero's Trelawny of the Wells at the Anspacher Theater in its Lafayette Street building, did I must admit stir more trepi dation than enthusiasm in my hardened old heart. But it is a play of blissful theatrical magic, and the production is a winner.

title: Improved Boeing Jumbo Jet Makes First Flight in West
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 11 (UPI)  The Boeing. 747B, an advanced and improved model of the world's first jumbo jetliner, made its first flight today.

title: Pretoria Students Beat Fans at Pop Festival
description: CAPETOWN, Oct. 11 South Africa's first attempt to stage a pop music festival ended in violence this week end when some 200 students raided the grounds where it was taking place, kidnapped spectators, beat them and shaved or burned their long hair.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The crux of Anne Paolucci's argu ment (letter, Sept. 26) seems to be that open admissions at the City Uni versity will somehow dilute the qual ity of degrees in higher education in New York City. This is emphatically not the case.

title: Problems for Cairo's New Regime
description: Sadat Coalition Seen as Seeking to Give Show of StrengthLONDON, Oct. 11The new Egyptian coalition, evidently unsure of itself and lacking wide support, is embarked on a diplomatic offensive on the Israeli issce to try to consoli date its power.

title: FOREIGN AID PLAN MODIFIED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11The Nixon Administration has quiet ly yielded to demands of the House Foreign Affairs Commit tee that it retain jurisdiction over any new approach to economic and military foreign aid next year.

title: Belmont Entries
description: Belmont Entries

title: Menu for Autumn
description: A menu for fall dining is suggested below with reci pes given for the starred dishes. The curried fruit compote can be served with lamb, poultry and game and adjusted to make use of the fruits that are in season.

title: Soviet Stakes in the Middle East
description: Premier Kosygin's decision not to attend the United Nations 25th anni versary celebration here later this month has emphasized the new deep chill in SovietAmerican relations. This past week Moscow and Washington spokesmen have been angrily exchang ing cold  war  type accusations as though this were 1950 or 1960 rather than 1970. Washington's anger at So viet and Egyptian missile trickery in the Suez Canal zone is matched by Moscow's effort to brazen its way out of the situation.

title: 4 JEWEL THIEVES ROB SOPHIA LOREN
description: Sophia Loren was robbed of jewelry reported to be worth $700,000 early yesterday by four gunmen who forced their way into her suite in the Hampshire House on Central Park South.

title: Palsy Unit to Gain From House Tour
description: The seventh annual bene fit house and art tour spon sored by the New Yorker League for Cerebral Palsy, an affiliate of the Women's Division of United Cerebral Palsy of New York City, is planned for the afternoon of Oct. 20 from 1 to 5.

title: Facts on World Series
description: ParticipantsBaltimore Orioles, American League, vs. Cincinnati Reds, National League.

title: Adam Rapacki, ExPolish Foreign Minister and Architect of Plan for AtomFree Zone in Eurone. Dies
description: WARSAW, Oct. 11 (Reuters) Adam Rapacki, former Polish Foreign Minister and the archi tect of the Rapacki Plan for an atomfree zone in central Europe, died of a heart ailment last night. He was 60 years old.

title: QUEBEC PREMIER ASKS GUARANTEES FROM KIDNAPPERS
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 11Pre mier Robert A. Bourassa said in a radio broadcast tonight that the provincial government of Quebec could not meet the demands of terrorist kidnappers before it was sure that the two men they held would be freed.

title: Exhibition Basketball
description: Exhibition Basketball

title: 7.4% Profit Rise Forecast For 25 Bank Operations
description: Profits from operations at 25 large representative banks will show a gain of 7.4 per cent for 1970, a leading under writer and dealer in bank se curities forecast over the weekend.

title: Lefkowitz Says Freight Rates Would Be Unfair to New York
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz charged yesterday that freight rate increases pro posed by railroads would make shipping costs through the Port of New York 9 per cent higher than those through Gulf and South Atlantic ports.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Shipping/Mails

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: 200 GATHER TO FIX ANTIWAR DAY PLANS
description: The antiwar activists are members of the steering com mittee of the National Peace Action Coalition. The coalition, formed at a conference of 1,500 persons last June in Cleveland, consists adult and student peace groups.

title: Nets Defeated by Condors In Final Exhibition, 124123
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., Oct. 11 A basket by George Thomp son and two free throws by Sam Watts brought the Pitts burgh Condors a 124123 vic tory over the New York Nets tonight.

title: China's Generation Gap
description: PEKINGThe problem of a gap between the older and the younger generations in China goes back 50 years to the May 4, 1919, movement which Chairman Mao has called a Cul tural Revolution and the most com plete and thorough up to that time.

title: Makarova to American Ballet Theater
description: LONDON Oct. 11  Na talya Makarova, the Russian ballerina who defected here last month, agreed tonight to join the American Ballet Theater.

title: Fox, SchultzHeik Take Class Honors In Y.R.A. Fall Sail
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Oct. 11  A. Shawhan Fox, with Stri der in the Shields Class, and Joachim SchultzHeik, with his Soling sloop, HoppeQuax, clinched postseason honors to day during the eighth regatta of the annual fall series for Yacht Racing Association fleets sailed off Larchmont Y.C.

title: EPISCOPAL CHURCH OPENS 63D PARLEY
description: HOUSTON, Oct 11  The 3.5millionmember Episcopal Church opened its 63d trien nial general convention here to night confronted with contro versial issues ranging from fi nances to Protestant unity.

title: Berlin Stage Fete: Some Highlights
description: BERLIN, Oct. 11Postwar German theater is famous for its organization and for its lack of new plays, and the threeweek autumn fes tival here confirms both. In East as well as in West Ber lin the festival programs sug gest an abundance of new works, but when you study the small print the usual pic ture emergesthat of a theater heavily dependent on foreign plays and visiting production.

title: Court Upholds Motto on Coins
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 12 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit rejected today a challenge to the constitutionality of the na tional motto In God We Trust and its use on currency and coins. The appellate court said it was quite obvious that the motto on coins and currency has nothing whatsoever to do with the establishment of reli gion.

title: U.S. RIGHTS PANEL FINDS BREAKDOWN IN ENFORCEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 The United States Commission on Civil Rights said today that there had been a major break down in enforcement of the vast complex of Federal laws and executive orders against racial discrimination.

title: Nat'l Football League
description: Nat'l Football League

title: Cool, Tough and Black
description: NAPA, Calif., Oct. 12In the teeth of that swing to the right that the politicians like to talk about, is it con ceivable that a black man could be elected to head the public school sys tem of California? Particularly if his opponent is the glib rightwing dema gogue, Max Rafferty, for eight years the state's Superintendent of Public Instruction?

title: SADAT CRITICIZES PRESSURE BY U.S.
description: CAIRO, Oct. 12Acting Pres ident Anwar Sadat charged to day that the United States, hopeful of a vacuum in the United Arab Republic because of the death of President Gamal Abdel Nasser, attempted to use pressure and threats to weak en the country's stand against Israel.

title: Black Power Leader Charged
description: LONDON, Oct. 12 (Reuters) Michael Abdul Malik, a British blackpower leader known as Michael X, today was ordered to stand trial on Charges of robbery.

title: Stocks in London Move Lower in Quiet Trading
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange moved lower in quiet trading yesterday. The weaker trend on Wall Street late last week caused some hesitancy and small selling depressed prices.

title: City to Purchase Building, Ending Lease Dispute
description: A controversy about a five story commercial building in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn has ended with the city's decision to buy it for use in the economic redevelopment of the area.

title: ANIS FULEIHAN, 70, MUSICIAN, IS DEAD
description: STANFORD, Calif., Oct. 12 (AP) Anis Fuleihan, New York concert pianist and composer, died yesterday in Stanford Medical Center of postopera tive complications. He was 70 years old and lived at 438 West 116th Street, New York City.

title: South Africa Breaches Black Nations United Front
description: CAPETOWN  South Africa, at the expense of bending a few of her laws on racial sepa ration, is quietly trying to per suade black African countries that cooperation is more ef fective than confrontation.

title: 5th Avenue Columbus Parade Draws Crowds and Candidates
description: On the kind of sunny, pleas ant day made for promenad ing, Americans of Italian and other ancestry marched up Fifth Avenue yesterday in the 26th annual Columbus Day pa rade.

title: BARNEY RAPP
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 12 (AP) Barney Rapp, who organized and directed one of the first musical groups in the bigband era, died today at his home. He was 70 years old.

title: Now That Nasser Is Gone, BenGurion, His Old Foe, Feels Uneasy
description: SDE BOKER, Israel, Oct. 8 To David BenGurion, Premier of Israel for 13 years, Gamal Abdel Nasser was primarily the man who thwarted his am bitions to establish peace and security for Israel. Now, like many influential Israelis, Mr. BenGurion is uneasy because the Egyptian President is gone.

title: Top Defense Lawyer Slain
description: PLEASANT RIDGE; Mich., Oct. 12 (AP) An Oakland County lawyer, who has rep resented many prominent crimi nal defendants, and his wife Were found shot to death yes terday in the bedroom of their large twostory home in the Detroit suburb of Bleasan Ridge: The victims were Carl ton S. Roeser, 47 years old, anc his wife, Barbara,: 46. The po Lice said there was some evi dente the home was broker into.

title: F.A.A. to Offer Antinoise. Plan For 2,000 Airliners Next Month
description: A $1billion dispute over whether the nation's airlines should be compelled to make their prejumbo jet airliners as quiet as the larger craft will intensify during the next month.

title: GULF OIL CORP. PLANS SALE OF DEBENTURES
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation an nounced plans yesterday to raise $200million early next month through the sale of 25year deb entures. The proceeds, the com pany said in its brief statement, are to be used for general cor porate purposes. The sale would be made about Nov. 5.

title: Guardsman Accused of Arson
description: AUSTIN, Texas, Oct. 12 (Reu ters)A 21yearold National Guardsman, Robert Connally, was arrested by the Federal Bureau of Investigation today in connection with an arson at tack at the Texas National Guard headquarters here last Friday, when four trucks were set ablaze with gasoline. He was charged with destruction of government property.

title: Executive Changes
description: Albert P. Gagnebin, president of the Intetna tional Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., and Inter national Nickel Company, Inc., has been elected a director of the IngersollRand Company.

title: 11 French Soldiers Killed In Clash With Chad Rebels
description: PARIS, Oct. 12The Defense Ministry announced today that 11 French soldiers were killed and 10 were wounded in a bat tle with rebel forces In north ern Chad yesterday.

title: British Soccer Standings
description: British Soccer Standings

title: W. HIGHLAND IS BEST IN MARYLAND SHOW
description: REESE, Md., Oct. 12Jane Esther Henderson's West High land white terrier, Ch. DeGo Hubert, capped a successful threeday Maryland circuit with a best in show at the Carroll Kennel Club's fifth annual event today. Judge P. Carl Tuttle of Rectortown, Va., called Hubert, personality plusfantastic in head.

title: Quebec's Premier Gets New Appeals From 2 Hostages
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 12Que bec's two kidnapping victims, James R. Cross and Pierre La porte, evidently still alive and unharmed, advised the Quebec government today that the Front for the Liberation of Quebec would keep its promise to release them if 23 prisoners were freed.

title: World Series Schedule
description: TodayAt Baltimore, 1 P.M. TomorrowAt Baltimore, 1 P.M ThursdayAt Baltimore, 1 P.M (if necessary).

title: Rails and Unions Extend Strike Deadline to Dec, 4
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (AP)  Railroad union and industry negotiations have agreed to give a White House emergency board additional time to report to President Nixon its recom mendations for settling a wage dispute that involves about 550,000 workers.

title: court Bars Review pf Ruling That Aids Some City Tenants
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (AP) The Supreme Court has turned down an appeal by the New York City Housing Au thority that sought to overturn ft ruling giving its tenants greater opportunity to combat rent increases and lease termi nations.

title: Bahamas Air Service Taken Over by 4 Lines
description: MIAMI, Oct. 12 (UPI) The Prime Minister Of the Bahamas, Lynden 0. Pin dling, claimed credit today for having averted a trans port crisis in the Bahamas, as a consequence of the col lapse of the national Ba hamian airline.

title: Quebec Front's Intermediary
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 12The man designated today by Quebec's political kidnappers to serve as the intermediary with the authorities is a 29 yearold lawyer who has be come well knowndefending FrenchCanadian separatist extremists. Robert Lemieux saia during a series or weak end news confer antes that, he did not know who had kidnapped James R. Cross, a British diplomat, or Pierre Laporte, a Quebec provincial minister, but I'm sure I've met them. Two cells of the Front for the Liberation of Quebec have given proof that they hold the two hostages.

title: LAFAYETTE SINKS JOHN JAY BY 4614
description: Lafayette, New Utrecht and Lincoln scored Public Schools Athletic League football vic tories yesterday.

title: Seven Are Indicted in Baltimore In Violations on Meat Inspection
description: BALTIMORE, Oct, 12 (AP) The former president of one of Maryland's largest packing companies, four other former officers and two Federal meat inspectors were indicted today for conspiring to commit wholesale violations of the Federal Meat Inspection Act.

title: LUDWELL DENNY DIES; NEWS EDITOR WAS 75
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Oct. 12 (UPI)Ludwell Denny, retired foreign editor of the Scripps Howard Newspaper Alliance, died here today. He was 75 years old.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President met with his staff and later in the morning saw H.E.W. Secretary Elliot L. Richard son. The President then flew to Corinecticut on a political trip and was expected to re turn to Washington later today.

title: EL AL GROUNDS PILOT IN HIJACKING DISPUTE
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 12Repre sentatives of the pilots of El Al Israel Airlines and manage ment agreed today to ground the captain of an airliner on which a security guard thwart ed an attempted hijacking by Arab guerrillas of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine on Sent 6.

title: All Died in Taiwan Crash
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan (AP)Unit ed States Air Force spokesmen confirmed today that there were no survivors among the 43 Air Force personnel aboard fa fourengine Hercules trans port that crashed or, Oct. 2.

title: Christine R. Costigan Is Engaged
description: Miss Christine Roberta Costigan, a graduate student at the University of Wiscon sin, and William Chittenden Schutt Jr., a senior there, have become engaged.

title: BUDGE BACKS SHIFT IN TAKEOVER LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (Reu ters)The chairman of the Securities and Exchange Com mission, Hamer IL Budge told, a House Commerce subcommit tee today that the S.E.C. sup ported a bill giving the com mission authority to regulate corporate takeover attempts involving 5 per cent or more of a company's stock.

title: The Cities: Babies For Sale
description: Many social scientists are confident that people who live for the moment would soon begin to take account of the future if they were placed in a situation where it would be advan tageous foi them (in terms of the values that they themselves hold) to do so.

title: 300 GAP. LEADERS AT GOODELL FETE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 About 300 of the Republican elite  including the Senate G.O.P. leader and whip and the chairman of the Republican policy committeeturned out tonight to supply support and funds to the campaign of Sena tor Charles E. Goodell of New York.

title: Europeans Speeding Plans for Phone and AirTraffic Satellites
description: CONSTANCE, West Ger many, Oct. 12International plans have been developed for several earthsatellite systems, each to some extent symbol izing Western Europe's prog ress toward independence in this field.

title: Women Given Role In Episcopal Policy
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 12  In major break with tradition, the 63d triennial convention of the Episcopal Church agreed over whelmingly today to permit women to serve as fully accred ited members of the conven tion's heretofore allmale House of Deputies.

title: Metreveli Wins Net Final
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 12 (UPI) Alexander Metreveli beat Too mas Lejus, 64, 64, 64, today to win the Soviet men's singles tennis championship. The women's title went to Olga Morozova, who defeated Zaiga Yansone, 64, 63.

title: REV. F. J. DOUGHAEN
description: The Rev. Francis Jerome Doughaen, assistant pastor of St. Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic Church at 135 West 31st Street, died yesterday at St. Clare's Hospital after a long illness. He was 67 years old.

title: Holy Cross to Keep R.O.T.C.
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 12 (AP)The FacultyStudent As sembly at Holy Cross College rejected today a proposal that the Naval and Air Force Re serve Officers Training Corps be phased out over a threeyear period.

title: CHARLES GREENFIELD
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Oct. 12 Charles L. Greenfield, a for mer resident of Bronxville, N.Y., died yesterday in Memorial Hospital, Hollywood. He was 67 years old and lived on Blue Heron Drive here.

title: Crash Hurts Negro Sherif
description: TUSKEGEE, Ala., Oct. 12 Alabama's only Negro sheriff, Lucius Amerson, was reported slightly improved by a Colum bus, Ga., hospital today after he was seriously injured in an automobile crash Saturday night. Harland B. Blake, an Alabama state trooper, was killed. They had been pursuing three youths who had escaped from Mount Meigs Industrial School in a stolen automobile. The crash occurred 13 miles from the Georgia state line.

title: 2 Job Protests at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 12Sixtynine of 230 guards stayed off their jobs to day to protest what they con sidered insufficient pay and poor promotion policies. Six teen of 29 telephone operators also reported they were sick, in a job action to win higher pay. A similar tactic is threat ened by interpreters.

title: Packers Down Chargers, 2220, on 14Yard Field Goal
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 12 (UPI) Dale Livingston kicked a 14 yard field goal, his third of the game, with 3 minutes 39 sec onds left to give the Green By PIC.kers a 2220 Natiohal Foot ball League victory over the San Diego Chargers tonight in a seesaw battle.

title: New Suburbanites Often Abandon Old Political Ties
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., Oct. 5 Bob McKie pumps gas for a living, and the living isn't easy. Two years ago he had to sell his house when the taxes got too high and move into a mobile home. Then the youngest of his five children was arrested on a drug charge.

title: NIXON ORDERS A HOLD ON EDUCATION FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (UPI)  The Nixon Adminis tration said today that some of the money Congress had or dered spent for education was being held up because of a budget squeeze and a question of whether. Congress would or der the President to spend the money.

title: OldTimers Pay Visit to Bronx
description: For 16 members of the original United Nations staff still on the Job, yesterday was a day of nostalgia returning after 25 years to the Bronx college campus that was the organization's first American home.

title: Probable Rafting Order For Third Series Game
description: Probable Rafting Order For Third Series Game

title: POLICE ACT TO TRACE SOPHIA LOREN GEMS
description: The New York police tele graphed prominent jewelry concerns in Paris, London and Rome yesterday to obtain pre cise descriptions of jewelry sto len Sunday from Sophia Loren in her suite in the Hampshire House on Central Park South.

title: Campbell Seeking Vaile's
description: The Campbell Soup Company announced yesterday it had reached an agreement in prin ciple to acquire all the assets of Valle's Steak House, subject to its liabilities, for $38,925,000 in cash. Valle's operates 12 res taurants in Maine, Massachu setts, Rhode Island, Connecti cut and New York and has five others in various stages of develop ment. Most of its facilities can seat up to 1,000 per sons. Earlier this year, Campbell purchased two restaurant chains in the Pacific Northwest. Campbell said it planned to operate Valle's under its present management and personnel.

title: SAM T. GREENE
description: MADISON, N. J., Oct. 12 Sam T. Greene of 25 Wilmer Street, publisher from 1940 to 1966 here of Supervision maga zine, died yesterday at Morris town Memorial Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: Football Ratings
description: Football Ratings

title: Mobil in New Libyan Deal
description: The Mobil Oil Company an nounced yesterday it had nego tiated a new contract with the Government of Libya setting an increased posted price of $2.53 a barrel for 40degree gravity crude and higher payments to Libya.

title: Tito Ends European Tour
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct 12 (UPI)  President Tito of Yugoslavia returned home yes terday from a five  day visit that included talks in Brussels, Luxembourg and Bonn. He said in a statement at the airport that he returned with very fa vorable impressions.

title: HABASH IS REPORTED RETURNED TO JORDAN
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Oct. 12 (AP) George Habash, Marxist lead er of the guerrilla organization that hijacked four airliners to the Middle East last month, re turned secretly today to Jordan despite a $14,000 reward for his capture.

title: Troops for Ottawa
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 12The Ca nadian Government tonight or dered troops to help protect the capital, while officials displayed deep concern over the Quebec terrorist kidnappings.

title: President Orders Extension of Turbotrain Trials
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Oct. 12 (AP)  The highspeed turbo train, which makes one trip day between New York and Boston, will be continued beyond its scheduled Oct. 22 termination date, President Nixon announced here today.

title: THE POST AND GUILD TO HOLD TALK TODAY
description: Negotiators for The New York Post and the striking Newspaper Guild are scheduled to meet again today, with Theo dore W. Kheel and A.A. Desser, mediators in their dispute, at Automation House, 49 East 68th Street.

title: OTHER COMPANY REPORTS
description: OTHER COMPANY REPORTS

title: Standard Oil of Indiana Unit Will Seek Copper in Congo
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 12 (UPI) The Standard Oil Company of Indiana said today that it would participate through its subsidiary, the Amoco Minerals Company, in an international group undertaking exploration for copper and other minerals in the Congo's Katanga Prov ince.

title: Beare Assails Lindsay in Court Fight
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame accused the Lindsay admin istration yesterday of trying to stack the deck against him in their court fight over consultant contracts.

title: Dead Souls on Campus
description: When I taught at Princeton one of my students brought me a story he had written: I'm sure you won't like it, he told me, because in your work people die.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: About Time, poems by P. J. Kava nagh; A Man in My Position, poems by Norman MacCaig; My Findings, poems by Frederick Broadie;The Sad Mountain, poems by Tom Early; The State of the Nation, poems by Alan Bold (Phoenix poems Living Poets: Wesleyan University, $3 each).

title: Excerpts From Hesburgh's Statement on Rights Enforcement
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 Following are excerpts from a statement by the Rev. Theodore M. Hesburgh, chair man of the United States Commission on Civil Rights, regarding the commission's release of a report on civil rights enforcement by the Federal Government:

title: Traffic Along Ho Chi Minh Trail Picks Up as Dry Season Nears
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 12With the dry season approaching, North Vietnamese and Vietcong forces in Laos are beginning to ship supplies southward along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, according to un official renorts.

title: ASCAP Fete Gets a Show
description: When the American So ciety of Composers, Authors and Publishers is honored at a dinner dance benefiting the Muscular Dystrophy Associa tions of America at the Plaza on Oct. 23, it would seem appropriate to have a bit of entertainment. And so there will be.

title: MRS. ROBERT MAUCHEL
description: Mrs. Robert M. Mauchel, mother of Mrs. Gordon P. Franklin, wife of the president of Saks Fifth Avenue, died yes terday in the Mary Manning Walsh Home, 1339 York Ave nue, after a long illness. She had been a resident of the home since last December. Earlier she had lived in the Florence Nightingale Home.

title: Money
description: Money

title: Bank Mergers Planneu
description: The First Federal Savings and Loan Association of Niagara County, Niagara Falls, and the Western New York Savings Bank, Buffalo, would combine under the savings bank's name under a merger plan disclosed yesterday by the New York State Banking Department. The department also has approved the proposed merger of the Orange County Savings and Loan Association into the War wick Savings Bank.

title: ERNEST SANS SOUCI
description: Ernest Sans Soud, manager of operations at Manhattan College's computer center, died Sunday evening at his home, 325 East 93d Street, after a heart attack. He was 44 years old.

title: Tennessee Not Following the DemolishGore Script
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 10Two months ago, it was rather wide ly expected that Senator Albert Gore, the liberal Democrat and Vietnam war critic, would be this year's main victim of the Nixon Administration's South ern strategy.

title: Actions Taken by U.S. Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Professional Football
description: Professional Football

title: ARTHUR G. WELCH
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Oct. 12 Arthur G. Welch of 330 West Jersey Street, president and treasurer of G. Stephen Lu Brew, Inc., an insurance and bonding company here, died yesterday at the Elizabeth Gen eral Hospital after a brief ill ness. His age was 60.

title: Ulbricht to Visit Ptague
description: BERLIN, Oct. 12 (Reuters) President Walter Ulbricht and Premier Willi Stoph of East Germany will pay an official visit to Czechoslovakia in the second half of this month, the East German press agency A.D.N. reported today.

title: Michigan Man Quits China With Wife After Seven Years
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 12 (Reu ters)Robert Friend, a journal ist and teacher from Michigan who has lived in China for seven years crossed into Hong Kong Oct. 4, American sources said today.

title: STUDY OF PRINTING PREDICTS GROWTH
description: The $54billion printing In dustry in this country appears headed for rapid growth as well as many changes in the next 20 years.

title: Sports Today
description: World Series, third game, Orioles vs. Cincinnati Reds, at Balti more. (TelevisionChannel 4, 1P.M.) (RadioWNBC, 1 P.M.)

title: Telephone Co. to Give Scores Daring Series
description: New York's baseball fans may get the. latest World Series scores by dialing 6371212, the telephone com pany's time bureau.

title: Rights Group Held Liable In Boycott's Closing Store
description: JACKSON, Miss., Oct. 12 (AP)  The Mississippi Supreme Court ruled today that the Southern Christian Leadership Conference was liable for dam ages to a Grenada grocery that went out of business after Negro boycott.

title: Miss Jan Porter Lenney Is a Bride
description: Miss Jan Porter Lenney and Michael Hurd, son of Peter Hurd, the painter, were married on Saturday in the gallery at his parents ranch in San Patricio, N. M.

title: APPEAL IS LOST BY RKO GENERAL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 12 (AP)  The Supreme Court declined 8to1 today to review a lower court ruling in New York re quiring RKO General, Inc., to give up some $8million for al legedly violating a law aimed at keeping insiders from profit ing on the basis of information unavailable to the public.

title: Saab Will Unveil Its First 4Door Sedan on Friday
description: In a break with longstand ing policy, Saab, the Swed ish automobile manufactur er, for the first time will offer buyers a fourdoor se dan.

title: Creative Services Chief Leaves Burnett Agency
description: After 20 years with the Leo Burnett Company, Don Tennant, its director of creative services, has left because of a disagreement over policy.

title: Feodor Rojankovsky, 78, Dies; Illustrator of Children's Books
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Oct. 12 Feodor Rojankovsky, an art ist and illustrator, primarily of children's books, died of can cer at his home here today. He was 78 years old.

title: CONGRESS CLEARS NIXONBACKED BILL TO COMBAT CRIME
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12The Senate passed and sent to the White House today a contro versial bill designed to curb racketeering and terrorist bombings.

title: Kanicki, Johnson Exult at Last
description: This question was blurted by Jim Kanicki on Sunday, several lockers down the clubhouse from Ron Johnson. Kanicki and Johnson used to be teammates on the Cleveland Browns un til they were traded to the Giants last winter for, well, Homer Jones. The two tormer Browns were feeling a bit giddy after the 3023 victory over Philadelphia. Kanicki had recovered a fumble in the fourth period while Johnson had run for touchdowns in the opening and closing minutes. And most im portant, the Giants had finally won a game.

title: Forward Gal Beats Isafloridan by 3 Lengths in Belmont's $125,600 Frizette
description: Also Stable's Forward Gal cast another important ballot in her campaign for juvenile filly honors yesterday by romp ing to an easy triumph in the $125,600 Frizette at Belmont Park.

title: Belmont Loses Nijinsky to Newmarket
description: LONDON, Oct. 12 (AP) Charles W. Engelhard of Far Hills, N. J., millionaire race horse owner, gave approval to day for his colt, Nijinsky, to race in the Champion Stakes at Newmarket on Saturday.

title: YASIN MUGHIR, 49, U.N. OFFICER, DIES
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 12Yasin Mughir, a senior political affairs officer with the United Nations, died Saturday in New Haven after a long ill ness. He was 49 years old.

title: PANMUNJOM CLASH HURTS U.N. GUARDS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 12 The United Nations command announced today that North Korean guards and civilian workers attacked a group of the command's security guards at the truce village of Pan munjom this morning with shovels, clubs and stones, in juring sevenone critically and another seriously.

title: Allstate Suspends Writing Of Auto Insurance in Florida
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Oct. 12 (AP)  The Allstate Insurance Company has notified its  of fices not to write any new automobile insurance policies in Florida until legal questions regarding the state's new 120 day rate moratorium law are resolved.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Business Machine Maker Expands Revenues
description: Higher sales and earnings were reported yesterday by the International Business Ma chines Corporation for the quarter and nine months ended Sept 30.

title: Strike of Funeral Homes Continues as Talks Recess
description: A selective strike against eight funeral homes cqntinued yesterday after an 18hour negotiating session Sailed to bring the parties to an agree ment. The strike, which began Saturday night is against branches of the J. S. Garlick Parkside Memorial Chapels, Gutterman's, Inc., and I. J. Morris, Inc.

title: BIG BOARD DROPS IN SLOW TRADING
description: A pause for consolidation. That's what sonic market ana lysts said yesterday. A phase of minor correction, echoed other observers on Wall Street.

title: Corn Crop Gains Slightly, But Lags Below Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (AP) The nation's blightdamaged corn crop improved slightly during the final week, of Sep tember and now is estimated at 4,188,280,000 bushels, the Agriculture Department an nounced today.

title: Irish Banking Employes Reject Pay Offer in Strike
description: DUBLIN, Oct. 12Bank em ployes today rejected an offer of a substantial salary increase and voted to continue a strike that has paralyzed the Irish banking system for more than five months.

title: Airlines Cut Costs by Trimming Luxuries and Staffs
description: The stewardess brings a corned beef sandwich instead of a steak. She doesn't show a movie on some flights. And in economy class, the maca damia nuts have all but van ished.

title: Filipoy Dance in Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 12  Aleksandc Filipov, a Soviet dancer who defected last month, signed a contract today with the Pittsburgh Ballet Theater as permanent guest artist. The 22yearold dancer was formerly with the Moise yev Classical Ballet Company, Young Ballet.

title: Freeport Handed First Nassau Loss By Uniondale, 76
description: Freeport, the Rutgers Cur winne: as the best school foot ball team in Nassau County last season, was upset yester day, 76, by Uniondale in a South Shore Division I game. It was the first loss for Free port since the final game of the 1968 season, after which the Red Devils won eight and were tied once.

title: Auctioned, Chinese Vase Brings $226,800, Double Old Record
description: LONDON, Oct. 12A 13th century Chinese flower vase brought $226,800 at auction to day, more than doubling the previous world record auction price for a single piece of pot tery or porcelain.

title: Incumbents in Queens, and L.I. Districts Are Facing Strong Challenges for First Time
description: Along the southern section of Queens, between the Brook lyn and Nassau borders, live thousands of voters so inde pendent in pulling levers on Election Day that they are known as chicken pickers. In this Seventh Congressional; District, it is almost unethical to vote a straight party ticket.

title: Eban Is Insistent on a Missile Rollback
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12  Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel called on the Soviet Union and Egypt today to re move the obstacles to peace in the Middle East by rolling back the antiaircraft missiles reportedly implanted along the Western bank of the Suez Canal since Aug. 7.

title: New Violence Flares in City In Italy After a Day of Calm
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, Oct. 12 (Reuters)Demonstra tors attacked the police station, the city hall, two railroad sta tions and two schools housing police reinforcements here this evening after a day of compara tive calm.

title: A Party Opening Valentino's Boutique Is a CrowdPleaser
description: The main attractions were the architecture and the peo ple last night at the opening for Valentino's porcelain and glass boutique at 801 Madi son Avenue, near 67th Street, and both could be admired from the outside. Because of the heat and the crowds, a lot of people brought their champagne out on the side walk.

title: Soledad: A Letter to Angela Davis
description: Angela Davis, a former philosophy professor, has been placed on the F.B.I.'s Most Wanted List as an out growth of the spectacular San Raphael shootout last August. Four persons died including 17yearold Jonathan Jackson.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (UPI) The Defense Department said today the following servicemen from the New York area had died in the war in Southeast Asia:

title: F.B.I Aide. Doubts That Reds Cause Unrest in U.S.
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Oct. 12 (UPI)  A high official of the Federal Bureau of Investi gation said today that the Com munist party is not in any way causing or directing or controlling the unrest we suf, fer today in the racial field and in the academic community.William C. Sullivan, top as sistant to the F.B.I. director, J. Edgar Hoover, said that Communists do attempt to ex ploit troubled situations wher ever they can. But he said the Communist party today is not nearly as extensive or ef fective as it was a number of years ago.

title: $316MILLION ADDED TO HEALTH BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (UPI) The Senate Appropriations Committee added a third of billion dollars to President Nix on's health budget today, refus ing to balance the budget by the sacrifice of human lives.

title: Brown Club Plans Dinner
description: Dr. Donald F. Hornig, who was recently inaugurated as Brown University's 14th pres ident, will be the guest of honor and principal speaker at the Brown Club on Oct. 21, when the club holds its 102d annual dinner here.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Nixon announced yesterday that 40,000 more troops would be withdrawn from South Vietnam by Christmas. The White House said that the reduction does not represent a withdrawal beyond the 150,000 men to be brought home by next spring. Meanwhile, Defense Secretary Mel vin R. Laird said that he hoped to do away with draft calls entirely by the middle of 1973. [Page 1, Columns 23.]

title: Help for CreditCard Losers
description: A New Jersey shopper went into Saks Fifth Avenue recently, stopped on the main floor to make a telephone call and inadvertently left her handbag in the phone booth.

title: Committee Here Reports on Aid To 313,000 Jews in 25 Lands
description: The Joint Distribution Com mittee reported yesterday that by the end of this year it will have assisted 313,000 needy Jews in 25 countries, including Israel, at a cost of $23million.

title: 27,000 in U.N. Family Add Exotic Touchto Urban Area
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 12Almost any morn ing women in saris or in flowing African cottons can be seen pushing shopping carts in the market near Kip's Bay, commenting on the price of lettuce or lamb and sigh ing because Madhav or Maged or Eduardo has reached the expensive age of orthodontia.

title: SelfService Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12It takes courage for a Congressman to stand up and be counted on the great issues of our time. Courage of a high order. Courage above and beyond. Too often, the Congressman finds it expedient to sit at home in his law office endorsing checks when the roll is being called. Too often, the Congressman shows the public a silhouette in chicken instead of a profile in courage.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Business Records
description: Business Records

title: 5 NASA OFFICIALS TO VISIT BROW
description: The United States space agency announced yesterday that five of its top engineers would go to Moscow on Oct. 26 to discuss with their Soviet counterparts ways of making manned spacecraft of the two nations compatible for joint flight operations.

title: McNally, Cloninger Start 3d Series Game Today
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 12The Baltimore Orioles, unbeaten in three weeks, girded themselves for the coup de grace over the Cincinnati Reds today as the World Series moved here with the Orioles firmly in charge.

title: Cuban Exiles March Before U.N. After a False Report on Castro Visit
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct 12A group of about a hundred antiCastro Cubans swarmed across First Avenue today, hurdled the iron fence protecting the United Na tions territory and managed to lower the Soviet flag for a few moments before being evicted by security guards.

title: The Myth of Humane Weapons
description: Myths are of great value  they make thinking unnecessary. One of the biggest myths is that war can be made humane. It is certainly possible from an organizational viewpoint to eliminate war and still provide ade quate safeguards for all nations, if that is what the nations want, but trying to make war more humane is futile.

title: Joseph M. Larkin Dead at 82; Was Bethlehem Steel Executive
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Oct. 12 Joseph M. Larkin, retired vice president for industrial and public relations of the Bethle hem Steel Corporation, died to day at Muhlenberg Medical Center here. He was 82 years old.

title: Union Carbide Denounced On Bid for Pollution Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 Representative Ken Hechier, Democrat of West Virginia, said today that the Union Car bide Corporation's proposal that the Federal Government pay half the cost of a $10.5 million air pollution control project in its Marietta; Ohio, plant was arrogant and insult ing.

title: BIANCA SAULER SINGS SUSANNA IN FIGARO
description: Bianca Sauler exuded charm and grace as Susanna in Mo zart's The Marriage of Figaro Sunday night, but for a time her singing had to be taken partly on faith. The Brooklyn born soprano, making her debut with the New York City Opera, has a light, sweet voice, and during the first two acts it simply did not carry well across the footlights. Much of the time her tone was faint; on occasion it was all but inaudible.

title: Foe Derides Troop Move
description: PARIS, Oct. 12 (Reuters) Hanoi and Vietcong officials tonight dismissed President Nixon's decision to pull 40,000 United States soldiers out of Vietnam by Christmas as an other move to fool American opinion before the Congression al election.

title: POOR NATIONS WIN TRADE ADVANTAGE
description: GENEVA, Oct. 12  The world's poorer countries have fulfilled a sixyearlong ambi tion with the conclusion today of an agreement giving their products easier access to the home markets of the industri alized nations.

title: Weatherman Article Tells Of Blast at Chicano Statue
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 12  The bomb that blew up the Hay market Square statue of policeman last Monday was as sembled in the airconditioned comfort of a suburban home and placed between the statue's legs by a young woman, ac cording to an article in a Chi cago magazine said to have been written by a Weatherman.

title: Mayor Confers on Judicial Reforms
description: Mayor Lindsay met yesterday at City Hall with the District Attorneys of the city's five counties to discuss judicial re form proposals to prevent a re currence of the city's recent jail rebellions.

title: Agnew Contends Unrest Stems From Success of U.S. System
description: AMARILLO, Tex., Oct. 12 Vice President Agnew said to night that a basic reason for unrest in the country was that Americans never had it so good.

title: College, School Results
description: College, School Results

title: A Correction
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 12Prime Minister Heath of Britain, Premier Eisaku Sato of Japan and Prime Minister Sir Kamisese Mara of Fiji, all due this week for the 25th ses sion of the United Nations, will be staying at the WaldorfAs toria Hotel, not the Plaza, as erroneously reported in The New York Times this morning.

title: Morocco's Foreign Minister
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 12 (Reuters)Ring Hassan today appointed Youssef Bel Abbes as the new Moroccan Foreign Minister. The new minister, un til recently ambassador in Al giers and a former Minister of Health and Minister of Educa tion, replaces Abdelhaid Bou taleb, who was elected presi dent'of Morocco's Parliament Saturday.

title: Starts and Rogers Disagree on Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12  Two members of President Nixon's Cabinet disagreed, flatly and publicly, today over the probable impact of the foreigntrade legislation that is now being considered by Congress.

title: Sports of Yhe Himes
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 12From time im memorial, baseball men have had a sub lime faith in the law of averages, theoriz ing that everything levels off to the proper degree if given a sufficient, period of time. But over short stretches it doesn't neces sarily work.

title: Contest in Second District in Brief
description: POPULATION  600,000, with a broad ethnic and eco nomic mixture. There are large black areas in Hunting ton Station, Amityville and Lindenhurst. There is also a large concentration of Ital ians on the South Shore.

title: ARMENTA ADAMS PLAYS MEMORIAL
description: Armenta Adams, a beautifully black pianist with a big tone and large ambitions, gave a recital Sunday afternoon at Alice Tully Hall in memory of her friend Philippa Schuyler, the musician and author Who died in a South Vietnam heli copter crash in 1967. Miss Admas, aiming at a suitable memorial, played a Beethoven sonata (Op. 2, No. 2); the world premiere of Hank Johnsons Khan Earth Fantasie, and for a mammoth coda, Bach's Gold herg Variations.

title: Belmont Jockeys
description: Belmont Jockeys

title: Europe Study Gets Grant
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 12 (AP) The University of Pittsburgh has received a $385,000 Ford Foundation grant to establish a Council for European Studies with eight other universities Columbia, Harvard, Massachu setts Institute of Technology, Princeton, University of Cali fornia, Yale, Michigan and Wis consin.

title: Drug Concern Reaches Record for Earnings
description: Sales and earnings of Eli Lilly & Co. set records in the nine months ended Sept. 30 de spite a continued slowdown in the rate of growth during the third quarter of this leading ethical drug producer.

title: President Will Attend Testimonial for Starr
description: GREEN. BAY, Wis. 0ct 12 (AP)  Nixon will attend the Bart Starr testi monial in Green bay on Satur day night, a: spokesman for Representative John W. Byrnes, Republican; Wiscon sin, announced today.

title: Canada May Announce Ties With Peking Today
description: TOKYO, Oct. 12 (AP) Japanese news reports said today that Canada was ex pected to announce recogni tion of Communist China to morrow.

title: HIGH COURT KILLS LAW ON PETITIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (AP) The Supreme Court affirmed today the ruling of a United States District Court in New York City that a series of New York State election laws deali, Ing with procedures for get ting on the ballot were invalid.

title: BLUES ARE VICTORS OVER CANUCKS, 41
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 12 (AP) The St. Louis Blues scored three ??? in the third period tonight to defeat the Vancouver Canucks, 41, in a National Hockey League game.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: Balloon Device Called Aid To Heart Attack Victims
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 12 (UPI) The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced today the development of equipment to provide temporary, aid to the failing hearts of coronary vic tims.

title: Britannia Becalmed
description: LONDON, Oct. 12The Brit ish economy lies becalmed this fall, a listless ship that has failed to reach any of the four generally accepted objectives of economic policy: economic growth, price stability, full em ployment and balanceofpay ments improvement.

title: Newspaper Plant Damaged
description: MARLBORO, Mass., Oct. 12 (UPI)Fire early today caused heavy damage to the compos ing and makeup rooms of The Marlboro Daily Enterprise, forcing cancellation of today's editions. Four firemen were injured battling the blaze in the twostory cinderblock building.

title: Goldberg Ousts 2 Hecklers of Governor
description: Arthur J. Goldberg personally apologized to Governor Rocke feller yesterday hours after two of Mr. Goldberg's aides had heckled the Governor on the Lower East Side. The Goldberg aides were discharged for their actions.

title: Summaries of Yonkers Races
description: Summaries of Yonkers Races

title: To Save the Seas
description: If the nations continue to use the seas as a dump, scientists warned last summer, the world's oceans will become as dead as. Lake Erie by the end of this century.

title: Pontiac Schools Reopened
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Oct. 12 (UPI)City officials have lifted a fourday curfew in this indus trial city and today they re opened the two schools where black and white students bat tled for three days with five youths being shot, But a state of emergency imposed along with the curfew Wednesday night remained in effect for the 85,000 residents of this north ern suburb of Detroit. It for bids gatherings of groups of more than four persons and the purchase of alcohol or gasoline in containers.

title: Cambodian TV: Full of Unexpected
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 6  The Time: Last Friday evening.

title: PRICE RISE PARED ON SOYBEAN LIST
description: New highs for the season were set in several soybeans fu tures contracts during yester day's session on the Chicago Board of Trade, but the ad vance was pared somewhat near the close.

title: Nixon Comments on Buckley
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (AP) During a brief stopover at the Westchester County Airport in Purchase on his way back from Connecticut to Washington to day, President Nixon was greeted by about a thousand supporters of James L. Buckley, the Conservative party's candi date for the Senate.

title: RARITIES ON VIEW AT ANTIQUES FAIR
description: Few antiques shows have been able to resist a policy of something for everyone, a course that is evident in the New York Antiques Fair, which opened yesterday at the 69th Regiment Armory, Lexington Avenue and 26th Street.

title: PROGRESS IS CITED IN BUILDING TALKS
description: Negotiations to end the four week strike of building service employes against Bronx land lords yielded some progress on both sides yesterday, rais ing hopes for a settlement of the dispute.

title: KNICKS IN GARDEN AGAINST CELTICS
description: The first step in establishing a dynasty in professional sports is to win one oham pionship.

title: London Gold Price Climbs To Its Highest Level of 70
description: LONDON, Oct. 12 (Reuters) Active trading on the London market today pushed the price of gold to its highest level in almost a year, with an ounce of gold gaining 32.5 cents to $3725.

title: Theater: Good Whodunit
description: When did Broadway last have a play with a second curtain line such as What is happening? A good play, that is. Barry England's play Conduct Unbecoming, which opened last night at the Ethel Barrymore Theater, is quite a wonderful example of its genre. It is a whodunit, a whyhedidit and a where itwasdone of quite unusual interest and quality.

title: FIAT'S SOVIET UNIT TO PROFIT LITTLE

description: TodayAt Baltimore, 1 P.M. TomorrowAt Baltimore, 1 P.M ThursdayAt Baltimore, 1 P.M (if necessary).

title: Buckley Predicts a Triumph for Silent Majority

title: PROFITS RISE 25% AT C.I.T.BANK UNIT
description: The $2billion National Bank of North America, 97 per cent of whose shares are owned by the C.I.T. Financial Corpora tion, reported yesterday net income from operations of $14.86million, or $2.83 a share, for the first nine months this year, up 25 per cent from the $11.31million, or $2.26 in the comparable 1969 period.

title: WAR GAMES BEGIN IN EAST GERMANY
description: BERLIN, Oct. 12  More than 100,000 troops from the seven Warsaw Pact countries moved into position today in East Germany to open the largest war games ever staged by the East European military alliance.

title: Archbishop Joseph McGeough, ExNuncio to Ireland, Is Dead

title: Mills Sees a Deficit of $12Billion to $20Billion
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Oct. 12 The deficit in the Federal Government's budget will range between $12billion and $20 billion during the current fiscal year, ending next June 30, Representative Wilbur D. Mills said here today.

title: No Alternative for Chile
description: The governing Christian Democrats have taken the least unpalatable course open to Chile in the agreement with Salvador Allende's leftist coalition. In return for the coalition's support for ten constitutional changes aimed at entrenching basic freedoms and free institu tions, the Christian Democrats will furnish the congres sional votes that will make Dr. Allende Chile's first Marxist President.

title: SOVIET AIDE ON COAST TO OPEN CONSULATE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 12 (Reuters)A Soviet diplomat, Aleksandr Zinchuk, arrived to day to open the first Soviet consulate in the United States since lust after World War II.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12The Supreme Court heard today three possible legal solutions to the problems of racial balance and busing in Southern schools.

title: Percentages Taking an Oriole Bounce
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 12 Those famous percentages by which baseball people live have played a strange role in this World Series, which has fallen so swiftly into the grasp of the Baltimore Ori oles. In the first two games, onerun victories for the Ori oles in Cincinnati, the percentage moves have all gone for Baltimore and against the Reds. Outsiders often misunderstand the talk of percentages. They have little to do with sta tistics, arithmetic or the mathematics of probability.

The new minister, un til recently ambassador in Al giers and a former Minister of Health and Minister of Educa tion, replaces Abdelhaid Bou taleb, who was elected presi dent'of Morocco's Parliament Saturday.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 12  Felipe Herrera, president of the Inter  American Development Bank since it was established in 1960, has resigned his post effective next May to return to Chile, where he may become associated with the new Gov ernment of Dr. Salvador Al lende.

J., Oct. 12  Government and industry officials said here today that fullscale commercial plants probably would be converting coal into synthetic oil and pipeline gas by the end of this decade. description: Recollections of despair, histories of sorrow, glimmers of occasional joy or hope all mutely endure the visitor's scrutiny.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12  The Senate defeated today, Southern attempt to tie a free domofchoice rider to the pro posed Constitutional amend ment barring rex discrimination.

title: Screen: Wild Child of 30:'Mind of Mr. Soames' Stars Stamp
description: There are some movies that do nothing right, no matter how well they do it, and such a movie is "The Mind of Mr. Soames," not that it does anything well. But with each scene, each camera movement, each gesture from its large and dispirited cast, "The Mind of Mr. Soames," which opened yesterday at the Cinema 57 Rendezvous, displays an emptiness and a falseness of response that is beneath even the inadequacy of its ideas and the banality of its plot.John Soames (Terence Stamp), in a coma for all of his 30 years, is finally brought to life by the super surgery of Dr. Bergen (Robert Vaughn) so that he may be educated according to the theories of Dr. Maitland (Nigel Davenport), director of the institute where he had been peacfully sleeping. Between permissive Dr. Bergen and repressive Dr. Maitland a certain ideological conflict develops (e.g. "How often do you playgameswith him?" "Games? What do you mean, games!") that is the first and, I guess, final cause of the melodrama. But in the background there is a third doctor (Donal Donnelly), a source of hope who keeps his own counsel, patiently watches the wild child, and incidentally looks a bit like Franois Truffaut."The Mind of Mr. Soames" is full of boldly introduced but ultimately undeveloped character clichs, which add a touch of bogus mystery to a film that is otherwise 100 per cent predictable. For example, Dr. Bergen drinkstoo muchbut nothing ever comes of it. And the callous TV director (Christian Roberts) who willfully almost wrecks Soames's belated childhoodwhat is his story, full of meaningless dark hints and fitful glimmerings?As Soames himself, a child of Frankenstein dressed in a mansized set of pink Dr. Dentons, without booties, Terence Stamp must have the best fun in the movie. Not only does he get to cry a lot and to play with toys, but he also is allowed at one time or another to dump baby food on all his doctors and keeperswith which inspiration "The Mind of Mr. Soames" exhausts itself and falls into moral platitude and heavy breathing.

title: U. S. Studies 5 Rochester Blasts
description: ROCHESTER, Oct. 12 Federal, county and city law enforcement officials joined today in an effort to find the terrorists responsible for the dynamite bombings early this morning of two downtown public buildings, two Negro churches and the home of white union official.

title: ATOMTEST DELAY BY PEKING IS SEEN
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 12Ex parts on Communist China are speculating that concern in Peking over creating a bad im pression on United Nations members could be delaying further nuclear testing.

title: Florida City Lifts Curfew
description: QUINCY, Fla., Oct. 12 (UPI) Mayor Lamar Monroe lifted a curfew in this tense north Florida city today after two nights of mass marches and windowbreaking that began Saturday night after a black man was wounded by a black policeman. Twenty blacks were arrested but Mr. Monroe said there was no animosity be tween the races. I think this could have happened under the same conditions whether you were black or white, he said.

title: New Oil Well Reported

The well is an offset to one previously drilled. Mountain Fuel has a 50 per cent interest in the field with Belco Petroleum and Humble Oil owning the other half.

title: A Trendless Election
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 Only three weeks to go and the seers and setters of trends who seek a neat and tidy result are growing restless. They are looking to Election Day to produce some new historic trend or alignment in American politics. So far, however, there is no visible trend, ?? or otherwise. The country appears to be having not one election, but a thousand. Vice President Agnew notwithstanding, the average Democratic candidate is not a rabid, rancid radical posing a historic challenge to the sys tem. The Democratic National Committee to the contrary, the average Republican candidate does not favor higher prices or unemployment, or both.

That proposal would allow exporters to reduce their taxes by forming Domestic International Sales Corporations.

title: Liturgical Activity By Catholic Women Is Called Limited
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 12 (AP) Responses from 345 Catholic parishes in 71 dioceses across the country indicate little or no participation by women in parish liturgical activity sanc tioned by the Roman Catholic Church.

title: TeenAger Held as Supplier Of Guns to Revolutionaries
description: SAVANNAH, Mo., Oct. 12 (UPI)The arrest of a teen ager suspecthd of supplying guns to hippie colonies and left  wing radicals was dis closed today by sheriff's offi cers here. The suspect, was identified as James Ronald Lambert, 19 years old, who is wanted in at least two states for stealing guns. Sheriff Read Miller said the youth had told him he had supplied as many as 200 guns to revolutionaries in different parts of the coun try under the direction of twe men he knew only by nick names.

title: Books of The Times
description: Writing from a 16thcentury point of view, Miguel Agia observed: The Spaniard and the Indian are diametrically opposed. The Indian is by nature without greed and the Spaniard is extremely greedy, the In dian phlegmatic and the Spaniard excit able, the Indian humble and the Spaniard arrogant, the Indian deliberate in all he does and the Span iard quick in all he wants, the one liking to order and the other hat ing to serve. It's a comparison im possible to fault, especially in view of the evidence John Hemming has marshaled in this excellent re telling of the old bloody story of Peru. Mr. Hemming  historian, e x plorer and mem ber of the Royal Geographical S o ciety takes us froin the establishment of the conquista dores at Cajamarca in 1532 to the behead ing of Tupac Arnaru, the last great Inca lord, in Cuzco 40 years later. What a dif ference 40 years can make
