description: AMERICAN CONFERENCE KANSAS CITYActivated Billy Cannon, tight end; added Richard Armstrong, running back, to taxi squad.

title: Jacklin Leads French Golf With a 67
description: SAINT NOM LA BRETECHE, France, Oct. 16The big names with the big games performed according to form today and, unfortunately for the promot ers, so did the almost nonexist ent French Rolfine public.

title: Books of The Times
description: Although it is cast in the form of novel, Bomber is a clinical, documentary account of a single, bombing raid that obliterates a small town in the Ruhrby mistake. It is told from both sides, the preparation and organization of the attack by the British, the planning and mechanics of the defense by the Germans. The two

title: New York G.I. Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP)  The Pentagon today identi fied eight servicemen as having been killed in the war in South east Asia, including S. Sgt. Douglas H. Silvernail of Hol comb, N.Y., of the Army.

title: MRS. IRVING WOLFSON
description: Mrs. Belle Turshen Wolfson, widow of Irving Wolfson, a former deputy city clerk for Brooklyn, died Thursday in Flatbush General Hospital. She was 71 years old and lived at 300 Sullivan Place, Brooklyn.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtiantic

title: Reluctant Candidate Is Facing Bingham in 23d District
description: The young wife of a city patrolman and a retired cus toms officer who tried unsuc cessfully to have his name re moved from the ballot are run ning against Representative Jonathan B. Bingham, Liberal Democrat, in the 23d Congres sional District in the Bronx.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Oct. 13.

title: Tampa Beats Miami, 3114
description: MIAMI, Oct. 16(AP)Sam Gellerstedt led a strong Tampa defense tonight as the small college powerhouse: beat Miami, 3114. The unbeaten Spartans now have won five games.

title: Commission Will Investigate Australian Bridge Collapse
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Oct. 16 (Reuters)The world's lead ing experts on bigbridge build ing are to be asked to appear before a royal commission set up to determine the cause of yesterday's collapse of a bridge span in which at least 32 work men were killed.

title: Pope Names Cardinal Villot Chamberlain of the Church
description: ROME, Oct. 16Pope Paul VI today named his Secretary of State, Jean Cardinal Villot, as Camerlengo or Chamberlain, of the Holy Roman Church. The Cardinal succeeds Benedet to Cardinal Aloisi Masella, who died Sept. 30 at the age of 91.

title: ARTHUR L. KLIEGMAN
description: Arthur L. Kliegman, presi dent of Kliegman Bros. Inc., laundry and dry cleaning sup plies, Glendale, Queens, died Thursday of a heart attack at his home, 1818 Newkirk Ave nue. Brooklyn, His age was 70.

title: Mellon's Mill Reef Scores
description: NEWMARKET, England, Oct. 16 (Reuters)Mill Reef, owned by the American mil lionaire, Paul Mellon, won the Dewhurst Stakes today by four lengths, with Engelhard's Wenceslas finishing second. Victory for the oddson fa vorite brought Mellon a prize of $26,910.

title: Policeman Gets Term in Perjury Case
description: Charging that police corrup tion is getting out of hand, Supreme Court Justice Francis J. Bloustein yesterday sentenced a New York policeman con victed of perjury to one to three years in state prison.

title: New Publisher in Elizabeth
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Oct. 16 (AP)  The Daily Journal of Elizabeth announced today the appointment of John Musgat as publisher efective Dec. 1. He will succeed Harry P. Frank, whose retirement Nov. 30 was announced last week. Mr. Mus gat is publisher of The Evening Sentinel of Ansonia, Conn.

title: Dr. Maurice Meltzer Dies; Urologist Was Consultant
description: Dr. Maurice Meltzer, former director of urology at Broad, Street Hospital, died last Sat urday here. He was 78 years old and lived at 15 Gramercy Park.

title: HYMAN BRESS GIVES PROGRAM ON VIOLIN
description: Among the many substantial works Hyman Bress played in his violin recital in Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night was one that had its familiarity strangely masked. This was the famous Bach Chaconne, which was presented not for solo vio lin as written but with the ac companiment supplied by Rob ert Schumann. The latter added piano music to all the Bach unaccompanied violin works, and Mr. Bress has recently re corded them.

title: FREDA E. SUPERKO
description: IRVINGTON, N. J., Oct. 16 Freda E. Superko, an English teacher at Irvington High School for 29 years, died yes terday at the Irvington General Hospital. Miss Superko, who lived at 10 38th Street, retired in 1959. She was 74 years old.

title: LEHMAN BROTHERS WILL INCORPORATE
description: Lehman Brothers, one of Wall Street's leading oldline in vestmentbanking houses, plans to transfer from its present sta tus as a partnership and incor porate to form. Lehman Broth ers, Inc.

title: Guild and Post Tar Apart
description: Negotiators for The New York Post and the striking Newspaper Guild remained very far apart yesterday and no date has been set for fur ther talks, according to Theo dore W. Kheel, chief mediator in the dispute.

title: Agnew Disputes Finch Stand
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Oct. 16 Vice President Agnew took is sue today with the statement by Robert H. Finch, counselor to the President, that Mr. Ag new was not speaking for the White House when he attacked Senator Charles E. Goodell, Re publican of New York.

title: U.S. REJECTS A PLAN ON NEAT INSPECTION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP)  The Nixon Administration has turned down a study group recommendation that a new consumer agency be set up in the Agriculutre Department to handle meat and poultry in snection.

title: A Striking Production Of Roberto Devereux'.
description: Donizetti's Roberto Dev ereux, which came to the New York State Theater Thursday night after having been absent from New York for a hundred years or so, is undeniably grand opera. It has big arias, handsome en sembles and a couple of full throated choruses. It attempts more in the way of charac terization than most bel canto operas do. The libretto, based on the story of Elizabeth and Essex, even makes sense. And yet it is hard to warm up to the work.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: GLADYS IRVINE
description: GREENFIELD, Mass., Oct. 16 Gladys Irvine, who retired as a teacher at Public School 220 in Brooklyn, died Wednesday here. She lived in Northfield.

title: EISENHOWER ESTATE PUT AT $2.8MILLION
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Oct. 16 (AP)Former President Dwight, D. Eisenhower left an estate totaling $2,870,004.90, accord ing to a Pennsylvania inheri tance tax return filed today.

title: Entertainment Events
description: THE WHISTLING WIZARD AND THE SULTAN OF TUFFET, the puppet musical by Alan Stern, songs by Bil Baird and Alan Stern. At the Bll Baird Theater, 59 Barrow Street. Saturday and Sunday at 1 and 3, through Nov. 29.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Nadien, Concertmaster Of Philharmonic, Resigns
description: David Nadien, concertmaster of the New York Philharmonic since 1966, has resigned from the orchestra to resume activi ties as an independent concert artist. The resignation became effective this week.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Hendry Wins Seniors Golf By 10 Shots With 146 Total
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Oct. 16 Jack Hendry of Syracuse scored a 72 on the 5,918yard, par70 South Course at Westchester Country Club today to win the New York State Seniors Golf Association fall championship by 10 strokes with 146.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: Advocate of the Military
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 A yellowed clipping from The New York Times relates that 20 years ago Representative Felix Edward Hebert, Demo crat of Louisiana, got into a redhot exchange of letters with President Truman. Mr. Hebert (pronounced ay BEAR) had asked the President to set aside a Sunday before Christmas as a day of prayer for national unity in the fight against a Godless ideology. Mr. Tru man replied curtly that he had already done so in his Thanksgiving Day proclama tion.

title: Soviet Satellite Launched
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 16 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched today a weather satellite de signed to relay data back to earth on its cloud and snow cover, Tass, the Soviet press agency, announced. The satel lite orbits the earth every 97.5 minutes.

title: Art: A Collection From Oxford
description: With Michelangelo, Raphael and Leonardo da Vinci row ing for Oxford, discussion is not necessary and one may be content with announcing the event. The three names mentioned, along with others ranging chronologically from Lorenzo Salimbeni da Sanse verino (c. 13741416/20) to Andrea Appiani (17541817) and includine such stellar performers as Giovanni Bel lini, Filippino Lippi, Lorenzo Bernini and Francesco Guar di, are included in an exhi bition at Wildenstein, 19 East 64th Street, for the ben efit of Oxford's Ashmoleau Museum, which has lent 75 drawings from its collection.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct 16 (UPI) Archie Clark scored 28 points tonight to spark the Philadel phia 76ers to a 127119 victory over the San Diego Rockets in a National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Scores on WOXR
description: Scores of leading football games will be given over WQXR, on the 6 P.M. news broadcast and in other news reports. Please do not tele phone The New York Times for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: BISHOP URGES RIGHT TO OBJECT TO A WAR
description: KYOTO, Japan, Oct. 16The Most Rev. Angelo Fernandes, Roman Catholic Archbishop of New Delphi, called today for the establishment of the right of conscientious objection to particular wars in which weapons of mass destruction are likely to be used or mili tary orders issued involving the commission of criminal offenses or war crimes or crimes against humanity.

title: Executive Changes
description: Herbert F. Korholz has been elected president of Pan American Sulphur Company.

title: Egyptians Give Sadat 90.04% Yes Vote
description: CAIRO, Oct. 16Anwar Sadat has been endorsed as the new President of the United Arab Republic by 9 of every 10 vot ers, the Government announced today.

title: Woody Allen, Closet Clarinetist For Years, Leads a Jazz Group
description: Woody Allen, comedian, playwright, actor, author and director, has added one more talent to this lengthening list. He made his professional de but Wednesday evening as a jazz clarinetist and leader of a jazz band at Barney Goo gles, 225 East 86th Street.

title: Relief Perils To City Cited By Dr. Adams
description: In one of his rare visits to Manhattan, Dr. Paul L. Adams, the Conservative party candi date for Governor, said yester day that Mayor Lindsay's budg et had reached complete bank ruptcy because welfare costs had been allowed to rise to the point where they were sapping, funds from essential services.

title: Giants in First Visit to Boston
description: There are five interconfer ence games on the schedule including the Giants first visit to Boston, where they have so many friends, to play the Patriots tomorrow in Harvard Stadium. That game will be televised here on Channel 2 at 1 P.M., fol lowed by Dallas at Minne sota at 4 P.M. Also at 4, on Channel 4, will be Kansas City and Cincinnati. National Confer ence teams have won all six interconference games played to date. Here is a preview of the games with wonlosttied records in parentheses.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Franklin to Reopen; Scribner Will Name Principal by Monday
description: An agreement that will reopen Benjamin Franklin High School in Manhattan, closed for a week because of a dispute over the appointment of a new principal, was reached last night by school officials and the group in dispute with them.

title: Memorial for Battleship
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP) President Nixon signed today a bill providing a memorial for the men of the battleship Utah, killed Dec. 7, 1941, in the Jap anese attack on Pearl Harbor. Flying of the flag over the re mains of the fighting ship was authorized by the measure.

title: COURT TENNIS LED BY PETE BOSTWICK
description: George H. (Pete) Bostwick Jr. of Locust Valley, L. I., held the lead over his younger brother, James C. Bostwick of Brookville, L.I., yesterday at the end of the first day's play in the world court tennis cham pionship at Racquet and Ten nis Club.

title: CANADA INVOKES WARTIME POWERS IN QUEBEC TERROR
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 16Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau invoked emergency wartime powers today to put down what he described as an insurrec tion by Quebec terrorists.

title: COMPANIES WARNED TO TELL BAD NEWS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission warned publicly owned companies today to make full and prompt disclo sure of unfavorable corporate news as well as favorable events.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Yonkers Entries

title: Count Bismarck, Grandson Of the Iron Chancellor, 67
description: CAPRI, Italy, Oct. 16 (UPI)  Count Albert Edward Bis marck, grandson of Otto von Bismarck, Germany's Iron Chancellor, died at his villa here today after a long illness. He was 67 years old.

title: 4 Students Knifed And 2 Police Hurt At Washington High
description: Four students were stabbed and many others were beaten at George Washington High School yesterday as rampag ing youths swept through the building and assaulted their schoolmates and snatched pocketbooks, forcing classes to be dismissed three hours early.

title: L.I. Parents Protest Deletion of Section on Sex From Health Text
description: MERRICK, L. I., Oot. 16 The expurgation by school authorities of two chapters dealing with human sexual ity from a book being used by seventhgrade students has drawn protests from some parents here.

title: BIG JIM TAYLOR, LEADER OF SECT
description: Big Jim Taylor, archangel of an exclusive and secret re ligious sect known as The Brethren, died on Wednesday at his home, 470 East 26th Street, Brooklyn. He was 71 years old.

title: Boy Convicted of Negligence In Shooting of a Conductor
description: Richard Berkley, 18 years old, was found guilty yesterday in State Supreme Court of crimi nal negligence in connection with the fatal sniper shooting of a conductor aboard a Penn Central train in East Harlem on March 15, 1969.

title: JonesTutwiler Lead by Shot
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 16 (AP) Grier Jones scored birdies on three of the last five holes to day and teamed with Ed Tut wiler for a 69 and a onestroke, secondround lead in the United States professional amateur golf championship. Jones, from Wichita, Kan., and Tutwiler of Indianapolis, carded nines of 35 and 34 over the 6,609yard Maketewah Country Club course for a two day total of 132, 12 under par.

title: Argentina, Beset by Economic Woes, Names LeftofCenter Aide
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 16 (AP)Argentina, beset by eco nomic difficulties, appointed a new Economics Minister today to try to get things back on the track.

title: Goldberg Assails Governor on Ads
description: UTICA, N. Y., Oct. 16Arthur J. Goldberg charged today that Governor Rockefeller's television advertising was grossly misleading. The public, he said, deserves to be informed, not fooled.

title: ACTIVITY CLIMBS FOR NEW ISSUES
description: The newissue market, which recently has been slowly try ing to move out of its doldrums, came alive this week.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: Governor Vows to Fight Leftist Terror Tactics
description: Governor Rockefeller de clared yesterday that the peo ple of this state were not go ing to be cowed or bullied by terrorists so long as he was the state's chief executive.

title: Common Market Gives U.S. Warning On Bills on Trade
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (Reu ters)The European Economic Community bluntly warned the United States today that it is ready to take common action if protectionist trade legisla tion now before Congress is ap proved.

title: 53 HELD ON DRUGS IN BUFFALO RAIDS
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 16 (AP)A massive force of lawenforce ment officers carrying warrants for the arrest of 101 persons searched this area today in one of the largest narcotics raids in the state's history.

title: Other College. Football Games on Today's Card
description: FordhamDuquesne Club. Montclair St.Bridgeport. Trenton St.Cent. Connecticut. WagnerAlbright.

title: Cotton Market
description: Cotton Market

title: HOUSING STARTS ROSE LAST MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP) The Commerce Department reported today that 1,504,000 housing units were started dur ing September, an increase of 92,000 over August. However, the seasonally adjusted hous ingstart rate was under the 1,603,000 housing units begun in July.

title: DEMOCRATIC UNIT MOVES TO REVAMP CONVENTION RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16The Democratic party moved today to open up and democratize its next Presidential nominating convention.

title: A C5A EXPLODES AT MARIETTA, GA.
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Saturday, Oct. 17An explosion ripped a giant C5A Galaxy super transport early this morning, and at least one person was re ported killed. The plane was under construction for the Air Force by the LockheedGeorgia. Company here.

title: Auto Output Up Slightly
description: DETROIT, Oct. 16 (AP) Ford, Chrysler and American Motors built more cars this week than they did a week ago while General Motors produc tion lines remained idle because of a strike that began Sept. 14.

title: Mary Keller Lenahan Betrothed to James Rush 3d
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Oct. 16Mrs. John Raymond Lenahan has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Mary Keller Lenahan of New York, to James Rob ertson Rush 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Robertson Rush of Putnam Valley, N. Y.

title: 3 NEW DANCE WORKS OFFERED IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Oct. 16  Three new works are included in the London Contemporary Dance Theater's current season at The Place, and the best of them is Rainmakers by the Dutch choreocranher Pauline de Groot.

title: Mailer, in London, Trades Jabs With Audience Over New Film
description: LONDON, Oct. 16Norman Mailer took a pounding from young British film enthusiasts this week over his new, loose gaited motion picture called Maidstone. Mr. Mailer told his critics they would like his picture better if they saw it 10 times.

title: Excerpts From Grand Jury Report on Incidents at Kent State U.
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Oct. 16 (UMI)The following are ex cerpts from the report of the special grand jury that in vestigated the incidents that led to four student death at Kent State University last May.

title: Goodell Urges Addict Center To Seek Windfall U.S. Aid
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell campaigned at a narcotics treat ment center in Harlem yester day, advising reluctant officals to apply for welfare aid and listening while addicts debated the effects of drugs.

title: MONTREAL CALM DESPITE THE CRISIS
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 16This metropolis, whose 2.2 million inhabitants make it the largest in Canada, went about its busi ness nonchalantly today.

title: Mrs. Lofton to Be Wed To Dwight Morrow Jr.
description: CARMEL, Calif., Oct. 16 Mrs. Nancy Lofton of Car mel, widow of Richard Mor rison Lofton, and Dwight W. Morrow Jr. of Carmel Valley and New Hope, Pa., plan to be married here on Nov. 25.

title: Vows to Quit Baseball and U.S. if He Loses Appeal
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Oct. 16 (UPI)Curt Flood said today the Washington Sena tors would have to offer him more than money to get him to return to baseball and the United States.

title: Nijinsky to Race at Newmarket Today
description: NEWMARKET, England, Oct. 16  Charles W'Engelhard's colt Nijinsky, once praised as the horse of the century, will try tomorrow to erase the memory of his disastrous defeat two weeks ago in the Prix de L'Arc de Triomphe.

title: Hundreds Are Arrested In Raids in the Province
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 16Some 250 persons were arrested in in Quebec Province today as the police, backed by federal troops and emergency wartime powers, began an allout cam paign to break up the Front for the Liberation of Quebec, a leftwing terrorist organization.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Jersgy 3, Johnstown 3. tone Island 4, Syracuse 0.

title: Political Aid an Arkansas Issue
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 13 Bath Gov. Winthrop Rocke feller and Dale Bumpers, his Democratic opponent in the Governor's race, are struggling to survive the help of their friends.

title: Taruc Led Huks 16 Years
description: Pedro Taruc had been com mander of the Huksthe Peo ple's Liberation Army, known in the Tagalog language as Hukbong Mapagpalayang Bay ansince 1954. He replaced his uncle, Luis Taruc, who sur rendered in that year after President Ramon Magsaysay had virtually destroyed the Huk movement.

title: Western Union Wins 30% Rate Increase On Telegrams Here
description: ALBANY, Oct. 16 (UPI) The State. Public Service Com mission gave the Western Union Telegraph Company permission today to increase its rate on five days notice by more than 30 per cent.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: GEORGE LENORMAND
description: HILLSDALE, N. J., Oct. 16 George P. Lenormand, a mem ber of the patentdrafting group at Bell Laboratories, died Wednesday. He was 61 years old and lived at 126 David Place here.

title: To Pay 12cc a Share
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP)  The Communications Satel lite Corporation declared its first dividend today, a payment of 12 cents a share.

title: Companion of Miss Davis Is Out on Bail
description: David Rudolph Poindexter Jr. was released from jail here yes terday after he posted $100,000 bail on charges that he had knowingly aided Angela Davis while she was a fugitive sought on murder and kidnapping charges.

title: Facts on the Contest in the 15th District
description: POPULATION  About 460,000. Mainly Jews, Irish and Italians, with sections of Scandinavians, Negroes and Puerto Ricans. Mostly., poor and low and middleincome. Some affluent portions.

title: British Football Results
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: '69 SERIES EVOKED DYNASTY TALK, TOO
description: Even while the champagne was still squirting after Balti more's decisive victory over Cincinnati in the World Se ries Thursday, players of both teams and any number of their fans were conceding the 1971 pennants to each other, prom ising a rematch in next fall's World Series.

title: NO BLAME IS FOUND FOR WESTMORELAND
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP) Secretary of the Army Stan ley R. Resor has dismissed allegations by a soidierdefend ant who charged Gen. William C. Westmoreland with over all responsibility for the ac tions of his troops in the alleged Sonmy massacre, it was announced today.

title: Devices Help Clear Hurdles for Severely Handicapped
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16An 11yearold boy who was born without arms and parts of his legs drove himself through the corridors of a hotel here today on a special electric cart.

title: Supreme Court to Be Asked To Review Brewster's Case
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (UPI) The Justice Department said today that it would ask the Supreme Court to review a Fed eral judge's order dismissing bribery charges against former Senator Daniel B. Brewster of Maryland.

title: Frazier Bout on Garden TV
description: Joe Frazier's heavyweight title defense against Bob Foster, the lightheavyweight cham pion, in Detroit on Nov. 18 will be televised on closedcircuit to Madison Square Garden.

title: ATLANTIC COAST FOOTBALL
description: Norfolk ID, Jersey Tigers 7. Bridgeport 31, Orlando 7.

title: Newark Mayor StresseS Engineers Role in Politics
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 16 Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson of Newark told 120 civil engineers here today that they shluld be come more involved an politics.

title: U.S. Calm as Bolivian Hostility Grows
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Oct, 16In the face of growing antiAmeri can terrorism and assaults on United States property con doned by the La Paz Govern ment, the United States has de cided to turn the other cheek toward Bolivia.

title: G. Grant Mason Jr., a Founder Of Pan American Airways, Dies
description: G. Grant Mason Jr., a founder of Pan American Airways and a former member of the Civil Aeronautics Board, died yes terday at his home, 785 Fifth Avenue. He was 66 years old.

title: Inquiry Proposes Change on Campus At Santa Barbara
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 16 Student disturbances at the University of California's cam pus at Santa Barbara might be averted in the future if the university took a more active role in the problems of its stu dent residential areas, a spe cial investigating commission told the university's board of regents here yesterday.

title: Tenants Find a Way to Cut Price of Food
description: After helping to start a foodbuying cooperative with 14 ot her neighbors last July in their apartment building in the Bronx,. Mrs. Andrew McGowan set'out on her first purchasing trip and got lost on her way to the Bronx Terminal Market, where she could buy goods at wholesale.

title: SHANKER ASSAILS LICENSE PROPOSAL
description: Albert Shanker, the presi dent of the United Federation of Teachers, said yesterday that School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner did not know what he was talking about when he proposed that city licensing examinations for teachers and supervisors be re placed by a requirement that candidates possess a state cer tificate.

title: 22 MORE ANIMALS ON ENDANGERED LIST
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP) The Interior Department said today three more mammals, eight more species of birds and 11 more types of fish now face extinction in the United States.

title: Charts of RaCes at Belmont
description: Charts of RaCes at Belmont

title: TV: Questions in Censoring of F. C. C.'s Johnson
description: Although the medium of broadcasting is celebrating its 50th anniversary, it became clear last week that it has by no means resolved all of its problems. A TV station li censed by the Federal Com munications Commission has censored two sentences from remarks made by an F.C.C. commissioner. Television has another first.

title: BERNSTEIN OFFERS 3 BY TCHAIKOVSKY
description: The next best thing to seeing the New York City Ballet per form Balanchine's Serenade is to hear the New York Phil harmonic play Tchaikovsky's Senerade in C for String Or chestra under Leonard Bern stein's direction. The ballet company has the advantage in that Serenade offers the op portunity of experiencing two masterpieces at one time the choreographer's magnificentl dance work and Tchaikovsky's ravishing score.

title: Future Farmers Elect Head
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Oct. 16 (AP)The Future Farmers of America elected J. Dan Lehmann, 20 years old, of Pleasant Plains, Ill., today as national president, and John H. McCulley, 20, of Malin, Ore., as national secretary.

title: King to Manage Richmond
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 16 (AP) Clyde King, former manager of the San Francisco Giants, was named today to manage the Atlanta Braves Interna tional League team at Rich mond.

title: Yonkers Harness Meeting Will Close Tonight
description: YONKERS, Oct. 16West chester County's harness rac ing year will be concluded tomorrow night at Yonkers Raceway. However, trotting buffs in the metropolitan area need not fret over a possible loss of action because the standardbreds will be starting a final 50night stand Monday at Roosevelt Raceway, West bury, L. I.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: Carey, in the 15th, Is in Match of Who Is Left of Whom
description: A Republican who character izes himself as to the left of both President Nixon and Gov ernor Rockefeller is the main opponent of Representative Hugh. L. Carey, the Democratic incumbent in Brooklyn's 15th Congressional District.

title: CUELLAR, POWELL ON HONOR SQUAD
description: Mike Cuellar, the winning pitcher for Baltimore in the fi nal game of the World Series against Cincinnati, and Boog Powell, a teammate, were named yesterday to the 1970 Associated Press allstar base ball team.

title: Notre Dame Faces Hobbled Missouri
description: Missouri and Notre Dame changed the site and the starting time for their first football meeting today. Now both teams, particularly Missouri would be just as happy to reschedule the game.

title: Religion Still Has Tenure
description: David Martin, the British sociolo gist, tells the story about a society in which religion was in full retreat. Public officials paid It lip service. The masses were superstitious but not concerned about authentic religion. Young people had drifted away from traditional faiths. Strange new cults from the Orient were beginning to influence fringe groups. The experts were convinced that the end of re ligion was near.

title: BALESTRIERI WINS POWERBOAT RACE
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Oct. 16 (AP)  Vincenzo Balestrieri of Italy sped 184 miles over calm seas today to win the 14th run ning of the MiamiNassau Dcean powerboat race.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A Salvation Army major, trim and peppy, stood in the Cincinnati Reds dugout one morning last week and shook his gray head with pleasure and admiration as Pete Rose performed flawlessly in a commercial for the Army's Christmas appeal. He's wonderful, said the major, he doesn't get a penny and he's very generous with his time. Our theme this year is Christmas. Is a Drop in the Bucket and Pete is doing our Cincinnati area spot. If the Reds win the Series, we might use this commercial nationally. We wanted to film the commercial twice, once introducing Pete as a world champion. But he didn't want to do that. Rushing things, I guess.

title: Home of U.S. Aide Burned
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 16 (AP) The home of the United States air attache here, Col. Charles Graffet, was burned out early this morning. Mr. Graffet, his wife and three children escaped unharmed. The police reported that the orgin of the fire had not been established and began an investigation.

title: Confrontation in Quebec
description: Were he not of French Canadian origin himself, it is unlikely that Prime Minister Trudeau would have dared take the energetic and unprecedented measures he put into effect against Quebec separatist extremists.

title: A New Parsifar Will Bow Nov.14, In 9th Met Week
description: The Metropolitan Opera will present a new production of Wagner's Parsifal in a per formance for the benefit of the company's production fund on Nov. 14, at the end of the ninth week of its season. Helge Bril loth, the Swedish tenor, will make his Metropolitan debut in the title role, and Leopold Lud wig will make his debut with the company as conductor of the work. The sets and cos tumes have been designed by Robert O'Hearn, and the stag ing will be by Nathaniel Merrill.

title: Sweden Increases Taxes In Effort to Curb Inflation
description: STOCHOLM, Oct. 16 (UPI) Premier Olof Palme's Social Democratic Government raised taxes today to curb inflation and correct a growing deficit in the balance of trade.

title: Catholic Women Elect Head
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 16 (AP)  Mrs. Thomas J. Burke, of Carbondale, Pa., was named today to a twoyear term as president of the National Coun cil of Catholic Women at the close of a weeklong conven tion.

title: Big Board Expels. Two on Charges
description: The New York Stock Ex change has expelled two former allied members, effective Oct. 1.

title: JURY INDICTS 25 IN KENT DISORDER; GUARD IS CLEARED
description: KENT, Ohio, Oct. 16A spe cial state grand jury Indicted 25 persons today in connection with disturbances last May at. Kent State University in which four students were slain in a burst of National Guard rifle fire.

title: Reagan Denounces 2 Regents as Liars After Angry Debate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 16 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan got into a shouting match with two members of the University of California Board of Regents to day and called one of them a lying son of a bitch.

title: JOHN L. COBBS DIES; EXAD EXECUTIVE, 83
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 16 John L. Cobbs, a retired vice president of Benton & Bowles, Inc., New York advertising agency, died yesterday in Greenwich Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 30 Hill side Drive, Larchmont, N. Y.

title: Final Bus Payment
description: The City of New York has paid the Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., and its wholly owned subsidiary, Surface Transit, Inc., $15,291,723 as the remaining compensation to be awarded as a result of the condemnation acquisition by the city in 1962 of the com panies bus service system and operations. The award was in line with an order of the Appel late Court. The companies had previously received $38.7mil lion as partial compensation for the condemnation.

title: Melanie Cancels Concert
description: The concert scheduled for tonight, by Melanie, the singer, at Lehman College, the Bronx, was called off because she is ill. Information about rescheduling or ticket refunds may be ob tained by calling 2954040. The new date for the concert of John Sebastian, which was to have been given at Queens Col lege last night but was post poned because of his illness, will be Dec. 18.

title: Lakers Top Bulls, 106102
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 16 (UPI) The Los Angeles Lakers, paces by Jerry West and Wilt Main berlain, stood off a secondhall rally by the Chicago Bulls to night and squeezed out 106102 triumph.

title: Chicago's 105YearOld Stockyard to Close Feb.
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 16 (AP) Chicago's Union Stockyards, the once bustling maze of pens that inspired Carl Sand burg to call the city Hog Butcher for the world, will drop the handling of farm animals on Feb. 1.

title: Hofstra Topples West Chester State, 3714, on SecondHalf Surge
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Oct. 16 Hofstra upset highlyfavored West Chester State tonight, 3714.

title: DINERS CLUB SEES PROFIT NEXT YEAR
description: The financially troubled, de tailbogged Diners Club, Inc., held its annual meeting yes terday morning at the St. Re gisSheraton, but only seven of its 2,500 shareholders showed up.

title: Paris Avoids Intervening in the Crisis
description: PARIS, Oct. 16France, a country that has encouraged French Canadian nationalism but has greatly moderated its position in the last few months, is refraining from any inter vention in the present crisis in Quebec.

title: TED SAUCIER, 74, HOTEL PUBLICIST
description: Ted Saucier, a publicrela tipns man long identified with the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness. He was 74 years old and lived at 136 East 76th Street.

title: SAYERS OF BEARS TO HAVE SURGERY
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 16 (AP) Gale Sayers of the Chicago Bears will undergo surgery on his injured left knee next Wednesday and will miss the remainder of the National Foot ball League season.

title: EPISCOPAL GRANT TO POOR RATIFIEL
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 16The House of Bishops of the Epis copal. Church gave final ap proval today to the denomina tion's controversial special program of aid to minority groups and the poor.

title: Nets Turn Back Floridians, 10592, in Opener at Home
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Oct. 16Everything about the Floridians is new this season owner, colorful uniforms and all 12 players  but the same losing image that haunted them last season, when they had the worst record in the American Basketball Associa tion, remained with them to night.

title: Parents Visit U.S. Student Again in East Berlin Prison
description: BERLIN, Oct. 16 (AP)Mark Huessy, a United States stu dent, received a second visit from his parents in his East Berlin orison today.

title: TURKEY SAID TO FACE A CHOLERA EPIDEMIC
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Oct. 16 (UPI)  The Turkish Health Minishtry brought a million doses of anticholera vaccine here from Ankara today and announced that Turkey faced the possibility of an epidemic.

title: Bridge:
description: Doubling for penalties at high levels can be a tricky affair. If the opponents are sacrificing, they should not be allowed to play undou bled. If they think they are going to make what they have bid, they should seldom be doubled. Exceptions occur in leaddirecting double situ ations, or when the defender knows the declarer is headed for bad breaks.

title: Aussie to Buy 5 Yachts For His Cup Campaign
description: Bond spoke after the Royal Perth Yacht Club, of which he is a member, issued a formal challenge today to the New York Yacht Club to race for the cup. Bond had placed an unofficial challenge with the club last month.

title: MARKET WEIGHING A CURRENCY BLOC
description: PARIS, Oct. 16  The six governments of the European Economic Community have re ceived a plan to establish a currency bloc by 1980 with single center for economic pol icy decisions and an integrated central banking apparatus sim ilar to the Federal Reserve Sys tem.

title: Mr. Jefferson's Academic Freedom
description: In these days when we hear so much about campus troubles, sweeping edu cational reforms, and the reaffirmation of academic freedom, it might be worthwhile to hark back to Thomas Jefferson, who cared more about edu cation and gave more thought to it than any other President of the United States.

title: MRS. EBERSTADT, 79, WIDOW OF BANKER
description: Mrs. Mary Van Arsdale Tongue Eberstadt, widow of Ferdinand Eberstadt, the in vestment banker, who was long active in Government service, died Thursday apparently of heart attack at her home, 435 East 52d Street. She was 79 years old.

title: Sharon Walsh Upsets Miss Wade
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Oct. 16 (Reuters)Sharon Walsh, the 18yearold United States junior tennis champion from San Rafael, Calif., upset Vir ginia Wade, the British Wight man Cup player, in a semi final match in the Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament today, 26. 62. 119.

title: MOSCOW IS PLANNING WEST GERMAN BANK

title: Youths Called Severe TVAd Critics
description: BRIGHTON, Mass., Oct. 16 A Haard specialist in the be havior of young people said to day that televisionwatching adolescents are sophisticates who ignore most commercials and have definite opinions about those they don't ignore: They like the funny, clever and straight ones and are offend ed by those they consider hyp ocritical, in bad taste or just plain stupid.

title: 2 INMATES FOUND HANGED IN CELLS
description: Two inmates were found hanged in their cells in city detention centers within 13 hours of one another, the Cor rection Department reported yesterday.

title: Candy Necklaces Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 (AP) The Food and Drug Adminis tration said today that a manu facturer's recall had been undertaken in the Eastern states for about 360 candy necklaces contaminated with wood splin ters, metal and insect frag ments. They were made in Hong Kong.

title: In Chile, MiddleClass Students With Marxist Ideals
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 15 When classes at the Uni versity of Chile's school of philosophy broke up for lunch here the other day, boys wearing jackets and ties and carefully dressed and madeup girls wandered across the grass to a cafe teria. They passed a written

title: G.E. Plans $25Million Plant
description: The General Electric Com pany announced yesterday plans for building a $25million plant near Florence, S. C., for production of mobile radio equipment. The 340,000square foot facility is scheduled for operation late in 1972 and will have an initial employment of 300 to 400 workers.

title: France Says Her Troops Will Leave Chad Next Year
description: PARIS, Oct. 16The Govern ment told the National Assem bly today that French forces would be out of Chad next year, but it specified no date.

title: WEATHER RREPORT DEJECTS GRAINS
description: Good weather conditions throughout the growing areas of the country resulted in liqui dation of grains and soybeans futures yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade, sending prices of most contracts lower.

title: B52's Bomb the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Southern Laos for the 8th Day
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 16 (AP)United States B52 bombers pounded the Ho Chi Minh Trail in southern Laos again today, the eighth consecutive day of raids against the Vietnamese supply lifeline, United States military spokes men said.

title: U.S. Team Triumphs
description: FAJARDO, P. R., Oct. 16 (UPI)Three AmericansJim Wright, Gene Borek and Jim Albusshot 66's, one stroke off the course record, in lead ing the United States team to victory over Puerto Rico today in the IzodConquistador golf tournament over the El Con quistador Hotel's par70 course.

title: Anarchy Assayed From Left and Right
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Oct. 16Great changes there must be, for a revolution can not accomplish itself without great changes; yet, order there must be, for without order revolution cannot accomplish itself by due course of law. So whatever brings risk of tumult and disorder, multitudi nous processions in the streets of our crowded towns, multi tudinous meetings in their public places and parks  ?? us to encourage and uphold the occupants of the executive power, whoever they may be, in firmly prohibiting term.

title: IMHOFF IS TRADED TO ROYALS BY 76ERS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 16  Darrall Imhoff, who had been suspended earlier in the week for his refusal to agree to con tract terms with the Philadel phia 76ers, was traded today to the Cincinnati Royals for two players and a secondround selection in next year's college draft.

title: Educational Guild Will Gain Oct. 25
description: The Educational Guild, new community service or ganization for entire families, will hold its second fund raising event Oct. 25 at Alice Tully Hall in Lincoln Center. Josephine Premice will serve as master of ceremonies for the evening, in which stage, screen and television per formers will take part.

title: BUSINESSMEN GET CONSUMER'S VIEW
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 16 Elisha Gray 2d, chairman of the board of the Whirlpool Cor poration, said today that con sumerism is for realit's not a fad.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meetings are closed to the public and tours have been suspended for the duration of the anniversary session.

title: Population Outlook
description: Is the population bomb defused? Census Director George H. Brown thinks it has been. He cites data show ing that American women are having fewer children, and he views as probably too high the oftquoted estimate that the United States will have 300 million persons in the year 2000. Tomorrow's population problems in this country, he suggests, will arise more from the changed composition of the American people than from explosive numerical growth.

title: Memorial Services
description: UNTERMEYERJean Starr, family and friends of Jean Starr Untermever an nounce a memorial service to be held in her honor on Sunday afternoon, Oct. 18th. 1970 at 3 P.M., In the Community Church, 40 East 35th St., NYC.

title: Locust Valley Turns Back Trinity School Eleven, 260
description: Locust Valley Friends regis tered its first football victory of the season yesterday by de feating Trinity School, 260, on a muddy field at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx. The victors scored touchdowns in every pe riod against Trinity, which lost its fourth game against no, vic tories. Locust. Valley's record is now 13.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Citing what he called an insurrection by Quebec separatists, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada invoked emer gency wartime powers yesterday and, in effect, outlawed the Quebec Liberation Front, the separatist group that kidnapped two officials. The police used the new power to make searches and arrests without war rants to seize more than 250 persons across Quebec. [Page 1, Column 8; Text, P. 12.1

title: Mrs. Carner's 67 Leads
description: WACO, Tex., Oct. 16 (UPI) Mrs. JoAnne Carner shot the best round of her professional career todaya 5underpar 67 and took a threestroke first round lead in the $17,000 Qual ity Chek'd open. Tied for sec ond were Mrs. Marlene Hagge and Arnie Amizich.

title: SPORADIC SHOOTING IS HEARD IN AMMAN
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Oct. 16 (UPI)Sporadic shooting broke out in downtown Amman last night after Government secu rity forces stopped a civilian car loaded with copies of Fa tah, the guerrillas official newspaper. One guerrilla was reported dead of gunshot wounds.

title: Treasury Economist Cautions Against Faster Money Growth
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Oct. 16  The senior consultant to the Treasury issued a strong warning today against more expansive Federal spending and faster growth in the money supply.

description: Friday, Oct. 16, 1970

title: Animal Kingdom Ball Discontinued
description: The Animal Kingdom Ball, one of the hardiest of a species of charity benefits that has flourished here for years, is extinct.

title: DUKE CANNON 2D IN $55,600 EVENT
description: Mike Smithwick scratched Vocalist from the $55,600 Tem ple Gwathmey steeplechase handicap at the last minute yes terday, apparently figuring that Top Bid could get the job done by himself.

title: 2 Court Clerks Arrested On Bookmaking Charges
description: Two court clerks were arrested yesterday on book making charges in the Civil Court garage at 111 Centre Street.

title: Louis Cheerfully Leaves Hospital
description: DENVER, Oct 16 (UPI) Joe Louis left the Veterans Administration Hospital here today after a fivemonth stay for treatment of an emotional disorder.

title: Beame Urges an Increase In City Borrowing Power
description: The city's borrowing power for public Improvements for the 197172 capital budget should be increased by $124.4million, to a total of $776.3million, Controller Abraham D. Beame recommended yesterday.

title: Moscow's First Skyjacking
description: The Soviet Union has now joined the increasing num ber of nations whose planes have been successfully captured in flight and forced to land in another country. The attempted resistance by the Soviet crewresistance akin to that which foiled some earlier efforts to hijack Soviet planesnot only failed this time, but resulted in several casualties. The whole tragic incident made plainer than ever that this sort of aerial crime is not limited in its impact by any consideration of politics or ideology, nor are the planes of any nation immune.

title: Black U.S. Aide Bids Ghettos Fight Crime
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16The only Negro on the Federal Re serve Board, Dr. Andrew F. Brimmer, said today that it was time for black leaders to take a more active role in the fight against crime, despite the risk of providing political ammuni tion to white racists.

title: LUCIA WELCOMED ON RETURN TO MET
description: The Metropolitan Opera's first Lucia di Lammermoor of the season on Thursday night came equipped with full cast of robust voices and that most valuable theatrical property of all, an audience that swallowed every note with gusto and cheered the furniture at each curtain rise. It was one of those nights when rich pro duction, vocal and scenic, could almost obscure the fact that Donizetti's drama fizzled on a damp fuse.

title: Boston Woman, 23 Dies After Abortion Performed in Office of Physician Here
description: A 23yearold woman diedi of internal bleeding last week after her uterus was perforated; during an abortion in a physi cian's office here.

title: CASTILLO TAKES CROWN ON COAST
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Oct. 16 (UPI)  Chucho Castillo of Mexico captured the world bantamweight title tonight when Dick Young, the referee, halted the fight with previously un beaten Ruben Olivares, the champion, at 2:37 of the 14th round because of cuts.

title: MRS. NEIL S. BISHOP
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Oct. 16 (UPI)Mrs. Doris B. Bishop, wife of the Republican candi date for the Senate, died yes terday after suffering a cere bral hemorrhage. She was 67 years old and had been in a coma since Sept. 29.

title: Soviet Pressing Demand For Return of Hijackers
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 16The So viet Union today pressed its effort for the extradition of the two men who hijacked a Soviet airliner yesterday and forced it to land in Turkey.

title: PRICES ON AMEX DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to retreat yesterday as the list fell sharply in quiet trading.

title: Noel Sale, Aiding 7 Beneficiaries, To Start Oct. 26
description: Booths for the 11th annual Christmas sale of Les Bou tiques de Noel will be set up in the Westbury Hotel's lob by and on the mezzanine and part of the third floor for four days starting Oct. 26.

title: 23d District House Race at a Glance
description: POPULATION  According to the 1960 Census, the 23d Congressional District, as cur rently constituted, has a pop ulation of 409,302. A bed room district with only one factory, it includes communi ties like Riverdale in the north, which is wealthy, and Morrisania in the south, largely black, Puerto Rican and very poor. In addition there are a number of elderly people whose sons and daugh ters have grown up and moved away.

title: False Fire Alarms Add to City Costs
description: The Fire Department re ported yesterday that half of all the alarms coming in from the city's 14,000 streetcor ner fire alarm boxes are false.

title: Ottinger Campaigns With Clockwork
description: The Senate campaign of Representative Richard L. Ottinger began nine months ago and you can still set your watch by it.

title: Miller's Art: City in a Dimmed Light
description: The American painter Ken neth Hayes Miller (18761952) is an artist who once en joyed a certain celebrity on the New York art scene. For 38 years he was a teacher at the Art Students League. Among his many students were such wellknown paint ers as Marsh, Bellows, Kuni yoshi, Hopper and Hartley as well as Lloyd Goodrich, for mer director of the Whitney Museum of American Art.

title: TWO SOVIET VESSELS AT A 2D CUBAN PORT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16  Two Soviet ships whose de parture from Cuba last week end reduced tension over whe ther the Russians were trying to build a base for missile sub marines at Cienfuegos, have re turned to another Cuban port, the Defense Department dis closed today.

title: STOCKS END DAY WITH A DECLINE
description: After two days of gains, the stock market closed lower yes terday in listless trading.

title: Princeton Harriers Triumph
description: Princeton defeated St. Jo seph's and Fordham in a double dual crosscountry meet at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx yesterday. Princeton beat St. Joseph's, 2728, and Fordham 2433. St. Joseph's defeated Fordham, 2036. Ed Grippe, a Fordham junior, finished first, with a 25:41 clocking over the fivemile course.

title: Pressures on Turkey
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 16 The hijacking of a Soviet Plane to Turkey by two Lithuanians has placed the Government here under painfully conflict ing pressures.

description: ROME. Oct. 16About 4,500 soldiers were sent today to Reggio Calabria, the city in the south that has been convulsed by intermittent violence since July.

title: Jury Verdict at Kent State
description: The special Ohio grand jury has placed the main bur den of blame for last spring's fatal campus disorders Kent State on the university administration, which it accuses of having fostered an attitude of laxity, over indulgence and permissiveness with its students and faculty.

title: Sales Also Advance
description: The Caterpillar Tractor Com pany realized a 34.7 per cent increase in third quarter earn ings on a sales gain of 19.9 per cent. Profits for the nine months, however, dipped 4.3 per cent, with sales 6.4 per cent higher, the Peoria, Ill., based manufacturer of earth moving machinery and equip ment, reported yesterday.

title: HUK LEADER SLAIN BY TWO INFORMERS
description: MANILA, Oct. 16Pedro Taruc, commander of the Huk balahap guerrillas in the Philip pines, was shot to death this afternoon by two civilian in formers who led an army unit to his house not far from the United States Clark Air Force Base, 50 miles northwest of here.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange were narrowly mixed yesterday as a late rally re versed an initial downward trend.

title: U.S. Use of Sweeping Powers Is Doubted
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16The White House today discounted the possibility that the United States Government wouldor couldever invoke sweeping emergency powers to combat political subversion similar to those put in force in Canada.

title: Do as I Say, Not as I Do
description: LONDON, Oct. 16For those of us in the middle class majority, few things are more grating about the radical young than their skepticism at our democratic faith. Your democ racy is just sham, they say. The vote gives only an illusion of power. The forces that really hold power the big corporations, the military, the entrenched politicianssee that they never lose it.

title: Ending Polarization on Campus
description: I have a nagging; nightmare, though as yet I can't accept it as prophecy. It's the notion of a Permanent Strike, not in mine and shop and mill (the old revnhitionary dream) but in the universities.

description: LONDON, Oct. 16  Prime Minister Heath met for 100 minutes tonight with leading black African opponents of proposed British arms sales to South Africa, and neither side moved an inch.

title: One Adult Cell Used to Produce Frog
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 16Scien tists in Britain have demon strated experimentally that single adult specialized cell, such as a skin cell, contains all the genetic information needed to produce a complete creature with skin, bones, organs and everything else.

title: The Magical Props Of Store's Displays Find Ready Buyers
description: CARLE PLACE, L. I., Oct. 16  The several hundred suburban housewives, and a few husbands, who came bursting through the doors of Abraham & Straus's ware house here this morning would have made a swarm of locusts look like a bunch of lazy butterflies.

description: LONDON, Oct. 16Princess Margaret lowered her hems this weekand the British press lowered the boom.

title: KLEINWORT BENSON SIGNS AN OIL PACT,
description: ST. JOHN'S, Newfoundland, Oct. 16 (UPI)Financial agree ments paving the way for con struction of a $155million oil refinery at Come By Chance, Newfoundland, were signed to day by Kleinwort Benson, Ltd., of London, acting on behalf of a syndicate of banks.

title: 3,184,307 Jersey Voters
description: TRENTON, Oct. 16 (AP) New Jersey has 3,184,307 registered voters for the Nov. 3 election, the Secretary of State's office reported today. The figure about 55,000 fewer than for last year's guberna torial election but 66,372 more than for the last United States Senate election in 1966. In gubernatorial elections, when many statewide offices are at stake registrations nprmally run higher than in offyear elections.

title: AETNA WILL BUY HOTEL OPERATOR
description: The Aetna Life and Casualty Company announced yesterday that it had reached an agree ment in principle to buy all of the outstanding stock of the Dunfey Family Corporation, operator of 12 hotels and mo tor inns, including the Parker House in Boston. The price will be 385,000 shares of Aetna common stock plus contingency payments not to exceed $9million in Aetna stock, the company said. The agreement is subject to approval of Aetna's board and Dunfey's shareholders.

title: POST VANQUISHES GETTYSBURG, 357
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Oct. 17 Gary Wichard threw two touchdown passes and Len Izzo, a sophomore, caught two touchdown passes today as C. W. Post defeated Gettysburg, 357, for their fourth straight victory.

title: Deborah Ann Munsell Is Bride of Raymond Hartz Jr., Broker
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N. J., Oct. 17Miss Deborah Ann Munsell, daughter of Mrs. Robert Edwin Munsell of Beverly, Mass., and the late Mr. Munsell, was married here this afternoon to Ray mond Emory Hartz Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Hartz of Bernardsville.

title: Union Opposes Imports
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 (AP) The International Union of Electrical Workers announced today that it was distributing more than one million leaflets around the nation expressing opposition to imports.

title: George Hall Weds Marion Symington
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 Miss Marion E. Symington, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd Symington, and George Emlen Hall, son of Mr. and Mrs. I. Davis Hall of New Canaan, Conn., were married here today in the garden of the bride's parent's home.

title: Three views of the great beast
description: Alexis de Tocqueville warned us that a majority could be tyrannical and that it would be most oppressive when we knew it least Then, the majority becomes the great beast that Hamilton thought it, a horde in which individual faces are lost, changing its shape and disposi tion in strange ways, now smil ing, now growling, gentle and ravening by turns. Unknown, the majority in a country of 200 million becomes a night mare creature and it does not change the fact that some are so oppressed by fear of it as to convince themselves that it is the best of friends. Our dis trust and praise of the majority reflect our hopes and fears, not our knowledge, and ulti mately, a picture of the many is a portrait of our secret selves.

title: Civil Rights Enforcement: A Mixed Picture
description: Effective
