description: Best Seller List

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Dressing babies and chil dren up to 5 years of age is an important segment of the apparel trade and recent demographic studies indicate that it is destined for im provement during the nine teenseventies. The baby population is increasing de spite the trend toward smaller families.

title: Kathleen Carpenter Is Wed on Coast
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Oct. 17Miss Kathleen Carpenter, daughter of Capt. Melvin James Carpenter, U.S.N., and Mrs. Carpenter, was married here today to Stephen Biklen, son of Mr and Mrs. Paul Frederick Biklen of Westport, Conn.

title: Barbirolli and Bernstein: Two Views of Verdi
description: IN 1951, New Yorkers had a chance to hear within the space of two months two extraordinary inter pretations of Verdi's Requiem. One was given at the Metro politan Opera House under the direction of Bruno Wal ter, with Zinka Milanov, Elena Nikolaidi, Jan Peerce and Cesare Simi as soloists. The other had Toscanini conduct ing his NBC Symphony in Carnegie Hall, where the solo ists were Herva Nelli, Fedora Barbieri, Giuseppe di Stefano and Siepi.

title: TWO WOMEN GOLFERS TIE FOR LEAD AT 138
description: WACO, Tex., Oct. 17 (UPI) Kathy Whitworth shot a five underpar 67 today to move into a tie with the firstround leader. Mrs. JoAnn Carner, in the 617,000 Quality Chek'd women's open golf. Each has a fourunderpar 138.

title: Coast Guard Plans To Keep the Lakes Free of Ice Longer
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 17 (AP) The Coast Guard will try to keep Great Lakes shipping lanes open through January this winter, extending the lake ship ping season to 11 months.

title: McMillan Cup Regatta Is Scheduled for Next Weekend
description: In a fall racing season that began last month, more than 60 intersectional events and major championships or regat tas are scheduled by the Inter collegiate Yacht Racing Asso ciation of North America.

title: Muhlenberg Beats Ursinus With Ground Attack, 3312
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Oct. 17 Muhlenberg rolled to a 3312 vitcory over Urinus ttoday be fore a Homecoming Day crowd of 3,500.

title: Prairie Partisans Move to Save Grasslands
description: PLAINFIELD, III., Oct. 17 There are people who love the prairie as others love the sea.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: Just when everyone thought investors had regained that oldtime religion after the long bear market, and were going to buy only bluechip stocks, the speculative sector of the market has begun to flare up again.

title: FANELLI STANDOUT FOR ST. JOSEPH'S
description: Powerful St. Joseph's of West New York made Weehawken its fourth straight victim, 3614, yesterday as Don Fanelli scored three touchdowns for the third time this season.

title: Yonkers Track to Honor Its Chief Photographer
description: Michael Cipriani, for years the chief photographer at Yonkers Raceway, will bek honored at a testimonial din, ner on Wednesday, Oct: 28, at 7:30 P.M., at the Tropical Acres Restaurant in Yonkers.

title: Calendar of Horse Show Events
description: Short Hills Farm, Evesham Road, Cherry Hill, N. J. Green, limit, amateurowner and junior working hunters; pleasure, po nies, equitation. 9 A.M.

title: Headliners
description: Henry A. Kissinger may be the serious man behind President Nixon's foreign poli cies, but he's also known as the Playboy of the Western Wing of the White House. It was this lighter, bachelor side of Mr. Kissinger's life that caught special atten tion during a TV profile of him last week. One who threw some light on the Presi dential aide's social life was Barbara Ho war, Washington hostess and occasional companion of Mr. Kissinger. She said he has everything that would make for a swingerexcept the time.

title: NEW ZEALAND RULE IS RAISING PROTEST
description: SUVA, Fiji, Oct. 14A new regulation that unmarried adult women from Western Samoa who wish to enter New Zea land must first take a test showing that they are not pregnant has raised a storm of protest among southern Pa cific women's leaders and polit ical circles.

title: JAVITS REMINDS U.N. OF U.S. GOAL ON AID
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 17  Senator Jacob K. Javits, in a speech before the General Assembly today, said that the United States had publicly accepted the goal of 1 per cent of the nation's income for aid to developing countries, through public and private sources, but that it had not accepted any deadline for reaching the goal.

title: TexasEl Paso Triumphs
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Oct. 17 (UPI)University of Texas El Paso got sharp passing from its quarterback, Bill Craigo, and scored 30 points in the second half en route to a 4137 Western Athletic Conference triumph over Colorado State University today. Craigo, throwing for 507 yards, a Utep record, fired two touchdown passes.

title: Montclair Scores on Sleeper Play, 76
description: Brooks Sleeper, a breakaway runner with deceptive speed, returned a kickoff 80 yards for a touchdown yesterday and paved the way for a major up set in Montclair's 76 victory over previously unbeaten Nut ley.

title: NAVY IS CRUSHED BY AIR FORCE, 263
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17Un defeated Air Force, which has been making quite a reputation for itself in the West with five victories, continued to thrive in the East today, sinking Navy, 263, before 46,414 fans in John F. Kennedy Stadium.

title: Court Test On College Closing
description: Last May, in the aftermath of Cambodia and Kent State, New York University joined a long list of colleges which canceled regular classes and gave faculty and students a number of op tions for finishing the semester and receiving credit for their courses. Last week, Roger Payn ter, a fireman who lives in Queens, was awarded $277.40 in refunded tuition when a Small Claims Court upheld his claim that the university had defaulted on its contract to teach his son Raymond, a sophomore in art education.

title: The Gym Class Is Called a FourStar Bust
description: About twice a weekif they haven't wheedled written ex cuses from their parents youngsters in schools across the country set down their pencils and books, pick up their sneak ers and head for the gym for physical education. This is required by law in most states on the ground that growing chil dren need regular exercise.

title: HORACE GREELEY EXTENDS STREAK
description: Horace Greeley, Ossining, Harrison and Pleasantville maintained their allwinning status yesterday. John Jay of Cross River, Roosevelt of Yonkers, and Briarcliff also re mained undefeated and untied.

title: Virginia Tech Vanquishes Tulsa in First Victory, 1714
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Oct. 17 (UPI)  Tom Mikulski dashed 23 yards with an intercepted pass today to give Virginia Tech a 1714 victory over Tulsa for its first success of the year after five losses.

title: Washington and Lee Wins From Tufts Eleven, 3534
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Oct. 17 (AP)Steve Fluhart, a sopho more quarterback, ran for three touchdowns and passed for a fourth to lead Washing ton and Lee to a 3534 victory over Tufts today.

title: Canada Recognizes Peking but U. N. Entry Unlikely
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. At a news conference here last Wednesday, Mitchell Sharp, the Secretary of External Affairs of Canada, said that his country's recognition of Communist Chi na had done more than any thing else to hasten the seating of the Peking regime in the United Nations.

title: Stony Brook Wins, 41
description: Stony Brook State College retained its lead in the Metro politan Collegiate Soccer Con ference's Division II by posting a 41 victory over secondplace Manhattan at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx yesterday.

title: Letters: Why Do You Pick on Haiti?
description: To THE EDITOR: With reference to Joseph B. Treaster's article on Haiti (Travel Section, Sept. 27), I don't understand why the news papers are all so insistent upon rubbing it in that Haiti is in the grip of a dicta torship. It certainly doesn't stop Amer icans from going to Barcelona and Se ville, where recently the police fired at a group of priests and students who were protesting repression. Spain has been going through enormous changes, but it is still a repressive dictatorship. Tourism is a major reason for the up surge in Spain's economy.

title: Mrs. Ecker Has Child
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Oct. 17A daughter was horn on Oct. 5 to Dr. and Mrs. Howard M. Ecker in the Bos ton LyingIn Hospital. The child has been named Merrill Lee. Her father is a plastic surgeon.

title: Economy: No Reason Yet for Loud Cheers
description: When the Nixon Administra tion took office 20 months ago, its primary economic job was to stop the inflation that it had inherited from the Johnson Ad ministration. The job was complicated by Mr. Nixon's deter mination to avoid a recession and any sizable increase in un employment. At his first press conference after taking office, the President said, I want to emphasize that we believe it is possible to control inflation without increasing unemploy ment in, certainly, any sub stantial way.

title: LOUD FINISHES 2D
description: Refuting the notion that three strikes means you're out, Fort Marcy finally won the Man o War Stakes yesterday at ice boxlike Belmont Park.

title: Kids who crave approval
description: ONE brand of breakfast cereal has been promoting a magic gun: shoot it, and out comes a white cloud that turns enemies into friends. The gun is a fantasy of the advertising world, but behavioral studies suggest that this gun will have great ap peal for certain children who have a craving for approval. Investigations into the approval motive show why some children need more approval than others, and what psychologists can pre dict about the child with a high need for approval.

title: Air Force Nurse Loses Her Plea Against Discharge for Pregnancy
description: McCHORD AIR FORCE BASE, Wash., Oct. 17  Susan R. Struck, an Air Force rurse, is 26 years old, single and preg nant.

title: Mrs. Joan L. Hitchcock Married To Harold R. T. Goodriough 3d
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 17 Mrs. Joan Lundberg Hitch cock, a former wife of the late Fremont B. (Pete) Hitch cock, the polo player, and Harold Robert Thaddeus Goodnough 3d were married here today at the bride's Pacific Heights home.

title: Stage: Solzhenitsyn Play
description: MINNEAPOLISIt is un questionably a very consider able coup for the Minnesota Theater Company to have ac quired, although without the author's direct permission, the world premiere of the first play by the Soviet novel ist Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn. And the coup has been for tuitously magnified by Sol zhenitsyn's recently winning the Nobel Prize for Literature.

title: Photography
description: COLOGNE AUTOMATION again was a catchword during the 11th Photokina ex hibition of products, pictures and films which pned here on Oct. 3 for a nineday program of activity reflecting world progress in the craft, as well as the art of photography.

title: Penguins Sign Bathgate
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 17 (AP) The Pittsburgh Penguins of the National Hockey League have signed Andy Bathgate to a con tract, a spoksman said today. Bathgate, who will play center, started in the N.H.L. in 1953 with the New York Rangers. In 12 years with the team he set season records for goals and assists, and holds the Ranger scoring mark.

title: The New Movies
description: THE GREAT WHITE HOPE, Howard Sackler's screen adaptation of his play, di rected by Martin Ritt, is a polemical, black Passion Play about Jack Jefferson, a lightly fictionalized ver sion of Jack Johnson who, in 1908, knocked out Tom my Burns of Canada to be come the first black heavy weight champion of the world, writes Vincent Can by. The film, like the play, progresses in terms of high ly stylized scenes that dramatize Jack Jefferson's initial triumph, his subse quent persecution and his humiliations as if they were the Stations of the Cross. The Great White Hope is one of those liberal, well meaning, fervently uncon troversial works that pre tend to tackle contemporary problems by finding anal ogies at a safe remove in history. However, the film contains a performance that makes the windy, otherwise empty movie seem inhab ited, if not by life, at least by art. James Earl Jones, who recreates the role of Jack Jefferson he played on Broadway, is marvelous to watch, combining heroic physical presence, tech nique and (to me) a com pletely mysterious way of projecting intelligence, so that the character com mands attention even when.

title: The girl on the wedding cake
description: We are all prone these days to gloomy laughter or comic de spair as we consider our lives in consumerdom, the country where in the end we find our selves consumedthat is, con verted into waste by the things we acquire, the goods and pack aged ideas dispensed along the supermarket aisles of our cul ture. In this first novel, how ever, a female hand gives an extra twist to the switchblade. The Canadian poet Margaret Atwood has written a work of feminist black humor, in which she seems to say that a wo man is herself likely to become another edible product, mar keted for the male appetite that has been created (or, at least, organized) by the media.

title: Nijinsky Defeated by a 1007 Shot
description: NEWMARKET, England, Oct. 17The dream is completely shattered. Charles W. Engel hard's colt Nijinsky, once her alded as the horse of the cen tury, went down to dismal defeat again today in the $87,300 Champion Stakes here. Nijinsky was beaten by a length and a half by Lorenzaccio a 1007 shot, with Hotfoot third, a neck back of Nijinsky.

title: A MANSON MOTIVE IS HEARD AT TRIAL
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 17The jury in the trial of Charles M. Manson got an insight this week into the possible motive, as the prosecution seems to see it, for the murder of the actress Sharon Tate and her friends in August of 1969.

title: Gardens
description: FLOWER arrangement has a new concept known as Creativity. This 20th century style en courages the expression of ab stract Ideas and experimentation with plant materials. When used for qualities of color, form, texture and pattern ra ther than for customary botanical asso ciations, flowers and foliage become an art medium similar to paint and metals. A rose, for example, would symbolize a round, red, abstract shape instead of a specific type of bloom.

title: Text of Chief Judge Fuld's Statement on Courts
description: Following is the text of a statement by Chief Judge Stanley H. Fuld, chairman of the Administrative Board of the Judicial Conference:

title: ARABS HOSTAGES WERE NEAR FRONT
description: AMMAN, Jordan Oct. 13 The house where 32 American] hostages were held is less than 200 yards from the front line of one of the critical battles of the Jordanian civil war last month.

title: Births
description: SHEPARDMr. & Mrs. Richard (nee Susan Wolff). announce the birth of Lee Bennett's sister, Alexandra Jill, on October 9, 1970 at New Rochelle Hospital.

title: Dennis. Hopper!
description: HENRY FONDA said I was an idiot? Wow! Dennis Hop per's voicesoft and friendly and lucidcomes to me long distance from his home in Taos, New Mexico, where he is editing The Last Movie. I guess it just goes to show you what the establishment view or me is. Of course, I did make his son a star in Easy Rider. But so far as Henry Fonda's not wanting to work with me, he doesn't really have to worry. Be cause, frankly, I find the man a bore. He hasn't done a good movie in 10 years. I admired him in The Grapes of Wrath, but I'd say he had a pretty good director there in John Ford, wouldn't you?

title: Montclair State Triumphs Over Bridgeport Team, 21 0
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Oct. 17Montclair State's eleven gained its fourth victory in five games tonight, downing Bridgeport by 210.

title: Striking Auto Workers Attend Class
description: LIVONIAi Mich., Oct. 17 The guys don't mind being on strike as long as they know what's going on, said Jim Shroat of the United Auto Workers Local 262 in this De troit suburb.

title: CASTILLO TO GIVE RIVAL A REMATCH
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 17 (AP) Twice in the last two years Jesus (Chucho) Castillo had failed in attempts to win the world bantamweight boxing championship. But last night the 26yearold fighter suc ceeded and he is now king of the 118pound class.

title: New Hampshire Aerials Subdue Vermont, 27 to 0
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Oct. 16 Paced by a senior quarterback, Bob Hopkins, New Hampshire rolled to a 270 victory over Vermont today, spoiling the Catamount's Homecoming game.

title: Arizona State Wins, 273; Punt Returned 94 Yards
description: PROVO, Utah, Oct. 17 (UPI) Steve Holden returned a first period punt 94 yards for touchdown and J. D. Hill ram bled 69 yards for a fourth period score as Arizona State remained undefeated with a 27 3 victory over Brigham Young today.

title: Three Debutantes Bow at Tuxedo Ball
description: TUXEDO PARK, N. Y., Oct. 17  Three debutantes were presented tonight in the Tuxedo Clnb at the 81st an nual Tuxedo Autumn Ball, the oldest debutante party in the New York area.

title: Claridge First at Freehold; Filion Drives 4 Winners
description: FREEHOLD, N. J.P Oct. 17 Claridge, owned by D. H. Wal lach of Greenhill Farms, Pa., and Herve Filion, North Amer ica's leading driver, shared honors today at Freehold Race way.

title: TAIWAN WORRIED OVER U.N. STATUS
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Oct. 17The Chinese Nationalist Government is maintaining an official calm ness towards Canada's estab lishment of relations with Com munist China.

title: Lines Here Are Planning More WeekLong Cruises
description: The expanding winter cruise field is increasingly committed to a new tackoneweek ex cursions.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Dave. Concepcion the 22yearold Vene zuelan, wasn't given a starting call for the Reds in the first two games of the World Series, presumably because he is highstrung and emotional. But then man ager Sparky Anderson decided the time had come to toss this tall, lean youngster into the heat of battle.

title: C.C.N.Y. 31 Soccer Victor
description: After falling behind in the third quarter, City College's sec ond team rallied to defeat New Haven College, 31, at Lewisohn Stadium yesterday. Eugene Raw czak, Ivan Mino and Ronnie Zuckerman each scored for the Beavers, who raised their sec ond to 421.

title: Harvard Tops Cornell, 21, In Soccer, on Gomez Goal
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 17 Solomon Gomez blasted in rebound shot with 55 seconds remaining in the game to lead Harvard to a 24 Ivy League soccer victory over Cornell.

title: Union Sets Back R.P.I. 11th Straight Time, 14.0
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Oct. 17  Union College defeated Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute for the 11th straight time to day, 140, as defense played part in the offense of both sides, with Union getting the edEe.

title: 5 Begin 2Month Stay At Bottom of Caribbean
description: GREAT LAMESHUR BAY, St. John, Virgin Islands, Oct. 17 (UPI)Two Ameri cans, two Germans and a Frenchman have begun a twoweek stay at the bottom of the Caribbean Sea.

title: Like Becky Sharp, Kay was fast on her feet
description: A pretty girl named Kay alias Catalina Garcia, Catalina Goznez, Mrs. Jeremy Wilsonis the title character of this novel, with its entertaining combina tion of Western shape, Eastern character and fictional hocus pocus. The places are Tokyo. Manila and Shanghai. The time is 19471949when, though the West was recovering from war, the East still remained in chaos, with friend indistin guishable from foe, savagery as common as mercy, kindness and love the greatest rarities, and ideology crowding out mo rality.

title: Loss First of Season
description: It had to happen sometime. The Knicks, whose project for the next six months is the defense of their National Bas ketball Association champion ship, played poorly at Madison Square Garden last night and lost to the Chicago Bulls, 9996.

title: 100 MILES AN HOUR MINIMUM FOR CLUB
description: A 100mileanhour outboard club has been formed by Evin rude Motors, which holds the world's outboard speed record of 131.051 miles an hour, as well as the multiengine and singleengine world outboard racing championships.

title: Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: 1971 Outboards: More Punch
description: Evinrude Motors of Milwau kee parlayed the 99.6cubicinch engine that holds the world outboard racing championship into an allpurpose family out board for 1971, while Johnson Motors, with five new models, has combined more power with smaller packages as its 1971 highlight. Both companies are divisions of Outboard Marine Corporation.

title: SMITH, OSBORNE IN TENNIS FINAL
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Oct. 17 (UPI)  Secondseeded Stan Smith and unseeded Jim Os borne won twoset matches to day and moved to the final of the $25,000 Thunderbird open tennis tournament.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: Today  Poughkeepsie Sports Car Club T.S.D. 75mile rally; start at Gibson's Colonial Inn, Red Oaks Hill, Poughkeepsie, N. Y. Registration: 11 A.M., first car off noon.

title: EDWARD A. M'GRATH
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Oct. 17 Edward A. McGrath, former Union County judge, died yes terday at the Alexian Brothers Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 960 Park Avenue here.

title: Parisians Who Want to Meet U.S. Tourists
description: PARISAs many a visitor has learned to his chagrin, the French are a reserved people, slow to befriend any stranger, even a fellow Frenchman. The ebullient American with a smattering of the French language who expects his two weeks in Paris to yield a bumper crop of new pals is most often disappointed.

title: MISSOURI BEATEN
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Oct. 17 Trailing for the first time this season, unbeaten Notre Dame rebounded with three touch downs in the last 23 minutes today and registered a rugged 247 victory over Missouri.An overflow crowd of 64,200 in Memorial Stadium  the largest ever for a sporting event in the ShowMe Stateroared defiantly early in the third quarter when the twicebeaten Tigers, trailing, 30, at half time, took a 73 lead on a 10 yard touchdown pass from Mike Farmer to Mel Gray.

title: FAIRFIELD CAPTURES INDOOR POLO FINAL
description: DARIEN, Conn., Oct. 17The Fairfield County Hunt Club rolled to a 1912 victory over Shallowbrook tonight to win the George C. Sherman Me morial fivegoal indoor polo championship at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club.

title: INDIANA'S COMEBACK TOPS ILLINOIS, 3024
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Oct. 17 (UPI)  Sparked by John Deb bout's 28yad touchdown run with a pass interception, In diana rallied for two touch downs and a field goal in the final 11 minutes today to beat Illinois, 3024.

title: A.A.U. SENDS TRIO ON TOUR OF ISRAEL
description: A swimmer, Mark Lambert; his coach, A.R. Barr, and a wrestling coach, Henry Witten berg, will leave New York to day for Israel.

title: Welfare Not Dead But It's Breathing Hard
description: WASHINGTON  There was an appropriately wistful note to the statement that the Secre tary of Health, Education and Welfare, Elliott Richardson, is sued last Wednesday.

title: McBarney Passer Hits For Six SixPointers
description: Gene Healy had a day to be remembered yesterday. The young quarterback for the McBurney School threw for six touchdowns and gained a total of 293 yards with his passes as Ms team crushed Fieldston, 620, on the loser's field in the Bronx.

title: The Jefferson Airplane is an unscheduled trip
description: The Jefferson Airplane is an unscheduled trip

title: BALLOT TEAMING UNDER CHALLENGE
description: Representatives of Senator Charles E. Goodell and Arthur J. Goldberg have raised ques tions with the Board of Elec tions about the teaming up of Governor Rockefeller and James L. Buckley in their peti tion nominations on this fall's New York City ballot. They have suggested the display may be misleadingand possi bly illegal.

title: BUSINESS SUBSIDY TO HELP NEWARK
description: NEWARK, Oct. 17Members of the business community here have agreed to augment the municipal salary of a proposed Business Administrator for Newark by $2,500 a year for four years.

title: California Bows, 2421
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Oct. 17 (UPI)Dennis Dummit, passing on every play except two in a desperate lastminute drive, ran 3 yards for the gamewinning touchdown with four seconds left today to give University of California, Los Angeles, a 2421 victory over California.

title: Adams Calls Governor Goodell's Twin
description: AUBURN, N. Y., Oct. 17 Dr. Paul L. Adams Poeused his attacks in upstate campaigning today on Governor Rockefeller through Senator Ohars E. Goaded.

title: DeGo Hubert Wins at Gloucester County Dog Show for His 29th Top Award
description: HURFFVILLE, N. J., Oct. 17 Ch. DeGo Hubert, 4yearold West Highland white terrier owned by Jane Esther Hender son of Stockton, N. J., defeated 1,253 rivals today in winning the bestinshow title at the 15th annual Gloucester County Kennel Club event.

title: Stanford Seeks Repayment
description: STANFORD, Calif., Oct. 17 (AP)Private collection agen cies will try to collect about 1,100 delinquent loans made to Stanford University students over the last 20 years and totaling $458,000, a school offi cial says.

title: OTTINGER TOURS HARLEM STREETS
description: On windwhipped Manhattan streets, Representative Richard L. Ottinger yesterday heard vot ers complaints and questions, shook their hands and began, the last two weeks of the long campaign he hopes will take him into the United States Senate.

title: KNUDSON LEADER IN GOLF WITH 214
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Oct. 17 (AP)George Knudson took a onestroke lead today in the third round of the $22,400 Wills Masters professional golf tournament while yesterday's leader, Terry Kendall, fell into a threeway tie for third.

title: Union Picks Soccer Captains
description: Chris Swan, a halfback from Westport, Conn., and Robert Dodd, a forward from Lexing ton, Mass., have been elected cocaptains of the 1970 Union College soccer team.

title: Katharine Meister Is Married To William Miller 4th, Analyst
description: MENTOR, Ohio, Oct. 17 Miss Katharine Elizabeth Meister, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Lewis Meister of Willoughby was married here this afternoon to Wil liam Christian Miller 4th. He is the son of Mr and Mrs. William C. Miller of Engle wood, N. J.

title: Wright Kicks 51Yard Goal
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Oct. 17 (UPI)Dave Wright of Duke kicked an Atlantic Coast Con ference record 51yard field goal in the third period Satur day to break Duke loose for 226 victory over North Caro lina State. The previous mark was a 49yarder by Harold Deters of North Carolina State in 1966.

title: I.L.O. Discusses Impact Of Technology on Seamen
description: GENEVA, Oct. 17The im pact of rapid technological de velopments in the shipping in dustry on the lives of the men who sail the world's merchant navies is the main concern at a 61nation maritime confer ence being held here by the International Labor Organiza tion.

title: Barbara Smol Bride Of Walter F. Higgins
description: Miss Barbara Smol, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Henry Smol, was married yesterday afternoon to Walter F. Higgins, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Hig gins. Both families are of New York.

title: Scene changing
description: When a young couple have inherited or accumulated traditional furniture in the early years of marriage, a problem may arise if their tastes change and they want their apartment to look uptodate. New York stockbroker Sidney Kahn and his wife Maxine were faced with this deco rating dilemma as they became more and more interested in modern art. They decided to keep the furniture they had inherited, fill in around the edges with some modem classics and concentrate on varying the visual mood of the inte rior with contemporary art and modulat ing colors. The resulting rooms pictured here are comfortable enough to accom modate three small children, yet elegant enough for frequent entertaining.

title: Obituary 8  No Title
description: Obituary 8  No Title

title: Upstate Track Lists Record
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Oct. 17 (AP)Finger Lakes Race Track reported today that at tendance this year reached a record 578,498 for 126 days, but parimutuel betting was down 1 per cent from a year ago.

title: F. and M. Routs Dickinson; Prusky Runs 85 for Score
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Oct. 17 Franklin and Marshall trounced Dickinson, 287, in a Middle Atlantic Conference football game today. The Diplomats scored on an 85yard return on a pass interception by Dan Prusky in the last period.

title: Australians Expect No Change
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Oct. 17 Canada's recognition of Com munist China came at a time when Peking was under lively criticism by both the Govern ment and the Opposition in the Australian Parliament.

title: Coins
description: MANY Americans in past years have ap parently been un aware of the great contributions made by this country's Negroes toward the rapid growth of the nation. Very few of their achieve ments have been recorded in school history books, maga zines or the newspapers pri or to the nineteensixties.

title: BOSTON U. DOWNS HOLY CROSS, 3323
description: BOSTON, Oct. 17 (AP)Bos ton University's hardcharging defense set up four touchdowns today and Ted Ryan scored three touchdowns as the Ter riers overpowered Holy Cross, 3323.

title: 76ers Trade Guokas to Bulls
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 17 (AP)The Chicago Bulls obtained Matt Guokas from the Philadelphia 76ers today in exchange for a No. 2 draft chaice in 1971.

title: Egypt at the Crossroads
description: The Egyptian electorate, offered no other choice, has, confirmed the selection of Anwar Sadat to lead the nation, as one official put it, in the path of Nasser.

title: Scraps Of Paper From Vietnam
description: JAMES P. STERBA just completed a 16month tour of duty as a Saigon correspondent for The Times.

title: Religion
description: The Reorganized Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints has traditionally been a sort of halfway house be tween Mormonism and main stream Protestantism. Al though its 170,000 members base their religious beliefs on the writings of the proph et Joseph Smith and accept most of the characteristic doctrinal tenets of the Salt Lake Citybased Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints, they have consistently rejected Mormon practices such as polygamy and the exclusion of Negroes from the priesthood.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17 When an American bites into a hamburger he is, in effect, getting a taste of how an import quota works.

title: Shooting of a Prowler Shocks Prosperous Suburb of Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17  The killing of a 13yearold newsboy early last Monday morning has left the prosper ous northern Virginia suburb of Tall Oaks bewildered, frightened and bitter.

title: Jewish Is Beautiful
description: THE Rothschilds, singing and dancing on Broadway? No, that I didn't figure when I started research on my book. I'd never even heard of Broadway. It was 1939 and I was 14 years old, standing on line with my family and about 600 other Jews in the Vienna Roths child palace. We were there to beseech the new tenants, the Jewish Passport Section of the Gestapo, to let us leave the Austria Hitler had taken over. For ten hours we trembled and inched and starved our way up an alabaster staircase. I remember having to go to the bath room and being sure there wasn't anywhy would Roths childs need a john? And when we finally left, precious passports in hand, I remember the SS man coming in at the door. Under the mighty Rothschild portals, he wiped his shoes briefly before he caught himself.

title: Steinkraus, as Usual, to Head Equestrian Team at National
description: Just as he has for almost two decades, Bill Steinkraus will lead the United States Equestrian Team in the Na tional Horse Show in Madi son Square Garden, Nov. 3 through 10. Steinkraus, the only American to win an equestrian gold medal in the Olympic Games  he scored

title: Tokyo Paper World Biggest
description: TOKYO, Oct. 16 (AP)The 91yearold Asahi Shimbun, one of Japan's five national news papers, has announced that daily circulation of its morning ari evening editions now ex ceeds 10 million, making it the biggest newspaper in the world.

title: Princeton 150Pound Eleven Hands Columbia 12.0 Defeat
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 17 Bill Degolian, the Princeton quarterback, passed for two touchdowns in the second half today in leading the Tiger 150 pound football team to a 120 victory over Columbia.

title: Mrs. Francis Taylor, Widow Of Museum of Art Director
description: Mrs. Pamela Coyne Taylor, widow of Francis Henry Taylor, director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art from 1940 to 1955, died Wednesday in Pa lermo, Italy, where she was visiting a daughter, Mrs. An tonio Simeti. She was 67 years old and lived in Florence, Italy.

title: Irish Love Affair: It Started in Rome
description: THE CLIFFS OF MOHER rise majestical ly 700 feet above the Atlantic, on the west coast of Ireland, south of Galway. I was headed for the cliffs but had lost my way, and I pulled to the side of a country road and inquired directions of an elderly gentleman seated on his porch. It was nippy and the old gent wore his scarf and cap and gloves, puffing on his pipe as he stepped to the, car. Putting his hand on the door jamb, he slowly, with gestures of his pipe hand, gave me detailed instruction. He went on for about five minutes, and soon I had di rections for finding the cliffs and the location of one or two country inns, plus a guide for determining the weather. And then I was answering inquiries about my beginnings, my trip and my health. I started to ease out the clutch, thanking him profusely, and moved the car gently into gear. He hung on. By the time I wrested the car from his strong hand, I must have been moving eight miles an hour. Relinquishing his grip he final ly sent me down the road with a wave and a God Bless!

title: Unionists and Academics Join Forces
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. Oct. 17 A group of Eastern intellec tuals met with labor leaders here last night to fashion a working alliance to fight what they described as reactionary political forces in our country.

title: Toledo 200 Victor
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Oct. 17 (UPI)Tom Duncan kicked 41 and 29 yard field goals and Toledo scored 20 fourthquarter points to break a scoreless tie today and beat MidAmerican Conference foe Western Michi gan. 200.

title: SMALL CITIES HAIL FULL INTEGRATION,
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17At a time of sharp national debate over how much School deseg regation is enough, a number of smaller cities have tried complete Integration and found that it works.

title: PITTSBURGH DUO WINS GOLF BY SHOT
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 17 (AP) John Birmingham reeled off birdies on the 11th, 12th and 13th holes and teamed with Roland Stafford for a 64 today to, capture the United States professionalamateur golf cham pionship by one stroke.

title: A Talk With the Holder Of World Passport No.
description: At one time or another almost every traveler dreams of being a citizen of the world, able to breeze across na tional borders with the wave of a uni versal passport. One man who has ac tually tried to bring this dream to life Garry Davis  the World War 11 bomber pilot who, in 1948, made head lines around the globe by renouncing his United States citizenship and deqlar irig himself a citizen of the world.

title: EPISCOPAL VOTE REJECTS WOVEN
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 17The House of Deputies of the Epis copal Church defeated today move to permit the ordination of women to the priesthood and the episcopacy.

title: SONE TRIM MOVE IS CALLED A PLOY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 17A member of a House subcommit tee that studied the alleged Sonmy massacre in Vietnam to day described as a defense ploy a demand for a tran script of House hearings on the case.

title: Regatta Is Postponed
description: KINGS POINT, N. Y., Oct. 17The start of the twoday Nevins Trophy college regatta at the United States Merchant Marine Academy was post poned today until tomorrow because of 35mileanhour winds and heavy seas.

title: FIJI SEEN AS VOICE OF ISLANDS IN U.N.
description: SUVA, Fiji, Oct. 14Politi cal leaders in the South Pacific islands have hailed the emer gence of newly independent Fiji as the prospective spokesman for the area in the United Na tions.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: Obituary 7  No Title

title: PURDUE. TRIUMPHS OVER IOWA, 24 TO
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, Oct. 17 (UPI) Otis Armstrong broke off tackle for a 63yard scoring run in the third period today to crack open a firsthalf defen sive battle and lead Purdue to a 243 Big Ten Conference vic tory over Iowa.

title: City Is Barred From Joining Suit Against 13 Contractors
description: A Federal judge refused yes terday to allow New York City to join in a suit brought by Consolidated Edison Company accusing 13 contracting con cerns of pricefixing and bid rigging over a 10year period.

title: Shows and Festivals
description: CONSERVATION IN ACTION will be discussed by Dr. Elvis Stahr, president of the National Audubon Socie ty at the Greenwich Garden enter on Wednesday at 2 P.M. The program is the first in a series planned by the conservation committee. The center is located in the Mont gomery pinetum, Bible Street, Cos Cob, Conn. There will be no admission charge.

title: New Commissioner Picked To Head the Detroit Police
description: DETROIT, Oct. 17 (AP) John Nichols, 51 years old, who joined the Detroit police force as a patrolman in 1942, has been named the city's new Po lice Commissioner.

title: PENN VANQUISHES LAFAYETTE, 3120
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 17 (UPI) Bob Hoffman, a sophomore fullback, plunged for two touchdowns in the fourth quar ter, the second with three min utes left, to lead Pennsylvania to a 3120 victory over Lafa yette today.

title: Some News for the Court
description: WASHINGTONThe Supreme Court of the United States has seldom and only at its perilbeen oblivious to the political and social currents moving in the nation. Hence, to the arguments it has heard during the past week on the question of racial balance in the schools, the Court ought to add some remarkable elec tion results from Pasadena.

title: Bettina Benson Bride in Jersey
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 17 In the Princeton University Chapel here this afternoon, Miss Bettina Foy Benson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence E. Benson of Skill man, became the bride of Manuel Benigno Lopez, son of Mr. and Mrs. Manuel Lopez of Havana and of Oviedo, Spain.

title: News of the Camera World
description: THREE new bookstwo technical manuals and one how  to guide  have recently been put out by Amphoto, 915 Broadway, New York, N. Y. 10010.

title: Protests Grow Over Bridge Across Sound
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Oct. 17 Governor Rockefeller, who has angered thousands of Nassau and Westchester County resi dents with his plan to build a bridge across Long Island Sound between Oyster Bay and Rye, has signed several petitions against the project, though he is probably unaware of it.

title: Fireman, 34, Falls To Death at Blaze On the West Side
description: A fireman fell six floors to death yesterday while cutting a hole through the burning roof of a vacant building at 512 West 19th Street.

title: How Safe Is Pot? Tests Raise Serious Questions
description: Marijuana is one of the oldest and most widely used drugs known to man. Yet scientists know less about its safety than they do about many newer drugs. Last week, at a hearing of a committee that is evaluating New York state marijuana laws, a pharmacologist reported find ings from his experiments on animals that raise serious ques tions about the safety of mari juana. What his experiments on pregnant mice and rats mean for humans is not entirely clear. But other recent reports in med ical journals indicate that some physicians are becoming increas ingly concerned about the pos sible adverse effects of marijuana in man.

title: At 17, the Road to Abortion Is Lonely
description: At 2:30 on a Thursday afternoon Carol, a sol emn 17yearold girl from a small Midwestern tourist town, stepped out of the first airplane she had ever been on and walked into the passenger terminal at La Guar dia Airport.

title: Love and Hate on the Nile
description: CAIROSoviet policy in Egypt has been far cleverer than America's, but it hasn't succeeded as well as it de serves. There is no doubt that without Moscow's aid this country would have disintegrated after its 1967 defeat. Likewise, America is regarded here as an adversary. Yet the Russians certainly aren't loved, nor are the Americans hated.

title: CHIEF JUDGE GIVES PLAN TO REDUCE DELAY IN COURTS
description: The state's chief judge an nounced eight administrative steps yesterday to alleviate the serious situation of the criminal case backlog in courts in New York City.

title: Inquiry Calledin Blast That Wrecked C5, World's Largest Plane
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Oct. 17 (UPI)Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and a hastily summoned Air Force board of inquiry sought today to learn the cause of a fire and explosion that killed one man and de stroyed the $23million mas ter model of the C5, the world's largest airplane.

title: letter fro ma friend
description: A series of columns offering advice to travelers about major cities of the worldin this case, a world city celebrating a special occasion.

title: Korean Train Crash Kills 14
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 17 (AP)A passenger train and a freight train collided in a tun nel 55 miles east of Seoul today. The police said 14 persons were killed and 55 injured, most of them high school students.

title: Panther Challenge to Jury Law Concluded in New Haven Court
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 17De fense attorneys for Black Pan thers on trial here for murder are challenging the law allow ing only registered voters to serve as jurors, charging that the system results in an over representation of middleclass whites who are apt to have bigoted attitudes toward blacks.

title: Elizabeth Ann Tweedy Bride Of Marshall Grout Streibert
description: WINONA, Minn., Oct. 17 In the First Congregational Church here this afternoon Miss Elizabeth Ann Tweedy, a researcher with the Whit ney Museum of American Art in New York, was married to Marshall Grout Streibert, who is with the John Price Jones Company, a fundrais ing concern in New York. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. John Kerr.

title: Dartmouth Trounces Brown, 42 to 14, as Chasey, Short and Simms Excel
description: HANOVER, N.H., Oct. 17 Indefeated Dartmouth, behind Jim Chasey and John Short, rolled to a 4214 victory over Brown today before a crowd of 10,436 fans bundled in heavy winter coats.

title: Books:
description: There is still time, argues Robert Theobold, to mend our ways before the carrying ca pacity of the earth is de stroyed. But this requires fun damental changes in eco nomic thinking and practice.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: AWEB of caution spread over the financial mar kets last week as investor concern heightened over the economy, the Federal budget, infla tion and the generally sorry state of corporate earnings reports. Wall Street found little to cheer about in the background news and nothing to validate the rising optimism that had permeated the markets in August and September. By the same token, how ever, there was no evidence that recent economic assessments were going awrya reality that was largely overlooked in the week's spiritless stock and bond trading. On balance, both markets showed little net change for the week.

title: Omolade's Goal Forces Tie
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Oct. 17 A goal by Waheed Omolade in the final period earned Pratt Institute a 11 tie with Mont clair State in a Metropolitan Intercollegiate League soccer game today.

title: PRINCETON BEATS COLGATE BY 3414
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 17 Steve Goepel, Colgate's senior quarterback, completed 16 of 33 passes for 248 yards today, but interceptions and a team mate's fumble proved to be his undoing as Princeton defeated the Red Raiders, 3414, before 19,000 chilled fans in Palmer Stadium.

title: Midtown Center Set Up For Hunters, Anglers
description: Hunting and fishing li censes and information on New York State's recreation and hunting areas are avail able for the first time in mid town Manhattan, according to Henry L. Diamond, Com missioner of the State's De partment of Environmental Conservation.

title: Tories Plans
description: LONDON  Britain's two big political parties, Con servative and Labor, are sometimes described as Tweedledum and Tweedle dee. Although they pay lip service to free enterprise or to a more socialized ap proach, it is said, the parties differ little in essentials.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The McGrawHill Building, whose greentinted brick fa cade has made it a land mark on 42d Street west of Eighth Avenue, has been sold to an Investor who intends to remodel it for general occupancy when the publish ing company moves to its new Rockefeller Center home late next year.

title: Speaking of Books: The Explorer Who Never Left Home
description: Arthur Waley selected the jewels of Chinese and Japanese literature and pinned them quietly to his chest. No one has ever done anything like it before, and no one will ever do so again.

title: TURKS ASK U.S. AID IN FIGHT ON CHOLERA
description: ANKARA. Turkey, Oct. 17 Turkey has asked the United States for five million shots of anticholera vaccine to fight a spreading epidemic in Istanbul and nearby areas.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: The picture of contempo rary radicalism painted by Philip Green in his essay, Can it Happen Here? Is it Already Happening? (Sept. 20), is rather remarkable. American radicals, we are told in all seriousness, are in favor of pluralism and diversity, the Black Panthers call mere ly for selfdefensive vio lence, and the acceptance by certain American revolution aries of Castroism, Maoism and other variants of Lenin ist Communism represents a tactical alliance rather than an attempt to implant similar totalitarian regimes in this country. The revolutionism of the Left, Philip Green con cludes with caution yet subtle innuendo, is fueled by ten dencies toward overseas and domestic repression on the part of an establishment which may be pioneering a new political system: of for mal democracy for the many and a kind of informal Fasc ism for the few.

title: Ellen L. Hickey Fiancee Of Randy M. Waterman
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., Oct. 17 Mr. and Mrs. Ed ward J. Hickey have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen Louise Hickey, to Randy Mi chael Waterman, son of Mrs. Allen J. Greenough of Green wich, Conn., and Rodney H. Waterman of St. Petersburg, Fla.

J., Oct. 17Miss Barbara Jean Rie werts, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Brar Volkert Riewerts, was maried here this after noon to Frederick Theodore Barber, son of Mr and Mrs. Anthony Victor Barber of Tuxedo Park, N. Y. The Rev. Wesley E. Megaw performed the ceremony in the South Presbyterian Church.

description: Cellist Gregor Piatigorsky will be soloist with the New York Philharmonic at Phil harmonic Hall Wednesday and Oct. 26.

title: Unhappy product of the black middle class
description: I was a rare kind of nigger. Not a Bigger Thomas, nor a manchild in a promised land. Maybe I had experienced too much of the nausea of life to have an identity. And what I

title: Kupec Guides Syosset to a 330 Triumph
description: The windy weather that buf feted Long Island yesterday afternoon forced most high school football teams to re main on the ground. It didn't seem to bother Chris Kupec of Syosset, however. Rupee, one of Nassau County's premier athletes, passed Herricks dizzy in leading Syosset to a 330 romp in a North Shore Division I game between undefeated teams.

title: When Will the Great Baby Sitter Get the Message?
description: ONCE upon a time there were three happy little networks. Naughty lit tle networks, they spent all their days and nights with dancing and singing and laugh tracks and movies and series and car toons and reruns. And then one day, the big bad FCC wolf began huffing and puff ing (as it was wont to do from time to time) and threatened to blow their li censes away. So, promising to reform their airwaves, the three suddenly became very public minded and decided to shore up their programing with a few solid bricks. Espe cially in that very delicate area which could quickly earn them the most Brownie points: Children's Programs.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon stood in the glare of the television lights and leaned toward J. Edgar Hoover and Attorney General John N. Mitchell like a coach sending two running guards into the game: Gentlemen, he said, I give you the tools you do the job!

title: Melinda M. Vercini Becomes Bride
description: TRUMBULL, Conn., Oct. 17 Miss Melinda M. Vercini, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fred A. Vercini, was married here this morning to Brian Sean Noonan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas P. Noonan of Southport. The Rev. Robert Kruse, chairman of the the ology department of Stone hill college of North Easton, Mass., performed the cere mony in St. Teresa's Roman Catholic Church.

description: Radio station WLIB, a station based in Harlem that broadcasts rock and soul music and jazz, went off the air at noon yes terday because of threats to the station and its employes.

title: News of the Rialto
description: PRODUCTION cutback? Don't both er asking the playwriting firm of Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee what that's a about. They apparently don't even know there's supposed to be a recession harassing the land. They just keep bringing out plays, as they have since Inherit the Wind, including the straight and musical versions of Patrick Dennis's Auntie Mame. Right now their contribution to the American Playwrights Theater, The Night Tho reau Spent in Jail, is spreading like a California brushfire.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: The world's largest plant designed exclusively for float glass production was dedi cated in Meadville, Pa by P. P. G. Industries. The facility is a half mile long and can produce more than 100mil lion square feet of glass year.

title: ITALIAN CITY CALM AFTER ROME ACTS
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, Oct 17A show of strength by the central Government brought respite to this rebel lious city today after 10 days of rioting and a paralyzing gen eral strike.

title: BUCKLEY SPENDS 3 HOURS IN QUEENS
description: James L. Buckley, the Con servative party candidate for Senator, spent three hours yes terday morning touring six sec tions of Queens so that I can see the people and they can see me.

title: Former Maryland Aide Wins Congress Primary
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 17 (AP) David Fentress, former deputy state insurance commissioner, won the Republican Congres sional nomination from the Fourth District in a court ordered primary today.

title: Harvard Defeats Cornell On Late Field Goa1, 2724
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 17Richie Szaro has never quite become the triple threat back that Robert F. Kennedy and other Harvard football enthusiasts anticipated when they helped recruit him four years ago. But the Hun garianborn senior should soon eclipse Charlie Brickley as Harvard's most prolific kicker, and today he beat Cornell, 2724, with a 31yard field goal with eight seconds to play.

description: TRENTON, Oct. 17 (AP) Unbeaten Central Connecticut trouced Trenton State in foot ball today, 280, for its fourth victory.

description: AUCKLAND, Oct. 17 (AP) Neville Landrebe, a New Zea land motorcycling star, was killed today when he crashed in a race at Pukekohe near here.

description: A week ago Mayor Lindsay wrapped up the blame for the city's Jail and court crisis and placed it on the court's door step. Now the chief judge of the state has responded, and the question is: How close is the crisis to a solution?

description: Pinto and Vega, the new miniautos from Detroit, can not halt the foreign car in vasion of the American mar ket, according to intelligence received from Bergen Coun ty, N.J.

description: The annual Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union junior team and individual cross country championships will be held Saturday, Nov. 7, at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx. The fourmile event will start at 2 P.M.

title: DELAWARE ROUTS RUTGERS, 64 TO 21
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Oct 17Delaware, the leading college division team in the na tion in rushing, made believers out of a Rutgers homecoming crowd of 16,500 today by piling up 499 yards on the ground en route to a record, 5421, victory over Rutgers.

title: So. Illinois Wins No. 4
description: GREENVILLE, N. C., Oct. 17 (UPI)  Sherman Blade scored two firstperiod touchdowns to day and unbeaten Southern Illinois made them stand up for a 1412 victory over East Caro lina. The triumph was the Salu kis fourth of the year.

title: Maine Mariners Score 276
description: CASTINE, Maine, Oct. 17 (AP)Dave Keene, the. Maine Maritime Academy quarterback, scored on three keenerplays and passed for a fourth touch down today as the middies crushed Nichols, 276.

title: Cottone's Passing Paces Norwich to 37.14 Victory
description: NORTHFIELD, Vt., Oct. 17 Joe Cottone threw three touch down passes and ran for a fourth to lead Norwich Univer sity to a 3714 victory over St. Lawrence today. Cottone com pleted 19 of 26 passes for 258 yards.

title: Black C.P.A.'s a Rare Breed
description: There are 100,000 certified public accountants in the United States. How many of them, do you think, are black?

description: THE DRIVER'S SEAT, by Muriel Spark. A blandly chilling novelette that traces a curious spinster on holiday to her violent and predict ablebut why?death.

title: Kerr on Vince in Wonderland
description: EITHER the people who are performing Alice in Wonderland know what they're doing, in which case they are not doing it well, or they don't know what they're doing, in which case they oughtn't to be so long about it.

title: Long Run Saves the Day
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Oct. 17 (UPI)Jay Morrison inter cepted a pass and ran 59 yards for a touchdown with 4:07 left in the game today that gave, New Mexico a 2417 victory over New Mexico State.

title: Son to Mrs. Glanzberg
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Oct. 17 A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Glanzberg of Cove Neck on Sept. 30 at the Lying In Hospital in New York. Mrs. Glanzberg, a psychiatrist, is known profes sionally as Dr. Carol Glanz berg. Her husband is a vice president of Lehrman and Glanzberg; Inc., a design and advertising firm in Hemp stead. The child has been named Michael Gardner.

title: INFLATION RISING AS VOTER CONCERN
description: Unemployment and inflation are becoming increasingly im portant issues to voters in up state cities, according to a statewide survey commissioned by The New York Times.

title: PRESIDENT URGES SUPPORT OF GROSS
description: NEWARK, Oct. 17President Nixon, arriving here this after noon, expressed hope that his visit to support Nelson G. Gross, the Republican candidate for Senator from New Jersey, Would provide the momentum to put him over the top.

title: Antiques and Adoration for Christmas
description: THE meanest thief may have once been the one who stole candy from a baby,. but he is now the man  or men who stole 3,000 film nega tives and prints from the home of Elliott Perry in West field, N.J. The negatives represented almost 50 years effort by Mr. Perry in ac cumulating a record of rari ties among United States stamps that are housed in outstanding collections., Mr. Perry, doyen of American stamp collectors, is the first rank authority one the 19th century issues of the United States.

title: Cortland State On Top, 280
description: BROCKPORT, N. Y., Oct. 17 (AP)  Torn Bucher scored two touchdowns, on runs of 1 and yards, to lead Cortland State to a 280 victory today over Brock port State.

title: ISLAMIC SOCIALIST GAINS IN PAKISTAN
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Oct. 17 (AP)The red, green and black banner of a party that stands for Islamic socialism is being flown in great numbers in the southern part of West Pakistan, the home territory of its controversial leader, Zulfi kar Ali Bhutto.

title: WILLIAM AND MARY DOWNS V.M.I., 2410
description: LEXINGTON, Va., Oct. 17 (AP)  Phil Mbsser, the na tion's bight leading ground gainer, turned in a 44yard touchdown run and shattered a school rushing record that had stood for 17 years in lead ing William and Mary to a 24 10 Southern Conference foot ball victory over Virginia Mil itary Institute today.Mosser, a junior fullback from Butler, N.J., galloped for 156 yards on 21 carries to lift his sixgame total to 739 yards. Until today, the most yards gained by a W. and M. player in a single season was 722 by Bill Bowman during 10 games in 1953.

title: Anniversaries
description: HINDERSTEINMin and Abe. With grati titude and love we wish our parents and grandparents good health on their 50th wedding anniversary.

title: Almost a TeenAger, Caroline Kennedy Talks About Her Life
description: Caroline Kennedy, who used to totter around the White House in her mother's nigh heels when she was a little girl, thas her own grownup shoes and ideas now as she prepares to enter her teens.

title: Early Susquehanna Score Enough to Top Upsala, 70
description: SELINSGROVE, Pa., Oct. 17 (AP)  Susquehanna scored in the first period on a 2yard run by Joe Palchak and made it hold up for a 70 victory over Upsala today.

title: MANHATTAN TAKES 8OARED CREW RACE
description: The Manhattan College var sity eightoared shell defeated Kings Point in Manhattan's homecoming regatta on the Or chard Beach Lagoon Olympic rowing course in the Bronx yes terday.

title: Kindness and good nature could only be found in the remote places
description: These lines were written by the great Russian poet Osip Mandelstam in 1931. Though he died in a con centration camp in 1938 or early 1939, his widow, Nadezhda Yakov levna Mandelstam, has lived to pre

title: I Like Good Movies
description: ALOT of movie critics have friends named Stanley, and mine, who dropped by the other day, between his tennis game and an appoint ment with his astrologist, Is the voice of the movie industry. He is short and round and bald (with heavy sideburns), wears bellbottom dungarees of flowered silk, turtlenecks with beads, and car ries his copy of The Saturday Review hidden inside the latest issue of Screw. When Stanley sits down in your office, it's a little like having tea with a Trojan horse.

title: Mrs. Tindale Wed in Georgia
description: THOMSON, Ga., Oct. 17 Mrs. Ann Revell Chadeayne Tindale of Hartsdale, N. Y., was married here this morn ing to Walter Johnson Brown, president of WSPA radio and WSPATV in Snartanburg. S. C. The Rev., Dr. J. Estell Jones of the First Baptist Church performed the cere mony at Hickory Hill, the bridegroom's residence here.

title: Riverdale Rolls to 4th in a Row, Outscoring N. Y. M.A., 36 to 14
description: Riverdale rolled to its fourth straight victory of the season yesterday when it downed New York Military Academy 3614 on the winner's field in the Bronx. The offenseminded In dians have now scored 100 points this season.

title: Darby Kolishe Is Married Here
description: The marriage of Miss Darby Marlowe Kolishe to Thomas Ward Wasson 3d took place in St. Bartholo mew's Episcopal Church here yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Andrew P. Mullins per formed the ceremony.

title: Oregon Club Names Doss
description: PORTLAND. Ore., Oct. 17 (UPI)Jack D. Doss, 37year old head pro at Elmwood coun try Club in White Plains, N. Y., for the last six years, was named yesterday as head pro fessional at Waverly Country Club. He will take the post Dec. 1 when Howard Bonar retires after 17 years as Waverly pro.

title: New heights for beef
description: It is, admittedly, a luxury item, but cold roast fillet of beef in aspic is one of the most beautiful dishes in all of French cookingand one of the hand somest dishes for any buffet. The beef, which really should be cooked rare, is arranged on a bed of jellied perigour dine sauce containing truffles, and then coated with a clear aspic. As a final fillip, the ensemble is garnished with a tomato rose. Step photographs describ ing the preparation of the beef appear on the opposite page; a recipe for the aspic, and for celery root remoulade (a fine accompaniment for the beef) ap pear on Page 90 along with instructions for making the tomato rose. A fine claret goes well with beef perigourdine. QUICK ASPIC

title: Storybook look
description: You may never have lived in a castle, but you might start thinking that way if you want to feel at home in the clothes that are going to be around this autumn. Most of them seem like something right out of the pages of a storybook. A rather dramatic storybook at that, with medieval maidens, cloistered damsels and swash bucklersall of them looking very much in fashion. Just pick your role and play it to the hilt.

title: Trinity Tops Colby, 28.14; Kiarsis Sets Rushing Mark
description: WATERVILLE, Maine, Oct. 17 (AP)Dave Kiarsis chalked up a Trinity rushing mark to day and scored once as the un beaten Bantams defeated Colby, 2814.

title: O'BRIEN IS ELECTED TO HALL AT GOSHEN
description: GOSHEN, N. Y., Oct. 17 (AP) Joe O'Brien, 53 years old, one of the foremost drivers in harness racing, was elected today to the Trotting Hall of Fame in Goshen.

title: CARTIER TAKES DIVISION OF RUIN
description: Tony Pennimpede, confident of victory, approached the fin ish of a scholastic crosscoun try race yesterday and discov ered that he had been beaten. But he didn't realize it until the last moment because the cham pion, Vincent Cartier, was so far ahead that he could not be seen.

title: CENTRAL CONN. WINS IN CROSSCOUNTRY
description: By capturing five of the first 12 places, Central Connecticut State College defeated three rivals in a crosscountry meet yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Plunkett Sets a Record
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Oct. 17 (UPI)Jim Plunkett became the greatest yardage gainer in Na tional Collegiate history today as he led ninthranked Stanford to a 6316 rout of Washington State in the Pacific8 confer ence.

description: The title is misleading, in fact the title will be a librarian's nightmare. The main entry here is the editor, historian Owen Dudley Edwards (Edinburgh University), who chose the 20 odd scholars and journalists whose essays make up the con tents; each is a specialist on some aspect of Ireland. Among

title: Why Air Charters May Not Always Be Safe

Many of these flights were operated by the scheduled airlines. Many were flown by nonscheduled companiessome first rate, some fly by nightoffer ing varying rates and levels of safety.

title: Edith Halpert, 190070
description: EDITHGREGOR HALPERT, who died last week, was a pioneer among the art gallery directors concerned with contemporary American art. When Mrs. Hal pert founded the Downtown Gallery in 1926, there were very few dealers interested in American art, and still fewer interested in young and progressive artists. Mrs. Halpert gave up a successful business career to de vote herself to these future leaders of American art and, as the years passed, her list of painters and sculptors came to include many of the outstanding creative figures of our country.

title: TaeuberArp and Albers: Loyal Only to Art
description: T HE history of abstract art in this century is an epic subject  one reason, perhaps, why it has not yet found a writer to do it justice. It weaves in and out of other historical currents with no very clear consistency. At one moment, its firmest attachment seems to be to theosophy, mysticism and other forms of the irra tional. At another, it offers itself as the indispensable ally of radical social reforms, revolutionary political move ments, and attempts to trans form industrial civilization into a new Utopia. On the one hand, it appears to embrace all the excesses of romantic solipsism, and on the other, to detach itself from the vi cissitudes of private feeling with an almost inhuman de tachment. It shows no scruples about involving itself in what ever the Zeitgeist happens to turn up, and yet it retains an energy and an independ ence that mock the importun ities of history. Its first and final loyalty is always to it self, whatever the masks it may deem expedient to don in the course of its realization.
