description: Business Records

title: Radio
description: Music

title: 2 Texans Convicted of Plot To Bomb School Bus Fleet
description: TYLER, Tex., Oct. 20 (AP) A Federal jury found two Long view men guilty today of con spiracy to bomb the Longview school bus fleet last July 4.

title: CITY SELLS BONDS FOR $233MILLION
description: New York City sold a $233.78million bond issue yes terday, and it incurred an in terest cost of nearly 7.15 per cent  the second highest rate in recent years.

title: 3 Opposition Groups In Ghana Combined Into a Single Party
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Oct. 20 Ghana's three opposition parties were merged today into a single organization, the Jus tice party.

title: T. W. A Halts Domestic Flights Because of Strike
description: Trans World Airlines can celed all domestic flights and about half of its overseas de partures yesterday after al most 5,400 stewardesses and pursers struck the airline at 12:01 A.M. in a dispute over wages and benefits.

title: Nixon Risking Prestige in Two Top Wisconsin Races
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 20 Robert H. Finch, counselor to President Nixon, did not hesi tate last week to tell Wisconsin audiences that Mr. Nixon was putting his prestige squarely on the line by coming here in behalf of Republican candi dates.

title: Sports of the Times
description: Joe Namath has been buried on occa sions under a much more smothering mass of muscle than flattened him late in the game with the Baltimore Colts last Sunday. Billy Ray Smith of the Baltimore Colts is a mere 250 pounds, modest tonnage for defensive tackle. It wasn't the weight of Billy Ray that did the damage, though. It was the way Namath toppled with his right wrist taking the shivering impact with the ground.

title: The Jewish Contradiction
description: The Jewish community in America Is now living in a situation unprecer dented in 2,000 years of Jewish history but only its young people are facing the fact, and even they have just be gun to.

title: Ted Lewis, British. Boxer, Dies;. World Champion Welterweight
description: LONDON, Oct. 20 (UPI)  Ted (Kid). Lewis, a Briton who was welterweight boxing champion of the world, died today after a short illness. He was 75 years old.

title: PRIVATE MAILING OF SMUT UPHELD
description: The United States Court of Appeals here ruled yesterday that consenting adults could send obscene material to one another through the mail for their personal and private use.

title: Rivers Sent Letter On
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 20 A staff member of the House Armed Services Committee has confirmed that Mr. Rivers re ceived the soldiers letter. She said it was forwarded to the Army's legislative liaison office on Wednesday.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP) The Defense Department to day listed the names of the fol lowing Army men front the New York area as having been killed in Indochina:

title: Jobless Rate Ebbing, State Statistics Show
description: ALBANY, Oct. 20 (AP)' The state's unemployment rate dropped slightly in September but was still greater than the same month a year ate, State Industrial Commissioner M. P. Cath erwod reported today.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Entertainment Events

title: STAR IS UNCERTAIN ON FUTURE PLANS
description: Joe Namath doubted last night that he would play for the New York Jets again this season. The 27yearold quar terback also acknowledged that the resumption of his ca reer next season was uncer tain at this time.

title: NATIONAL CITY ADDS EARNINGS DETAILS
description: The First National City Cor poration, parent company of New York's largest bank, re ported yesterday that its rate of return on its stockholders investment increased during the first nine months of, this year, but its profit margin declined.

title: Judge Imposes OneYear Term For Defying a Senate Subpoena
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 Alan McSurely, who has en gaged in a threeyear battle with a Senate subcommittee, was sentenced today to a year in prison for contempt of Con gress and his wife, Margaret, was sentenced to three months.

title: Joint CopperRecovery Plan
description: The Cleveland  Cliffs Iron Company and E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. said yesterday that a joint venture would seek to recover copper by a chemical process known as solution min ing. The process will be used at an inactive mine near Mountain City, Nev., which is believed to hold 25,000 tons of recoverable copper. The property is con trolled by the Cliff Copper Cor poration, a subsidiary of Cleve landCliffs.

title: Bridge
description: Bridge is one of the few recreations in which experts can oppose players with sub stantially less experience and both sides enjoy the expe rience.

title: VIETCONG AMBUSH REPORTED BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 20 (AP)A Vietcong unit was reported to have ambushed an American convoy today 200 yards from a South Korean out post in the Central Highlands of South Vietnam.

title: Ottinger Is Backed On Vietnam Stand
description: Senator Eugene J. McCarthy, the peace movement candidate for President in 1968, compared the antiwar credentials of the Democratic and Republican candidates for Senator from New York yesterday. As he saw it, the Democrat won.

title: Mobil Oil, Imperial and Sohio Gain
description: The oil industry began to parade its thirdquarter and ninemonth earnings reports yesterday with upbeat and downbeat profit tunes just about evenly matched.

title: Senator Williams Shuns Limelight in the Stretch
description: TRENTON, Oct. 20  Com pared with the furor of some recent election Campaigns by Democratic candidates in New Jersey, Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. apparently is in political hiding, with the elec tion just two weeks from today.

title: OUTPUT OF INDUSTRY RISES 8.3% IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 20 (UPI)  Soviet industrial production rose by 8.3 per cent in the first nine months of 1970 despite shortcomings in consumer goods industries, the Government an nounced today.

title: SYLVESTER GIVES A CELLO RECITAL
description: A true virtuoso needs a lot of seasoning and more than sprinkle of dash to carry off solo recital. A virtuoso cellist needs even more of these in gredients than do players of more usual solo instruments.

title: DIOCESES TO GET PLAN FOR MERGER
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 20  The 3.5million member Episcopal Church, meeting here in trien nial general convention, agreed, today to transmit to its 90 dioceses for study a plan of union that would merge nine major Protestant denominations into one church with a total membership of 25 million.

title: Fawzi, 70YearOld Diplomat, Approved as Premier of Egypt
description: CAIRO, Oct. 20Dr. Mah moud Fawzi, a distinguished 70yearold diplomat, was ap proved tonight as Premier of the United Arab Republic.

title: Curbs Urged on Imports Of Footwear and Leather
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 20 (UPI) Spokesmen for the footwear and leather industries urged the United States Tariff Com mission today to curb imports of such products, which they said were threatening their existence.

title: DAVID LEVY
description: FREEPORT, L. I., Oct. 20 (UPI)  David Levy, retired banker and civic leader here, died today after a long illness. He was 83 years old.

title: Open Interest
description: Open Interest

title: Stans's Film on Africa Criticized by Press Club
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (Reuters)Maurice H. Stans, the Secretary of Commerce, has withdrawn from public showing a movie he shot in Africa after complaints about his use of the words boys and natives in referring to Africans in the film.

title: GBC Introduces Camera
description: The GBC Closed Circuit TV Corporation introduced yester day a new lowcost television camera that operates in total darkness. The company said the camera would sell for $1,500, or about 10 per cent of the cost of comparable cameras.

title: Nixon Returns to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House tonight. The Presidential jet landed at An drews Air Force Base, Mary land.

title: Landlords Seeking A Tax Moratorium For 400,000 Units
description: A chief spokesman for land lords of New York's 1.3mil lion rent  controlled apartments warned yesterday that unless the city suspended real estate taxes for the owners of build ings containing 400,000 apart ments, these buildings would go into debt this winter.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: Fashion Show to Benefit Hospital
description: A luncheon and fashion show will be held next Wednesday at the St. Regis Roof and Penthouse by the Women's Auxiliary of the Presbyterian Hospital. Among the designers to be represent ed at the Caravan of Fash ion are Donald Brooks, Vera Maxwell, Anne Fogarty, Pucci, Geoffrey Beene and Chester Weinberg. Melvin E. Dawley, chairman of the board of Lord & Taylor, will be guest of honor.

title: ACTING PRINCIPAL FOCUS OF LAWSUIT
description: The Council of Supervisory Associations decided yesterday to file a suit to compel Dr. Har vey B. Scribner, Chancellor of the city's schools, and the Board of Education to cancel the appointment of Melvin Tay lor as acting principal of Ben jamin Franklin High School in East. Harlem.

title: Class 44: The Gifted Often Hide Talents
description: Early this semester, a teacher at Public School 198 stopped by Class 44 to alert her colleague there, Dorothy Boroughs, to the promise and abilities of one of her new students, a brighteyed youngster named Raymond Mercado, who had managed through most of his first four years of school to conceal his natural eagerness.

title: Two Win Acting Awards
description: Mary Wright and John Vent antonio are winners of the first annual William Benton awards presented by the American Shakespeare Festival for acting. Each received an award of $500. They are made possible by a gift from William Benton of Southport, Conn., to a member or members of the resident com pany at Stratford, Conn.

title: Syria Likely to Review Policy At Meeting of Party Command
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Oct 20 (AP)  The leadership crisis touched off by the resignation of President Nureddin tassi may have farreaching effects on Syria's future course in the Middle East.

title: and the Bronx
description: Twentysecond District: James H. Scheuer (Dem.Lib.) has amply proved his value as a Representative in his three terms in office. His work for jobtraining, crime prevention and housing especially entitle him to reelection.

title: Discount Rate in France Lowered to 7% From 7.5%
description: PARIS, Oct. 20For the see cond time within two months, the flank of France lowered its discount rate today by half a point.

title: MINOR CANDIDATE WINS RADIO TIME
description: A writein candidate has won an equaltime broadcast ruling from the Federal Communica tions Commission, and radio station WOR said yesterday that the candidate would get free radio time worth about $10,000.

title: The Tallest Briefly
description: The World Trade Center has pushed its monstrous way into first place as the world's tallest skyscraper. It now dwarfs the Empire State Building by four feet. When it reaches its full height of 110 stories, the World Trade Center's margin will grow to a hundrecl feet. But by that time an even loftier rival, the Sears Tower, will be on its way up in Chicago.

title: Plans for Fare Changes On the New Haven Scored
description: Representative Ogden R. Reid charged before the Pub lic Service Commission yester day that a fare restructuring proposal by the Penn Central for the New Haven Division would cause hardship not only for commuters but also for, stu dents and elderly people.

title: GOLDBERG BACKED BY G.O.P. IN BRONX
description: Twentythree of the 38 lead ers in the factionridden Bronx Republican organization aban doned Governor Rockefeller yesterday to throw their sup port behind Arthur J. Gold berg, his DemocraticLiberal opponent.

title: PRICE FREEZE SET FOR SCANDINAVIA
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 20Scan dinavian countries face a hard winter of austerity as authori ties intensify their conuter at tack against inflation in an at tempt to restore equilibrium to external accounts.

description: Money

title: Mrs. Whelan's 86 for 171 Wins Jersey Senior Title
description: DEAL, N.J., Oct. 20Mrs. James Whelan of Springdale won the first New Jersey sen ior women's amateur state championship by two strokes, shooting a 43, 4386 to finish with a 171 at the Hollywood Golf Club.

description: College, School Results

title: WOODALL, DAVIS PASS IN WORKOUT
description: New Xrays of Joe Namath's fractured right wrist were taken yesterday and the prognosis was worse than be fore: The 27yearold quarter back of the New York Jets, will have the wrist in a cast for six weeks.

title: Tooth Accidents Decried
description: MIAMI BEACH, Oct. 20 (AP) One hundred thousand teeth were knocked out of the mouths of American children last year in accidents that Might have been avoided, an oral surgeon said yesterday. Intramural sports, quickstop school buses, fights, and other events robbed the chil dren of some of their natural teeth, said Dr. Bernard Kings bury Jr., president of the Na tional Society of Oral Surgeons, which is meeting here this week.

title: Poor Richard's Almanack, &c.  Nixon Edition
description: What's good for the President good for America.

title: Stage: Gandhi Wrongs a Great Man
description: Well intentioned, weak minded and quite totally and unutterably boring, some kind of historical play, laughing ly calling itself Gandhi, dragged its sluggard way into the Playhouse Theater last night. In the first place it is an insult to a great man, in the second place it is an in sult to a great man, and in the third place it is a waste of another man who has many claims to being a great actor.

title: Market Summary
description: Market Summary

title: CHRISTOPHER KEENE CONDUCTS RODRIGO
description: Christopher Keene, the 23 yearold winner of the first Julius Rudel Awarl, made his New York City Upera debut Sunday afternoon conducting Ginastera's Don Rodrigo. De spite his tender years, Mr. Keene has already had consid erable operatic experience on the musical staff of the Santa Fe and San Francisco opera companies, and, in 1968 and 1969, conducting at the Spoleto Festival.

title: ARMY RESTS CASE IN MYLAI DEATHS; MOVE A SURPRISE
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Oct. 20 The prosecution in the court martial of S. Sgt. David Mitchell for his role in the al eged massacre of civilians in the South Vietnamese hamlet of Mylai 4 unexpectedly rested its case today after calling three witnesses to the stand.

title: The 10th District
description: POPULATION A popula tion of about 475,000, mostly Jewish. It has always had Irish and Italians, too, but it now is beginning to have many Negro and Puerto Rican newcomers.

title: INQUIRY BY CLERGY INTO JAILS BLOCKED
description: A committee of clergymen said yesterday that officials had turned down their request to conduct their own investi gation of conditions in city jails.

title: Adams Charges A Liberal Cabal Rules State G.O.P.
description: Dr. Paul L. Adams, Conserva tive party candidate for Gover nor, said yesterday that the most significent political devel opment this year has been the unraveling of the liberal cabal which for the past decade, at least, has controlled the New York State Republican party.

title: PUISSANCE CLASS GOES TO GERMAN
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 20 The West German Equestrian Team took the third straight international class at the Penn sylvania National Horse Show, tonight, when 24yearold Gert Wiltfang, a Rhineland automo bile dealer, won the puissance class aboard Sieno after five rounds.

title: Kent State Student Leaders Urge Nationwide Callege Moratorium on Friday
description: KENT, Ohio, Oct. 20The student government at Kent State University called today for a nationwide, nonviolent moratorium by students on Fri day to protest the indictments handed down by an Ohio State grand jury as a result of the violence on the campus last May.

title: Shoemaker Wins Hickok Poll
description: Willie Shoemaker, who re cently became the jockey with the most career victories, won the September poll yesterday in the race for the annual Hick ok award to the professional athlete of the year. He received 32 firstplace votes and 134 points to beat Ken Rosewall, the tennis star, by 32 points.

title: Traveling to Paris Certainly Changed The Old Drugstore
description: True to its boast that it has just about everything except drugs, that isLe Drugstore opened here Monday. Like its 50 European counterparts, it sells clothes, gifts, books, tobacco and delicatessen food. In addition, it houses three restaurants and a bar.

title: Undecided in Connecticut Hold Key To Races for Governor and Senator
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 20  With Election Day two weeks away, the races in Connecticut for Governor and the United States Senate appear to be exceedingly close, with a large percentage of undecided voters apparently holding the Key.

title: Soviet Lauriches Cosmos 373
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 20 (UPI)  The Soviet Union launched to day the 373d in its Cosmos zeries of unmanned earth satellites, Tass said. The Soviet press agency Tass did Dot specify the mission of Cosmos 373.

title: Accused Black Panthers Tell Jury Here That Their Party Is on Trial
description: Defense lawyers and two de fendants representing them selves attacked the state's case against 13 Black Panthers yes terday, calling it a politically motivated conspiracy to de stroy the party.

title: Goodbody's Fund Quest Is Clarified by Big Board
description: The New York Stock Ex change disclosed yesterday that it had ordered Goodbody & Co. to raise additional capital and said the new funds would be used to strengthen the firm's existing operations, rather than to expand its activities.

title: Patrolman Arrested In a Gambling Case; No Charges Filed
description: Two weeks ago a special team of 14 investigators from Police Headquarters in Man hattan seized a plainclothes policeman and a gambler meet ing on a street in Oueens.

title: New Books
description: Congress, and Conscience: Essays by Senators Barry M. Goldwater and George S. McGovern. Rep resentatives Jim Wright, Charles E. Bennett, Albert H. Quie and John B. Anderson, edited with an introduction by Mr. Anderson (Lippincott, $4.95).

title: Senegal to Base Her Future on Broad Diversification
description: The West African nation of Senegal  long dependent on peanuts as her main export commodityis basing her eco nomic hopes for the future on a broad new diversification pro gram, Premier Abdou Diouf told businessmen here yester day.

title: CITY CLUB HONORS MRS. MARY LASKER
description: Mrs. Albert D. Lasker, presi dent of the Albert and Mary Lasker Foundation, received the Distinguished New Yorker Award of the City Club of New York last night.

title: Books of The Times
description: The Great Dethriffe is C.D.B. Bryan's first book since P. S. Wilkinson (1965), which was unlucky enough to be a prize novel from a distinguished publishing house. Reviewers fall upon prize novels like packs of famished wolves and tear them to shreds, because reviewers resent being forced topay attention to anything.

title: Taiwan Bids U.N. Stand Firm Against Admitting Red China
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 20Nationalist China urged the member nations of the United Nations today to stand firm against Communist China's admission on the ground that Most Of tbose nationsyrere potential targets of Chinese Communist aggression.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK BRAVES BY 9889
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 20 (AP) Hal Greer came off the bench in the second period and led the Philadelphia 76ers to a 9889 victory over the Buffalo Braves tonight.

title: Soviet Team Wins Medal In World Title Shooting
description: PHOENIX, Oct. 20 (AP)Thei fourman Soviet team won a gold medal today in the run ning boar match of the 40th world shooting championships.

title: Barenboim and the Beethoven Cycle
description: Daniel Barenboim, young in years but veteran pianist, conductor, chamber music player, accompanist and mu sical activist to the point where one is tempted to title him Daniel Barenboim Ltd., is the first of the Beethovenyear pianists to attempt the full cycle in New York. He started on Monday evening in Alice Tully Hall, playing the first of eight concerts devoted to the 32 Beethoven sonatas. At the opening concert his choice embraced Sonatas Nos. 1 in F minor (Op. 2, No. 1); 18 in E flat (Op. 31, No. 3) and 29 in B flat (the Hammer klavier, Op. 106).

title: Nat'1 Basketball Ass'n
description: Nat'1 Basketball Ass'n

title: JOE HICKERSON SINGS CENTURYAGO MUSIC
description: Popular songs of a century ago, which have been trans formed by the passing of time to folk songs, formed a focal point for a recital by Joe Nick erson on Monday night at the Washington Square Church, 135 West Fourth Street.

title: Incumbent in Nassau Expects Opposition to Help Him Win
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Oct. 20  Lester L. Wolff, the Democatic Liberal representing Nassau County's Third Congressional District, is confident that his Republican and Conservative opponents will divide the rising Conservative vote and enable him to capture his fourth term.

title: City's Election. Board, in Reversal, Revises Ballot
description: The city's Board of Elections reversed itself yesterday and voted to change the already printed voting machine ballots to prevent any impression that Governor Rockefeller and James L. Buckley were running on joint independent slate for Gov ernor and Senator.

title: GASPAR OF METS SENT TO PADRES
description: The Mets sent Rod Gaspar to the San Diego Padres yester day, completing the deal that brought Ron Herbel, the pitch er, to New York Aug. 31.

title: Students Hostile to Justice Official
description: SOUTH HADLEY, Mass., Oct. 20  Toward what construc tive end did the Justice De partment request 1,000 more F.B.I. agents? a student asked in an accusing tone, suggesting that they were mainly intended for use on college campuses.

title: Agnew includes Tydings On Radical Liberal List
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 20Vice President Agnew added today the name of another prominent Democrat  Senator Joseph D. Tydings of Maryland  to his growing list of radical liber als deserving of political ex tinction.

title: UTILITY'S PROFIT RISES IN QUARTER
description: The American Electric Power Company and subsidiaries re ported yesterday gains in its net income for the three, nine and 12 months ended Sept. 30. The company's report also showed September net income had risen by 10.5 per cent to $9,968,000 from $9,023,000 a year earlier.

title: CocaCola Stock Split Set
description: Shareholders of the Coda Cola Bottling Company of New York, Inc., approved yesterday a twoforone stock split, the company announced. Sharehold ers also voted to increase it COMMOIL stock from four mil lion, shares with a par value of $1 to eight million shares witl a par value of 50 cents.

title: Power Project Challenged
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 20 (AP) The Sierra Club and Citizens for Clean Air and Water, both conservationist groups, filed suit yesterday in Unitde States District Court here to block the construction of the $270mil lion DavisBesse Nuclear Power Station near Port Clinton.

title: Cyanamid Fighting Lilly's Plan to Buy Cosmetics Maker
description: The American Cyanamid Com pany filed a suit in Federal Dis trict Court yesterday to pre vent the sale of the Elizabeth Arden Sales Corporation to Eli Lilly & Co. Earlier this month Eli Lilly announced it had ar ranged to buy the manufacturer of cosmetics and operator of beauty salons. A few days later American C y a n a m i d dis closed it had signed an agree ment to buy the Elizabeth A r d e n concern that predated by four days the one announced by Eli Lilly.

title: Legendary Reformer
description: If anyone had based a movie on the actual life of Mexi co's Lazaro Cardenas, critics would have called it too fantastic. Here was truly the stuff of lore and legend: The peasant boy who left school at eleven to help sup port his family; the jailed young revolutionary under death sentence, smuggled out to freedom in a burlap bag; the politician who broke with his party, campaigned on horseback through the country and won the Presi dency with 80 per cent of the votes; the President who brought off one of the authentic social and economic revolutions of this century, then gave up power freely at 45 when his term was up. Incredible!

title: PRICES ARE FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London stock exchange were firm yesterday after a minor rally from low er opening levels.

title: Brooklyn Patrolman Seized With 3 in Narcotics Case
description: A Brooklyn patrolman and three other men were arrested last night in the East New York section on charges of loitering for the purpose of using nar cotics.

title: Students Question Buckley
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Oct. 20James L. Buckley, the Con servative party candidate for the United States Senate, was sharply questioned today by 750 students in a lecture ball at Harpur College of the State University.

title: LAPORTE FUNERAL HELD UNDER GUARD
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 20Amid a cordon formed by hundreds of soldiers, a funeral was held today for Pierre Laporte, the Quebec Minister of Labor and Immigration, who was kid napped and slain by the Front for the Liberation of Quebec.

title: GATHERING DANCED AT COVENT GARDEN
description: LONDON, Oct. 20Jerome Robbins last night became the first choreographer to stage work for the Royal Ballet since the new directors, Kenneth Macmillian and John Field, took over. Dances at a Gath ering, created for the New. York City Ballet in May of last year, enjoyed a warm re ception at Covent Garden with special enthusiasm greeting Mr. Robbins as he responded to curtain calls.

title: CANUCKS TURN BACK GOLDEN SEALS, 2 to 1
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Oct. 20 (UPI)The Van couver Canucks scored two goals in the first two minutes of the second period tonight and gained a 21 National Hockey League victory over the winless California Golden Seals.

title: The Rebirth of a Future:
description: Daytoday events leave us with feeling of chaos; it seems as if we must be mere powerless spectators at the decline and fall of our country. But these same events are capable of being understood as part of a larger process of social change  a process that is fearsome and yet fundamentally hope ful. And we may be participantswe may regain the power to make our own futureif only we understand what is taking place.

title: Philippa Greene of Skidmore Engaged to Andrew Kennedy
description: NORWALK, Conn., Oct. 20 Miss Philippa Clarke Greene and Andrew Sumner Kennedy plan to marry here in March.

title: SOVIET WILL JOIN I.C.A.O. ON NOV. 14
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 20The Soviet Union, which has avoid ed membership in the Interna tional Civil Aviation Organiza tion since it took shape in 11944, will formally join the air line agency Nov. 14.

title: Tonight's Entries
description: Tonight's Entries

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Shipping/Mails

title: CibaGeliv Merger Voted
description: GENEVA, Oct. 20The merg er of two Swiss chemical com panies, J. R. Geigy and Ciba, was approved by their share holders at meetings today in Basel. Ciba will be the surviv ing company under the new name of CibaGeigy, Ltd. The way for the merger was cleared last July with the filing of a consent agreement by the Unit ed States Justice Department in connection with the American holdings of the two Swiss com panies.

title: Sadat Says U.S. Support For Israel Blocks Peace
description: CAIRO, Oct. 20Anwar el Sadat, the new President of the United Arab Republic, said last night that if the United States were not behind the Israeli ex pansion drive, the whole ques tion of the ArabIsraeli conflict would be solved by the Jarring mission within 24 hours.

title: Jordanian Tanks Shell Ramtha Near the Syrian Border
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Oct. 20 Jordanian tanks shelled the town of Ramtha today in what appeared to be a continuing effort to seal off the Syrian border from Palestinian com mando bases in the north.

title: The RogersGromyko Talks
description: Foreign Minister Gromyko's meeting tomorrow with President Nixon and his lengthy private talks in New York with Secretary of State Rogers come at a crucial point for the Administration's policy of negotiation, not confrontation. Substantive discussion of such subjects as the Middle East, Vietnam Berlin and the strategic arms limitation talks (SALT) has been overtaken by more fundamental question: good faith. The United States has been trying to communicate that one simple message for weeks, while probing for Russia's future intentions.

title: 3M Sets Peaks in 3 and 9 Months
description: The Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company achieved record sales and earnings in the third quarter and first nine months of this year, the diversified manu facturer reported yesterday from its St. Paul headquar ters.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On behalf of several hundred thou sand Spanish workers, members of the Sindicato Nacional de Actividades Di versas, a powerful union that reflects a wide spectrum of the Spanish work ing people, I wish to convey to you the deep concern that we have in this country about the socalled Mills Act now before the U.S. Congress. As you well knock, such an act would damage seriously our footwear and olives ex ports, among others, to the U.S.

title: Politics or a Plot?
description: To the prosecutors, the trial of New York's 13 Black Panther defendants is basically a crimi nal case. They have accused the Panthers of plotting to kill policemen and bomb buildings, including Bloomingdale's and the Bronx Botanical Gardens, and the truth of those charges is all that the District Attorney cares to have ar gued in the court room. To the de fendants, it is a political trial; the criminal charges, they say, are just an excuse for the prosecution to stamp out a party whose politics it doesn't like.

title: New Post Contract Is Ratified by Guild
description: Striking members of the Newspaper Guild unit at The New York Post voted over whelmingly last night to ratify a new agreement with the newspaper and planned to re turn to their jobs today.

title: DR. GEORGE M'NEELY
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Oct 20 The Rev. Dr. George McNeely, former rector of three Episcopal churches in Elizabeth  St. John's, St. Andrew's and Grace Church  died yesterday in nursing home at Livingston. He was 92 years old and lived at 120 South Harrison Street here. He retired in 1964.

title: CONSTRUCTION RISE OF 10% IS FORECAST
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP) With housing leading the way, construction contracts are expected to increase by almost 10 per cent to $74.35billion in 1971, the McGrawHill Informa tion Systems Company, a divi sion of McGrawHill, Inc., said today.

title: Timothy Leary Gets Asylum in Algeria
description: ALGIERS, Oct. 20Algeria has granted political asylum to Dr. Timothy Leary, the prophet of LSD who escaped from pris on in San Luis Obispo, Calif., on Sept. 13, the official Algerian press agency said tonight.

title: U.S. Apparel Mission to Europe Sees Italy as Attractive Market
description: ROME, Oct. 20  Italians used to buy a few blue jeans from the United States and export plenty of Pucci pants and Gucci shoes. But the terms, of transAtlantic fashion trade may soon change.

title: JAMES H. BECKER, BROKERAGE HEAD
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 20James H. Becker, chairman of the board of A. G. Becker & CO., Inc., a national investment banking and brokerage house, died of a stroke yesterday. He was 75 years old and lived at 55 Oakville Avenue in subur ban Highland Park.

title: Metropolitan Is Host to Antagonists
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art played host yesterday, diffidently to be sure but not without grace, to a galaxy of its antagonists. For five hours, from 3 P.M. to 8 P.M., the museum allowed the oc cupation of its Great Hall in an event that had an assort ment of names, among them opening hearing, work shop, popular rally and International Artists Demon stration.

title: Green Beret Blast Report
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., Oct. 20 (AP)The Army says an in vestigation board found no in dividual independently negli gent in causing an explosion that killed eight Green Beret soldiers and injured four others last June on a training range.

title: Wright, Langford Retain Golf Crown With a 66 for 133
description: OLD BROOKVILLD L.I., Oct. 20The defending champions. Jimmy Wright and John. Lang ford of Inwood, carded 33, 33 66, with three birdies on each nine, to retain their Metropoli tan Professional Golf Associa tion's propro title today with a 133 at the Cedar Brook Coun try Club. Par for the 6,601yard course is 36, 3672.

title: Advertising: Young People Shun Agencies
description: The annual Eastern re gional conference of the American Association of Ad vertising Agencies began its threeday stay at the Bilt more yesterday with some words from the wise that won't prove sufficient.

title: Boggs Sued by Candidate
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 20 (AP) Robert E. Lee, a lawyer and Republican Congressional candi date, filed a $2million damage suit yesterday against Repre sentative Hale Boggs, Demo crat of Louisiana, after accus ing Mr. Boggs of being behind a malpractice suit against Mr. Lee. Dennis DeLatte, a former client of Mr. Lee, charged him with malpractice in mishandling an accident case and a separa tion proceeding several years ago.

title: DIVIDEND MEETINGS TODAY
description: DIVIDEND MEETINGS TODAY

title: Reuss Presses Federal Agency For Suits on Mercury Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20  Representative Henry S. Reuss criticized the Federal Water Quality Administration today for failing to recommend to the Justice Department the filing of suits against 40 com panies discharging mercury into the nation's waterways.

title: Hemisphere Press Group Hears Appeal on Apathy
description: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 20 (AP) James S. Copley opened the 26th general assembly of the InterAmerican Press Associa tion today with a call for West ern Hemisphere newsmen to break through the apathy of our peoples.

title: Priority for Politics
description: President Nixon's priority for Republican politicking over state business, combined with shoddy staff work by Zambian diplomats, has produced unfortunateand wholly unnecessaryfriction between the United States and black Africa. In this instance, a seeming White. House snub of President Kenneth. Kaunda of Zambia is the source of the irritation.

title: Arpino's Lyric Cello Concerto Enlivens Program for Joffrey
description: Some of the Joffrey Ballet's most sparkling ballets were on the subdued side last night at the City Center. The oomph was not missing, just redistrib uted.

title: Tulsa Is Put on Probation For Violations in Recruiting
description: TULSA, Oct. 20 (AP)The University of Tulsa, barely into its football rebuilding program, was put on probation today by the Missouri Valley Con ference for alleged recruiting violations.

title: Fairleish Soccer Victor
description: TEANECK, N. J., Oct. 20 Fairleigh Dickinson's soccer team won a hardfought 21 victory over City College to day in the Metropolitan Confer ence.

title: Bank Reports
description: Bank Reports

title: 5 SLAIN ON COAST AND LEFT IN POOL
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., Oct. 20 A wealthy Santa Cruz eye surgeon, his wife, two of their four children and his secretary were shot to death yesterday and their bodies were dumped into the swimming pool at the doctor's mansion in the rugged hills overlooking Monterey Bay about five miles south of here.

title: Miss Dearborn To Be Married
description: The engagement of Miss Mary Lindsay Dearborn, to B. F. Alex Huppd, son of Dr. and Mrs. B. F. Hupp of Binghamton, N. Y., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. James Andrew Dearborn of Jamaica Estates, Queens, and Deerfields, Mount Holly, Vt.

title: Mrs. Meir Meets Rogers
description: Premier Golda Meir of Israel told Secretary of State William P. Rogers yesterday that Israel was willing to resume ArabIsraeli negotiations only if the United Arab Republic made rectifications for its violation of the Middle East ceasefire.

title: Treasury Statement
description: Treasury Statement

title: Soviet Mathematician's Trial Reported to Have Opened
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 20 (Reuters) A Soviet mathematician, Re volt Pimenov, went on trial to day charged with distributing antiSoviet fabrications, accord ing to dissident sources.

title: Airline Captain Loses His Job In a Fight Over Fuel Dumping
description: A pilot who has flown for Eastern Airlines for 30 years has been discharged following what the airline calls an un necessary procedure that de layed flights. The pilot, how ever, maintains that the proce dure was a quick and simple process that could reduce flight hazards and air pollution.

title: Sandler Defeats Anteby In U.S. OneWall Handball
description: Steve Sandler, the defending champion and topseeded play er, advanced to the semifinal round of the United States Handball Association's onewall singles championships at the Brownsville Boys Club last night. Sandler beat Sam Anteby of the Brighton Y.M.H.A., 121, 218, 216.

title: Deserter, Demolition Expert, Is Held Briefly in Toronto
description: TORONTO, Oct. 20 (UPI) A 21yearold United States Army deserter who is a demo lition expert was released here yesterday after being held in custody for more than 18 hours under the emergency powers invoked against French Cana dian separatist terrorism.

title: Market Place
description: When Ebasco Industries, Inc., was preparing to merge into the Boise Cascade Cor poration, the management of Ebasco, which was once known as Electric Bond and Share, went to great lengths to explain the situation to shareholders.

title: An Apathetic Electorate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20  With two weeks to go, the 1970 election campaign shows every indication of remaining one of history's great nondebates.

title: WarWeary Laotians Hope for CeaseFire With Pathet Lao at Least in North of Country
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Oct. 16 This sleepy capital has come to life with a water festival of canoes racing down the Me kong, dancing monkeys, snake charmers, public singing, four ferris wheels and villagers sell ing dried squid and rice.

title: CORN FUTURES STAGE COMEBACK
description: Corn and soybean futures prices rebounded yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade in active trading after being under selling pressure for the previous six sessions.

title: Clara L. Penney Is Dead; An Author and Scholar, 82
description: Clara Louise Penney, an author and scholar, died Sun day at her home in Clifton, Me. She was 82 years old.

title: Angels Bring the Best Out in Bowlers
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Oct. 20  Angels are replacing breweries and equipment companies as primary spon sors for touring members of the Professional Bowlers As sociation. P.B.A. national, Battista was the Maxwell group's leader, 20th in the field of 170. The quintet seemed assured of cashing in at the end of the week, as there are 56 money awards with $7,500 as the top prize.

title: MORRIS H. BANNISTER
description: PEEKSKILL, N. Y., Oct. 20 Morris H. Bannister, chairman of the board of the First Fed eral Savings & Loan Associa tion, died yesterday of a heart attack. He was 81 years old and lived at 1413 Elm Street.

title: Good News for Vera's Ladies
description: Yesterday, B. Altman & Co. threw a tea for Vera and some of her best customers, whom the store calls Vera's ladies, to introduce the de signer's new collection of fall and resort clothes.

title: RATES DIP SLIGHTLY AT FANNY MAY SALE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (UPI) Interest rates declined slight ly today in the Federal National Mortgage Association's biweek ly auction of commitments to buy $149.7million in Federal Housing Administration and Veterans Administrationbacked mortgages.

title: U.S. and Canada Fight Drinking by Motorists
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 20 (AP) The Governments of Canada and the United States have embarked on a joint project to reduce the number of auto accidents in which alcohol plays a part, the Transport Minister, Don Jamieson, an nounced today.

title: Knicks freak Avva in Fourth uarter to Hand Lakers 115100 Defeat Here
description: A strong third quarter with Willis Reed unavailable for most of it and a runaway fourth quarter in which Reed scored 16 of his 29 points brought the New York Knickerbockers a 115100 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers at Madison Square Garden last night before the season's first capacity crowd of 19,500.

title: Albatross, Nansamond Added To $91,000 Roosevelt Futurity
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Oct. 20 The deadline for supplementing 2yearold pacers to the Roose velt Futurity, set for Roosevelt Raceway on Oct. 31, passed last midnight. It was not until this morning, though, that the entry box was opened by Larry Mailer,: the racing secretary. In side the box were two checks, each for $7,500, and each mak ing a juvenile pacer eligible for the mile event.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Jobless Rate of Black TeenAgers Up to 34.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20  Ilising unemployment in the third quarter of 1970 struck most severely at the poor, the black and the young, according to a report released today by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Labor Department.

title: Excerpts From Interview With President Sadat
description: CAIRO, Oct. 20Following are excerpts from an inter view with President Anwar elSadat of the United Arab Republic conducted in Eng lish last night by C. L. Sulz berger of The New York Times:

title: ADAPT TO CHANGE, BUSINESS IS URGED
description: A need for American busi ness to become more responsive to social challenges and for American shareowners to sup port business in its efforts to adapt to changing times was emphasized yesterday by A. W. Clausen, president of the Bank of America, at a conference on the business outlook in Los Angeles.

title: Brooklyn Democrat Not Overconfident on a 25th Term
description: In the Indian summer of a lifetime in politics, Representa tive Emanuel Celler, the 82 yearold Brooklyn Democrat, is on the campaign trail again this year, seeking election to his 25th consecutive term in the House.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures

title: LEAFS ALTERNATE STARTING GOALIES
description: Either Bruce Gamble, the journeyman who was trans formed into a supergoalie in Madison Square Garden, or Jacques Plante, the old, broken nosed wanderer who was strafed for six goals in his last appearance, will man the nets for Toronto tonight at 7:35 when the Rangers face the Maple Leafs.

title: Massey Ends All Doubts Of Ability to Lead Yale
description: There was speculation at the beginning of the season about the status of Joe Massey, Yale's quarterback. Some observers may have had doubts about Massey's ability to lead the Yale team.

title: U. S. Military Doctors in Jordan Have Performed 800 Operations
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Oct. 16  American military doctors have performed surgery on more than 800 Arabs here as part of a $5million United States emergency relief program after the Jordanian civil war.

title: This Man Must Die, Chabrol Thriller, Begins Run
description: Claude Chabrol's Que la bte meure is a revenge melodrama about a young father who sets out to dis cover and murder the hitand run killer of his little son. By providential chance he learns who was in the fatal car. He pursues first a tele vision actress and then her brotherinlaw, his intended victim, who, it turns out, is a monster whom everybody (except his own awful moth er) would gladly see dead.

title: Inflation Strategy
description: Will the Nixon Administra tion at last be persuaded to abandon its handsoff policy on wages and prices? The latest recruit to the cause of an in comes policy is the Business Council, a group of the nation's top industrialists, who at their Hot Springs meeting last week publicly urged the President to reinforce monetary and fiscal policy with specific measures to keep wage, increases from overleaping pro ductivity gains and pushing up prices. The business leaders then took their case in person to the White House, where Mr. Nixon reportedly maintained a poker face.

title: Johnson Anxiety on War Is Related by His Wife
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20  Exactly one month after order ing the bombing of North Viet nam in February, 1965a date marking a significant escalation of the warPresident Johnson told his wife that he saw no way out of American involve ment.

title: Linda S. Womrath Will Become Bride
description: WILTON, Conn., Oct. 20 Mr. and Mrs. Robert Snyder Womrath have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Snyder Womrath, to Stephen Bosley Palmer, son of Mr. and Mrs. George B. Palmer of Orange, N. J. The wedding is planned for Nov. 21 at the Unitarian Church in Westport.

title: PATRICK WYMARK, BRITISH ACTOR, DIES
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Oct. 20 Patrick Wymark, a wellknown British actor, was found dead in his hotel room in Melbourne this evening, apparently of natural causes. He was 44 years old.

title: Republicans Seek To Win Ethnic Vote
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 20The Re publican party, after 40 years of standing wistfully by, this year is pursuing the white eth nic vote with a vigor that is making ethnic politics a major matter in many of the nation's large industrial centers.

title: PRICE OF GOLD UP IN EUROPE MARKETS
description: LONDON, Oct. 20 (AP)The price of gold rose more than 20 cents in Europe's bullion mar kets today to its highest point in more than a year.

title: SUMNER M. COWDEN
description: WARRENSBURG, N. Y., Oct. 20 (AP)Sumner M. Cowden, former State Superintendent of Fish Culture and a veteran of 45 years in state conservation work, died at a nursing home here yesterday. He was 85 years old.

title: GOVERNOR REBUTS MAYOR'S CHARGES ABOUT AID TO CITY
description: Governor Rockefeller stepped up his counterattack on Mayor. Lindsay yesterday, producing at a street rally 19 former Lindsay aides who were willing to dispute the Mayor's charge that Albany was niggardly to ward City Hall and who pro tested the Mayor's endorsement of Arthur J. Goldberg, the DemocraticLiberal candidate for Governor.

title: Soviet Warns Turkey
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 20The So viet Government newspaper Iz vestia today warned Turkey that failure to extradite the two hijackers of a Soviet air liner could cast a shadow over TurkishSoviet relations.

title: Dream of Library Realized
description: A delivery boy bringing sandwiches to librarians rushing to put thousands of books on the shelves of the new MidManhattan Library before it opens on Monday, seemed stunned by the bright orange carpets, royal blue upholstered chairs and the gleaming escalators. This is no library, this is a giant cocktail lounge, he said.

title: 3 of 4 Nets Up in Chemicals, Drugs
description: Increased profits in the Sep tember quarter were shown by three drug and chemical producers  the American Home Products Corporation, the Bristol  Myers Company and RichardsonMerrell, Inc. in their reports issued yes terday. Only the Celanese Corporation, a leading maker of synthetic fibers that is im portant in chemicals, plastics and coatings, had lower third quarter results.

title: Mirich Goes to Patriots
description: BOSTON, Oct. 20 (UPI)The Boston Patriots signed Rex Mirich, 29yearold defensive linesman, as a free agent today. He played three years with the Oakland Raiders and three years with the Denver Broncos.

title: JOHN CUMMINGS, 82, WRITER ON POLITICS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 20 (UPI)John M. Cummings, re tired political writer and colum nist for The Philadelphia In quirer, died yesterday at his home in suburban Penllyn. He was 82 years old.

title: F. X. PATREY, HEADED! PERFUME COMPANY
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Oct. 20Francis Xroatrey, president of Botirjois, Inc., died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, where he had been under treatment for two weeks for a virus ailment. He was 53 years old and lived at 64 Plymouth Road.

title: Memorial Services
description: ARGUSM. K. (Macy Eisenstadt). A meet ing of friends to pay tribute to the memory of M. K. Argus will be held Sunday, Oct. 25, at 2 P.M., at The Community Church, 40 E. 35th: St. Please omit flowers.

title: Police Patrol Central Paris As Far Leftist Goes on trial
description: PARIS, Oct. 20  Thousands of policemen and security troops patrolled the center of Paris today as one of their most outspoken enemies, Alain Geis mar, a 31yearold science teacher and New Left leader, went on trial on charges of provoking street riots.

title: Mutual Fund Purchases Topped Sales in September
description: The nation's mutual funds purchased about $340million more portfolio securities than they sold last month, figures re leased by the industry's trade association, the Investment Company Institute, indicated yesterday.

title: Stage: Story Theater in New Haven
description: NEW HAVEN  Two Saints, which the Yale Rep ertory Theater is performing this month in repertory with Olympian Games, is a matched, yet contrasting, pair of Story Theater plays. The first, Isaac Bashevis Singer's Gimpel the Fool is about a saintly Jewish fool, the second, Flaubert's St. Julian the Hospitaler, about a murderer turned Catholic saint.

title: Roosevelt Results
description: Roosevelt Results

title: New Philadelphia Accord Proposed for Teachers
description: PHIDALEPHIA, Oct. 20 (UPI) A second tentative agreement in a threeday wage strike by more than 11,000 public school teachers was reached here to day through the efforts of a threejudge panel.

title: Aqueduct Entries
description: Aqueduct Entries

title: Israel Stakes Out Position
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 20Israel staked out an advance position today for expected, but un wolcomed debata on the Mid dle East at the United Nations General Assembly, warning that she would not be bound by any new resolution that the Assembly might adopt.

title: ALGERIAN EXILE FOUND MURDERED
description: BONN, Oct. 20 (Reuters) Belkacem Krim, a former Alge rian revolutionary leader, was found strangled tonight in a Frankfurt hotel, the West Ger man Interior Ministry said.

title: Lindsay's Workers Joining Goldberg Campaign Force
description: Arthur J. Goldberg's campaign for Governor has received a massive infusion of Lindsay organization Aides, ideas and enthusiasm in the wake of Mayor Lindsay's latehour endorsement of the Demo craticLiberal candidate.

title: SHARP RISE SEEN IN CAPITAL BUDGET
description: A record outlay of capital improvement funds for 197172, probably topping $L5billion and including huge sums for transit, schools and environ mental protection, was forecast at City Hall Yesterday.

title: Brooks Robinson Receives Auto As Outstanding Star of Series
description: Harry Dalton, the Man who decides how much of the Baltimore Orioles money Brooks Robinson should re ceivehas shattered the myth that the brilliant third base man receives his entire salary for hitting and none of it for fielding.

title: Executive Changes
description: Lloyd F. Taylor, president, has been appointed chief executive officer of Standard Kollsman In dustries.

title: State Wants More Details On Offtrack Betting Plan
description: New York City's entry in the offtrackbetting futurity was ordered back to the barn for more saddletightening yesterday by the state agen cy that will regulate the venture.

title: For a Group Discussion of Food, You Pick Up the Phone
description: Interest in cooking has been heightened on many fronts:  by the growing nutnber of cookbooks, tele vision cooking shows and cooking schools, by the open ing of new restaurants, by the wider availability of ex otic ingredients. Now food devotees in New York have two new experiences avail able to them.

title: Robert Robinson, Headed Island Development Unit
description: SUFFERN, N.Y., Oct. 20 Robert Robinson executive di rector of the Grand; Bahama Cruise Development Board, died yesterday in Good Samaritan Hospital here after a short ill ness. He was 59 years old and lived at 17 Hillside Court here.

title: Events for Children in City
description: INANOOK OF THE NORTH. (1922), 60 minute film by Robert Flaherty, at 3:30 P.M. Monday at the Museum of Modern Art. 9567078.

title: CAR INSURANCE MEN ASK NEW RATE BASIS
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 20Re versing their position on invest ment income, representatives of the auto insurance industry recommended to the State Board of Insurance today that income from all sources be con sidered in auto ratemaking formulas.

title: CHAMBER PLAYERS START 10TH YEAR
description: The Caecilian Chamber En semble has nine years behind it, but it has given its concerts in peripheral concert halls. On Monday night, it opened its 10th season by venturing into Carnegie Recital Hall. Under the direction of Gerardo Levy, its Argentineborn conductor who is also a flutist, it pre sented an odd assortment of pieces, which made up a mildly stimulating evening.

title: DAVIS TAKES LEAD IN TITLE BOWLING
description: GARDEN CITY, L. L, Oct. 20 Dave Davis came within two pins of a perfect game tonight, but even though he failed to record his sixth 300, the tall lefthander from Miami used his 298 effort to vault into first place in the $75,000 National Championship of the Profes sional Bowlers Association.

title: Sports Today
description: BOWLING

title: Income Off 20% at Republic Steel
description: The Republic Steel Corpo ration, the nation's third largest steel producer and the first of the major con cerns to report thirdquarter earnings, said yesterday in Cleveland that income in the latest period was down =20 per cent from the 1969 level.

title: Results Are Mixed in Flow of Profits
description: Results Are Mixed in Flow of Profits

title: Estate of George Humphrey Joins in. Hanna Stock Sale
description: The estate of George M. Humphrey and other large stockholders disposed yesterday of 278,560 shares of Hanna; Mining Company common stock at $45.50 that were marketed by a First Boston Corporation underwriting group. The main purpose of the sale was to pro vide funds for estate and oth er tax obligations; Mr. Hum phrey was long the head of the concern.

title: Starr and Gabriel: A Clash of Views
description: Perhaps his hometown fans and friends did the man to be honored no favor by sched uling a testimonial dinner for Bart Starr the night before Bart was to take on the Los Angeles Rams difficult de fense. The dinner, in Green Bay, Wis., came complete with the commissioner of pro football, Pete Rozelle, and President Nixon. I know if it had been me, said Roman Ga briel, quarterback of the Rams, I would have preferred any night but the one before the game. There is too much concentration in volved.

title: Meeting on Nursing Homes Told Of Cruel and Callous Treatment
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20  Several dozen speakers de tailed at a meeting here today what they described as the ap palling state of many American nursing homes and the lack of governmental efforts to correct the shortcomings.

title: Lowdenbach in Race Post
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Oct. 20 (AP)Hank Lowdenbach of Tulsa, Okla., a former driver, was named today director of professional racing for the Sports Car Club of America.

title: Holding Unit Plans To Offer High Rate For Small Savings
description: The competition for the sav ing dollar, which is already in tense, appears likely to intens ify further in the near future. The First Union National Ban corp, parent company of the $1.1billion First Union National Bank, which operates statewide in North Carolina, is poised to merchandise a $15million issue of bonds paying interest as high as 7% per cent in denomi nations as small as $2,500.

title: BELGIUM REDUCES BANK RATE TO 7%
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 21The Bel gian National Bank announced a cut in the bank rate today, from 7 per cent to 7 per cent.

title: Truck Group's Chairman Ties Lag in Traffic to Labor Dispute
description: The nation's truckers have noticed a certain softness de velop in truck traffic since the beginning of the month and they believe It reflects the ef fects of the automotive labor situation, including the Gen eral Motors strike, according to C. James McCormick.

title: Stone Union Backs Merger
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 21, (AP) The merger of the 20,000mem ber United Stone and Allied Products Workers Union with the United Steel Workers of America has been approved at the stone union's national con vention. About 135 delegates.

title: UNMANNED ZOND 8 ON WAY TO MOON
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 21  The Soviet Union announced today the launching of Zond 8, an unmanned spacecraft, whose flight plan calls for it to swing around the moon on Saturday and return to the earth next Tuesday.

title: Manson Put at Tate Home 5 Months Before Killings
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct 21 Charles M. Manson returned to the courtroom today and Was promptly confronted by a witness who testified that Manson visited the residence of Sharon Tate five months before she was murdered last year.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: EXPLOSIVES CACHE MYSTIFIES POLICE
description: The identity and whereabouts of a man in whose Brooklyn apartment the police found ex plosives they believe were in tended to blow up several United Nations missions re mained a mystery yesterday after four days of investigation by detectives of the special services division and the Brooklyn District Attorney.

title: White Rome Restates Stand on Goodell's Race
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 21 The White House reiterated again today that it would not endorse the Republidan candi date for United States Senate in New York and hinted at, strong support for the Con servative candidate, James L. Buckley.

title: Midland Gains Polo Final
description: MIDLAND, Tex., Oct. 21 (AP) The Midland Polo Club made a strong bid for its fourth con secutive national 12goal polo championship today, defeating Barrington, Ill., 126, gaining Sunday's final against Spokane, Wash, an 87 winner over Cripple Creek Polo Club of Dallas.

title: DEKONING CONVICTED OF ACCEPTING GIFT
description: William DeKoning Jr., a for mer Long Island labor leader, was convicted in Federal. Court in Brooklyn yesterday of vio lating a provision of the Taft Hartley Act that bans the re ceipt of a gift by a union offi cial from an employer.

title: U.S. Denies Saigon Rumor A CeaseFire May Be Near
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21Re ports from Saigon that the United States and South Viet nam might announce a uni lateral ceasefire in Vietnam before the end of the month drew a categorical denial today from the White House. According to the Saigon re ports, President Nguyen van Thieu has instructed his com manders in the four military regions and provincial gover nors and town mayors to pro vide maximum security in preparation for such a cease fire.

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. San Francisco Warriors, at Madison Square Garden. Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 7:30 P.M. (RadioWNBC, 7:30 P.M.)

title: McDonnell Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21. (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that it had imposed sanctions against seven former employes of Mc Donnell & Co., Inc., a securities firm in liquidation once based in New York, for violations of Federal securities laws.

title: Abusive Calls Reported
description: Abusive telephone callers purporting to represent the OttingerforSenator campaign have been pestering potential voters at odd hours or with repetitive calls orin the case of people with Jewish names during the high holy days, Rep resentative Richard L. Ottinger's campaign manager said yester day.

title: Kennecott Dips Others Show Slim Gains.
description: The Kennecott Copper Cor poration, the leading producer of United States primary cop per, reported yesterday that earnings in the third quarter fell below the comnarablc 1969 level. Kennecott said income from United States operations rose, but the advance was more than wiped out by the absence of dividends from its Chilean holdings.

title: ROYAL BANK REBUTS ABACUS CHALLENGE
description: The president of the Royal National Bank  which is caught in the middle of a bitter proxy fight between the Se curity National Bank, Hunting ton, L. I., and the Abacus Fund, Inc.; Security's biggest share holdercharged yesterday that Abacus had made an irrespon sible and completely unjustified attack on Royal.

title: Yorkville Ball Oct. 30 Will Benefit Youth Programs
description: The Yorkville Youth Coun cil will hold its 11th annual Yorkville Ball Oct. 30 at the Roosevelt Hotel's Terrace Suite. Invitations were ac cepted by 350 persons, who paid $12.50 for the evening.

title: Race in First District at a Glance
description: POPULATION  710,000, the largest in the state, mostly concentrated in the western towns of Islip and Smithtown. Most residents fall into the middleincome bracket. There are many farmers and migrant workers in the east, large numbers of blacks in Central Islip, Bellport and Flanders, and many people engaged in sci entific work at the Brook haven National Laboratory.

title: 50 Drawings by the Old Masters Bring $468,225 at Auction Here
description: European and British dealers appeared last night in force at an auction here of Old Master drawings, but the prizes, col lected by the late Mrs. Jesse Isador Straus, remained in this country.

title: English Asks Housing for 2,700 To Combat City Nurse Shortage
description: The city's new Health and Hospitals Corporation reported yesterday that the 18 municipal hospitals could not keep their nurses because of a lack of housing.

title: BRACKETT PARSONS
description: HARPSWELL, Me., Oct. 21 (AP)Brackett Parsons, former president of the pepperell Manufacturing Company, died at his home here Monday. He was 73 years old.

title: Safeguarding the CeaseFire
description: Prospects for progress toward peace in the Middle East are being seriously endangered by the rigid position both sides are currently voicing in regard to violations of the standstill ceasefire.

title: They're Buying Not Only a Yacht but a Chapter of Presidential History
description: Will the former Presidential yacht, the Julie, become the Good Ship Curly Top?

title: POLICE AND SNIPERS CLASH IN CAIRO, ILL.
description: CAIRO, Ill., Oct. 21 (AP) The police said sniper fire tem porarily pinned policemen be hind an armor barricade in their station tonight and that shots were heard in numerous places throughout this racially divided city.

title: CARDENAS, EXCHIEF, IS BURIED IN MEXICO
description: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 21  Gen. Lazar Cardenas, former President of Mexico, was buried here today hi an elaborate state funeral as this nation of 48 mil lion observed a day of mourn ing.

title: BIG CONGLOMERATE IS BUFFETED IN ITALY
description: ROME, Oct. 21The share of one of the world's larges conglomerates, Montecatini Edi son, S.p.A., dropped to their lowest price in the four year of its existence today amid in dications that the embattlec company would soon have to undergo drastic reorganization Montedison, as the group is known to investors, closed at Milan and Rome exchanges at 880 today.

title: Gun and Urban Warfare Book Shown to Panther Trial Jury
description: A revolver and a book titled Urban Guerrilla Warfare, seized at the Harlem apartment of a Black Panther, were pre sented to the jury hearing the trial of 13 Panthers yesterday.

title: Conservative Is lneliable For Brooklyn House Race
description: As a result of a late filing with the Board of Elections by the Conservative party, Donald J. Walsh, who had been nomi nated by the party for Repre sentative in the 13th Congres sional District of Brooklyn, has been ruled ineligible for that contest.

title: Jump in Living Costs
description: The claims of the Nixon Administration that it has succeeded in slowing down inflation have been thrown into serious doubt by the new consumer price data for September.

title: Bradshaw Draws Fine For Missing Practice
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 21 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Steelers levied a substantial fine on their rookie quarterback, Terry Bradshaw, today for missing practice yesterday after a visit to his home in Shreveport, La.

title: Senator's Kick on TV Blackout Draws HoHum From Rozelle
description: While Pete Rozelle at tended the Bart Starr dinner with President Nixon last Saturday night in GreenMay, Senator William Proxmire was in another part of Wis consin, Muskego Beach, advo cating the lifting of pro foot ball's television blackout of home games.

title: Theodore J. Kauffeld, Engineer And Industrialist, Is Dead at 67
description: Theodore J. Kauffeld, a con suiting engineer and industrial ist, who was chairman of the board and chief executive of ficer of Deverico, Inc., 150 Broadway, technical consultants and designers, died yesterday at his home, 2 Delaware Road in Convent, N.J. His age was 67.

title: MYLAI TRIAL IS OFF FOR AT LEAST DAY
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Oct. 21 The court martial of S. Sgt. David Mitchell was postponed today until tomorrow at the earliest to allow defense at torneys time to round up wit nesses to testify on the alleged mass killing at the South Viet namese hamlet of Mylai 4. The trial of Sergeant Mitchell on a charge of assault with in tent to murder some 30 South Vietnamese civilians in the hamlet was thrown into disar ray yesterday when the trial counsel, or prosecutor, sudden ly rested his case after just three witnesses had been heard.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Overconsumption of Fuels

title: Miss Marylynn Lynch Betrothed
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Oct. 21The engagement of Miss Marylynn Lynch to Paul J. Matacera has been an nounced by State Senator John A. Lynch and Mrs. Lynch, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mrs. Peter G. Matacera and the late Mr. Matacera, who was a partner in the Fa raci Brothers Fuel Oil Com pany here.

title: The Cast
description: The Cast

title: Roosevelt Entries
description: Roosevelt Entries

title: TOP U.S. GENERALS. IN TURKEY MISSING1
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 21 The two topkanking American military men in Turkey are missing on a plane that is feared to have crashed in Mountainous terrain and bad weather in eastern Turkey, it was announced tonight.

title: COPPER FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Copper futures prices rose yesterday on the Commodity Exchange here with the Decem ber contract, the busiest with 509 sales, rising to 49.05 cents from 48.40 cents a pound.

title: SHORT INTEREST SHOWS A DECLINE
description: The New York Stock Ex change yesterday reported that short interest positions fell slightly for the month ended Oct. 15, but the decline was at a slower pace than the pre vious monthtomonth drop.

title: and Queens
description: In the four Congressional districts of Queens this newspaper reendorses the three incumbents and one challenger it supported two years ago.

title: Campus Terror: An Indictment
description: The fall semester is in full swing everywhere. It began shortly after the terrorist bombing at the University of Wisconsin took the life of Robert Fassnacht, seriously injured others, destroyed the life work of several scientists, and resulted in $6 million damages to buildings and equipment.

title: U.S. Greek Catholic Church Becomes Independent Unit
description: NEWCANAAN, Pa., Oct. 21 (UPI)  The Russian Orthodox Greek Catholic Church of Ainerica, which traces its his tory in Arnerica back to 1794, officially became an indepen dent church yesterday by changing its name.

title: Jerseyan, 97, Wins Prize of $100,000 In October Lottery
description: A 97yearold New Jersey man was one of three $100,000 winners yesterday in the monthly New York state lottery. William Kent, of 5209 Liberetay Avenue in North Bergaen, will use his winnings to take care of his family be cause he's kind of old to plan big trips, his oldest child, Mrs. Marion Fetzer, who is 68, said last night.

title: 400 Die in Typhoon
description: MANILA, Thursday, Oct. 22 (Repters)More than 400 per sons were killed by Typhoon Titang which swept across the southern Philippines Sunday, the Red Cross said today.

title: Chronic Campaigning
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21President Nixon has announced plans for more extensive midterm campaigning than any President has done. The record shows that in the twentieth century there are plenty of precedents for this effort, but few of them suggest that it is likely to be rewarding for the Republicans.

title: Bonn Names 3 as Suspects In Killing of Algerian Exile
description: BONN, Oct 21 (Reuters) The West German police today named an Algerian and two Moroccans wanted in connec tion with the murder of a man believed to be Belkacem Krim, the Algerian opposition politi cian in exile.

title: Exchange Tightens Rules On Capital Requirements
description: The New York Sto'ck Ex change has acted to strength en the capital requirements of its member organizations and to insure against sudden capi tal withdrawals that might weaken brokerage houses.

title: Tight Contest Waged in S.I.Brooklyn District
description: A tough, close and un predictable contest is being waged in the 16th Congres sional District, which takes in all of Staten Island and a bit of Brooklyn, by John M. Murphy, the 44yearold Demo cratic incumbent, and former City Councilman David D. Smith, the RepublicanCon servative candidate.

title: JOHN CASHIN, 78, U.S. JUDGE, DIES
description: KINGSTON, N.Y., Oct. 21 Former Federal Judge John M. Cashin of the Southern District Court of New York died today at his home, 166 West Chestnut Street. He was 78 years old.

title: PRIEST RETURNED TO POST AT TOES
description: The Rev. Laurence Gibney, the Roman Catholic chaplain at the Manhattan House of Deten tion who was banned from the jail during the recent prisoner uprising there, was returned yesterday to his duties and praised for his attempts to end the crisis.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Not long after the province of New Brunswick announced that it would have no wood cock hunting this fall because a dangerously high concen tration of DDT had been found in a sampling of birds shot just before the season was to have opened, Maine announced that it was mak ing similar tests.

title: Ceausescu Gets 90Minute Macy Tour
description: The President of Communist Rumania met the president of Capitalist Macy's yesterday. They apparently got along well.

title: BOARD TO REASSESS EXPERIMENTAL HIGHS
description: The Board of Education is taking a new look at its three comprehensive high schools to determine if the ex perimental schools are working out.

title: LINDSAY'S CRITICISM OF COURTS DEFENDED
description: Herbert Sturz, the director of the Vera Institute of Justice, took issue yesterday with an assertion by Stanley H. Fuld, chief judge of the State that Mayor Lindsay's recent critical report on the court system was a disservice to the public and the rule of law.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Travel. The President ap pointed C. Langhorne Wash burn to the new position of Assistant Secretary of Com merce for Tourism. Mr. Wash burn, 52 is director of the United States Travel Service. The President also signed a bill that amends the Inter national Travel Act of 1961 to promote travel to the. United States by foreign visitors in anticipation of improving the balance of pay ments.

title: Credit Union Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21 (UPI) President Nixon signed legis lation today providing manda tory insurance for savings in credit unions and optional in surance for statechartered cred it unions.

title: Impact of Strikes Felt
description: Thirdquarter earnings of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company fell 11,8 per cent and earnings in the first nine Months declined 21 per cent, the na tion's leading rubber company reported yesterday from Akron, Ohio. It blamed long, costly work stoppages and the overall softness in the general economy.

title: Green Revolution Has Sharply Increased Grain Yields but May Cause Problems
description: Until recently the world's food experts were wondering how to drive off the specter of hunger and frustrate the pre dictions of Malthus, who warned in 1798 that population was Outrunning food supply.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: MILWAUKEEAsked waivers on Tito Fran cona, first basemanoutfielder.

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: Charts of Races at Aqueduct

title: HO CHI MINH TRAIL IS BOMBED 13TH DAY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 21 (AP)B52 bombers pounded the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos today for the 13th consecutive day in an attempt to halt the flow of enemy supplies to South Vietnam and Cambodia. Ground activities involving United States forces were light and scattered in South Vietnam, but the Vietcong, in a mortar barrage, damaged a United States Navy support base in the Mekong delta.

title: Treasury Statement
description: Treasury Statement

title: Pacers Win on Foul Line
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Oct. 21 The Carolina Cougars out shot the Indiana Pacers from the floor, but got beat on flawless freethrow shooting tonight as the Pacers con verted 35 of 35 in a 125113 American Association game.

title: Paintings by 2 Hiroshima Witnesses Shown Here
description: Australia, Belgium, China, Czechoslovakia, Denmark, Britain, the Netherlands, Hungary, the Republic of South Africa, the Soviet Union, Sweden, Switzerland and West Germany are among the 20 countries that have already seen The Hiro shima Panels, a set of eight very large paintings memo rializing the victims of the first atomic holocaust. Their first exhibition in Japan at tracted more than nine mil lion visitors, and since then the number has probably doubled. The panels are now in this country for the first time, at the New School Art Center, 65 Fifth Avenue.

title: Poll Indicates Most in U.S Favor U.N. Peace Army
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 21 According to the Gallup Poll, most Americans favor the idea of establishing a United Nations peacekeeping army of 100,000 men. Although many Americans have reservations about the United Nations success in problemsolving, according to the poll, an overwhelming ma jority believe that it is very important that the United States try to make the United Nations a success. These find ings emerged from interviews with 2,963 adults questioned in two national surveys made last month for the 25th anniversary of the United Nations.

title: Profit at General Phone Slips by 3% in 3d Quarter;
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday declines of 3 per cent in third quarter net income and 11 per cent in the first nine months of 1970 despite higher revenues and sales in both periods.

title: Goodell Speaks at College
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Oct. 21 Senator Charles E. Goodell urged voters today to teach Spiro Agnew a lessen on Nov. 3, but he stopped short of calling for the Vice President's removal from the G.O.P. tick et in 1972.

title: Ski Team Fund To Gain at Fete
description: The fourth annual Ski Ball, honoring the United States Alpine and Nordic Ski Teams, will be held in the Grand Ballroom at the WaldorfAs toria next Thursday. J. Neg ley Cooke Jr. and Ernest T. Greeff are cochairmen for the event. Proceeds will go to the United States Ski Team Fund, which supports the de velopment and continued training of young skiers and racers, who are America's Olympic hopefuls.

title: Firing Heard in Amman
description: AMMAN, Oct. 21 (Reuters) Bursts of machinegun fire were heard today in some parts of Amman.

title: Big Louisiana Swamp Is Slowly Dying
description: CHARENTON, La.  Carl Cadine, a swamp Cajun by birth and upbringing and now at age 40 by preference, swallowed the thick coffee his wife had poured and talked about the place he loves, the Atchafalaya Swamp, and how it is dying.

title: Chess:
description: The Rev. William Lom bardy of New York, a former world junior champion, is hard man to turn away from what he considers best in complicated position. Witness the game played between Lombardy and National Mas ter Ungureanu of Rumania. The game, a Sicilian Defense was played during the recent 19th Chess Olympiad at Sie gen, West Germany.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Premier Golda Meir of Israel told the United Nations General Assembly yester day that her country was willing to continue the Middle East ceasefire without a time limit but was not prepared to resume nego tiations with the Arabs until the situation obtaining at the time when the ceasefire went into effect is restored. Later in the day, Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union called, the charges of Egyptian ceasefire violations nothing but a fabrication and called for immediate re newal of the peace talks. [Page 1, Col. 1.]

title: Books of The Times
description: Organ music, please, and a little atten tion from the choir. Youth culture has got ten its very own Norman Vincent Peale in the person of Charles A. Reich. And his positive thinking is this. America has passed through two stages of conscious ness. The first, Consciousness I, was the laissezfaire mentality of the 19th century

title: Adair to Manage Hawaii
description: HONOLULU, Oct. 21 (UPI) The Hawaii Islanders of the Pacific Coast League named Bill Adair as manager today.

title: Luncheon Will Benefit Children's. Service Unit
description: MILLBURN, N. J., Oct. 21 The Children's Service Com Mittee will benefit from a lunoheon and fashion show at the Chanticler here next Monday and Tuesday.

title: The Campaign for Governorship of Colorado: A Lullaby vs. 30,000 Handshakes
description: DENVER, Oct. 20In a way, Mark Hogan has been an albatross around Gov. John A. Love's neck for the last four years, but the voters of Colo rado will settle that when they elect one of them Governor.

title: Dance: Feld in Brooklyn
description: The American Ballet Com pany,. known more plausibly elsewhere as the Eliot Feld Company, last night opened its fall season at its home at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. It looked in very good shape  with its personal style not only intact but sharpened.

title: RAYMOND E. HILDEBRAND
description: TOLEDO Ohio, Oct. 21 Raymond E. Hildebrand, a Re publican who served 20 years in the Ohio Legislature between 1931 and 1965, collapsed in downtown building yesterday afternoon and was pronounced dead on arrival at it. Vincent's Hospital., He was 74 years old.

title: Miss Weld Wed To Jack Vaughn, ExAmbassador
description: LONDON, Oct. 21Jack Hood Vaughn, a former am bassador and director of the Peace Corps, and Miss Mar garet Anne Weld were mar ried here yesterday.

title: College, School Results
description: College, School Results

title: First Breeder of Afghans in the Antilles Is a Success
description: Anne van der Vlis is a woman of distinction in Cu racao, Netherlands Antilles. She is a barrister, specializ ing in corporation law. She also is the only breeder of Afghan show dogs. But we have no shows on the is land, she said, so in order to aet my hounds to compete, I have to tly to other islands or to the United States.
