description: Article 1  No Title

title: Facts in Brief on the 6th District
description: POPULATIONThere are 500,257 in the district, mixed ethnically, ranging from blue collar workers in the indus trial east to farmers and estateowners in the west.

title: 2 DYNAMITE CACHES FOUND IN BROOKLYN
description: Two lots of dynamite were found within an hour and a half yesterday in Brooklyn's Bushwick and Park Slope sec tions.

title: Idle Capacity Up; Use in 3d Quarter Dropped to 76.2%
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26 Idle capacity in manufactur ing increased further in the third quarter of this year, the Federal Reserve Board re ported today.

title: Local Issues Blocking National Trend
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Oct. 26 One week to go and an old American political disease localitispocks the landscape. A Republican President and Vice President are pleading for a parliamentarystyle majority of loyalists in Congress, but, individual personalities, elec toral oddities and local peculiarities appear to be taking hold in most places. In an energetic final swing, Mr. Nixon will head this week into the sunbelt states of Florida, Texas and California to try to shore up sagging Re publican Senate campaigns with appeals for help in Washington. But the President has had sec ond thoughts about a television finale that would have served up all his party's candidates from one or more regions in a single ideological stew. Vice President Agnew railed against Manhattan radicals in the Carolinas today at the start of a last lap around the South and Midwest. But he, too, be gan to concentrate on local is sues with a vigorous pitch for Southern conservative on the Supreme Court, a quota on textile imports and a ban on busing to integrate the schools.

title: Illinois, With Valek at Helm, Holds Normal Monday Drill
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Oct. 26 (AP)The Illinois football team returned to a normal practice today following a bizarre weekend in which Coach Jima Valek was dismissed and then rehired.

title: Nat'1 Basketball Ass'n
description: Nat'1 Basketball Ass'n

title: DR. A.C. SILVERMAN
description: SYRACUSE, Oct. 26 (AP) Dr. A. Clement Silverman, a wellknown physician who spe cialized in pediatrics, was killed today when he was struck by an automobile. He was 83 years old.

title: Indiana Standard Gains
description: The Union Oil Company of California reported yesterday lower earnings for the quarter and ninemonth period ended Sept. 30. Profits of the Stand ard Oil Company (Indiana) were up for The quarter, but down for the ninemonth period, and the smaller Murphy Oil Corpo ration showed increases in net income for both periods.

title: Arkansas Trial Postooned
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 26 (AP)The trial of James L. Townley, 38 years old of Hurst, Tex., first of seven persons to be tried on charges of conspir ing to conceal defects in parts made by the Self Manufacturing Company of Walnut Ridge for the F111 warplane, was post poned indefinitely here today.

title: G. E. FAITHFULL, PATENT LAWYER
description: BEDFORD, N.Y., Oct. 26 George Edward Faithfull of Mianus River Road, a New York patent lawyer long active in civic affairs here, died yes terday in Northern Westchester Hospital after a long illness. His age was 66.

title: TREVINO IS AHEAD IN POINT STANDING
description: Lee Trevino took the lead in professional golf's point race by tying for second In the Kaiser International last weekend, and Billy Casper retained his lead in the moneywinning division even though he did not survive the 36hole cut in the same event.

title: THREE FRANKLINS AT PHILHARMONIC
description: It was Franklin Soul Night at Philharmonic Hall on Sunday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
ABRAHAM VERBELL
description: Abraham Verbell, a supervi sory inspector with the Cus toms Service, died Saturday evening, apparently of a heart attack. He was 67 years old and lived at 6771 Yellowstone Boulevard, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Man Gets 25 Years to Life In Slaying in East Village
description: Santos Bermudez, alleged leader of an East Village rob bery gang, received a 25year tolife sentence yesterday for the $14 robberymurder of a 27yearold man on Feb. 7, 1969.

title: Indians Assail Keatinff Talk
description: KANPUR, India, Oct. 26 (AP) Several hundred students protesting United States arms sales to Pakistan today tried to prevent Ambassador Kenneth B. Keating from delivering speech in this northern indus trial center today. The students attempted unsuccessfully to block his car as it entered the campus of the Indian Institute of Technology and they then walked out during his speech.

title: Reid, Seeking Reelection, Favored in 3may Westchester Race
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 26 Representative Ogden R. Reid, the fourterm Republican run ning with Liberal party en dorsement, is running for reelection in the 26th district against a Democrat who has failed seven times to get elect ed to local offices and a 28 yearold salesman who, as a Conservative candidate, is making his first try for elective office.

title: MRS. HAROLD PRESTON
description: Mrs. Eugenia Preston, a pianist and teacher on the staff of the Metropolitan School of Music, died Sunday of can cer at Montefiore Hospital. The widow of Harold Preston, she was 64 years old and lived at 1015 Grand Concourse, the Bronx.

title: Mongo's Pride, $19, Larceny Kid, $9, Win at Big A
description: Mongo's Pride, $19, Larceny Kid, $9, Win at Big A

title: TRIAL OF 11 STARTS ON KICKBACK CHARGE
description: Three weeks after the murder of one of the defendants in a Teamsters Union pension fund kickback case, a jury trial of 11 men accused of carrying out a bribery scheme through or ganized crime councils in New York, Detroit, and Pittsburgh began in Federal Court there yesterday.

title: Dr. Raymond B. Blakney Dead; College President and Author
description: CLAREMONT, Calif., Oct. 26 The Rev. Dr. Raymond D. Blakney, former president of Olivet (Mich.) College, an au thor and translator of Chinese manuscripts, died here Satur day. He was 74 years old.

title: Japanese Gymnasts Capture World FreeExercise Title
description: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, Oct. 26 (AP)Japanese gym nasts swept the men's individ ual freeexercise events at the world championships today and successfully defended the team title with a total of 571.10 points.

title: Lefkowitz for Attorney General
description: As Attorney General of this state since 1957, Louis J. Lefkowitz has been a vigorous defender of consumer interests and an innovator in several other important fields. His activities in policing security frauds and breaches of civil rights, as well as his more recent interest in environmental protection, give him high marks in an office held by distinguished predecessors. Attorney Gen eral Lefkowitz, running this time on both the Republican and Liberal lines, merits reelection.

title: FIGHT BLACKED OUT IN A COAST THEATER
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Oct. 26 (AP)About 1,400 fans were disappointed tonight when the closedcircuit tele cast of the Muhammad Ali Jerry Quarry fight was blacked out at the Grenada Theater.

title: Major Independents
description: Major Independents

title: Cholera in Eastern Slovakia
description: GENEVA, Oct. 26 (AP)The World Health Organization said today that it had been officially notified by the Czechoslovak Government of an outbreak of cholera in eastern Slovakia. There have been no fatalities thus far, the organization said. Eastern Slovakia borders the Soviet Union and Hungary.

title: Nantucket Ponders Hippies
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Oct. 26 (AP)  Voters in this island community 30 miles at sea have been summoned to a spe cial town meeting. Nov. 5 to consider bylaws designed to rid the island of what selectmen call the hippie element.

title: HENRY P. WHERRY
description: MIDDLEBURY, Vt., Oct. 26 Henry P. Wherry, a mining engi neer, died today in a nursing home after a long illness. He was 90 years old and had lived in Middlebury since 1948.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The decision by Crown Publishers, Inc., to bring out new editions of two extremely important and outofprint trout and trout fly works by American authors deserves applause.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
description: Roosevelt Drivers

title: Garden State Results
description: Garden State Results

title: EARNINGS LISTED BY WESTERNUNION
description: The Western Union Corpora tion and subsidiaries reported yesterday gains in revenues and net Income for the first nine months of this year. Revenues rose to $299million from $289 million a year earlier. Net in come was $17.5million, or $1.71 a share, compared with $17.4million, or $1.86 a share on fewer shares, in the nine months ended Sept. 30, 1969. There were 9,039,353 shares outstanding in the 1970 period and 8,258,978 a year earlier.

title: Foster Hewitt Is Honored Here For Career as Voice of Leafs
description: Foster Hewitt, the announcer whose opening greeting, Hello Canada, and hockey fans in the United States, has been heard for every game the Toronto Maple Leafs have played, was honored here last night for long and distinguished service to the game.

title: JUROR HANDCUFFS HIMSELF AT TRIM
description: A juror at the trial of 13 Black Panthers here Inadver tently locked a pair of hand cuffs on his right wrist yester day, causing adjournment a half hour early.

title: 3 Candidates Support Rights of Homosexuals
description: Three of the major state wide candidates have issued statements in support of the Gay Activists Alliance plat form on homosexual civil rights.

title: Two States to Sign Pact For the New Haven Line
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced last night that contracts for New York and Connecticut to take over the deteriorated New Haven commuter rail line, starting Jan. 1, would be signed today.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: Amer. Basketball Ass'n

title: The Stage: Story Theater Opens at Ambassador
description: Let me beat no longer about the bush. I had a great evening last night at Paul Sills's Story Theater at the Ambassador Theater. I adored the show, which brings back magic and innocence to Broadway, raises charades to the strange eminence of an art form, and demonstrates the essential theatricality of children's games.

title: Adams Criticizes Aid to Goodell By Carpetbag Senators in State
description: WATERTOWN, N. Y., Oct. 26Dr. Paul L. Adams, the Conservative party candidate for Governor, denounced today carpetbag Senators coming in from outside to help Repub lican candidates in New York State.

title: Mystic Known as the Greatest Sage of Cambodia Is Said to Have Strong Influence on Premier Lon
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 27The phase of the moon was propitious for the presentation of new robes to monks and a handful of women gathered at the pagoda atop Pnom Daun Penh bearing bolts of yel low cloth.

title: Miss Davis Is Continuing Her Prison Hunger Strike
description: Angela Davis, the 26yearold black Marxist militant arrested here two weeks ago on Cali fornia charges arising out of fatal shootout in a courthouse at San Rafael, completed the third day of a hunger strike yesterday in the Women's House of Detention.

title: CEYLON HOUSE VOTES TO ABOLISH SENATE
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon. Oct. 27 The House of Representatives today approved by 117 votes to 16 a bill to amend the Con stitution and abolish the Sen ate, the upper house of Cey lon's Parliament.

title: Queens Girl Found, Dead In Ravine in California
description: SALINAS, Calif., Oct. 27 (AP)The Monterek County coroner said today that the body of a young woman found in a ravine 150 feet south of the MontereySalinas Highway had been positively identified through dental charts as that of Eve Hindin, 19 years old, of 13942 230th Street, Laurelton, Queens, N. Y.

title: BRITISH TAX MOVE SPURS STOCK HST
description: The British Government's announcement yesterday of 6pence reduction in basic tax rates and a proposed cut of more than a billion pounds in its spending by 197475 had bullish effect yesterday on the London Stock Exchange.

title: Tokyo String Ensemble Shows Technical Poise
description: Considering the formidable number of Japanese string players making their marks on the world's stages, it should surprise no one that four of them have banded to gether into an excellent quartet. The Tokyo String Quartet, which made its New York debut Monday night at Town Hall, is composed of graduates of the famous Toho School of Music who spent two years here study ing repertory with Robert Mann and Raphael Hillyer of the Juilliard Quartet.

title: Nixon to Send High Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 President Nixon intends to send Charles A. Meyer, Assistant Secretary of State for Inter American Affairs, as his per sonal representative to the inauguration of President Al lende.

title: TV: Problems of Citizens Broadcasting Committee
description: The National Citizens Com mittee for Broadcasting, which on Monday held its first conference on citizens rights in broadcasting, was an occasion of more than passing significance. No one was more surprised than the committee, when at least 1,200 people showed up at the Americana, a dramatic demonstration of growing con cern over TV. Yet probably few knew of the committee's own problems.

title: NEW AARMS PLAN OFFERED IN NATO
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 Military commanders of the North Atlantic Treaty Organi zation would be permitted to move atomic land mines close to potential crisis areas under a new policy that is expected to be approved this week by the alliance's nuclear planning group.

title: Holding the Line in Europe
description: A threeway offer by the European allies to increase their share of the West's defense burden is emerging the first fruit of President Nixon's Oct. 4 pledge that the United States would under no circumstances reduce its NATO forces, except in a mutual cutback with the Warsaw Pact.

title: JACOB W. SHOUL, 75, POLICY SALES STAR
description: Jacob W. Shoul, one of the country's most successful life insurance salesmen, died Mon day in Beth Israel Hospital, Brookline, Mass. He was 75 years old. Mr. Shoul, whose home was in the Boston suburb, had suffered from heart disease for several years.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE APPROACH TO KINGS. By Patrick An derson. 373 paves. Doubleday. $6.95.

title: Mayor Fills Six Vacancies on Board of Correction
description: Declaring that the Board of Correction must help bring about basic improvement with in the criminal justice system, Mayor Lindsay yesterday filled six board positions for which the terms had expired one to five years ago.

title: Three Get Housing Posts
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI) President Nixon named today Peter John Bertoglio of Pitts mrgh, Calif.; Woodward King man of New York, and Ray A. Watt of Torrance, Cali., to thp National Corporation for Hous ing Partnerships, which encour ages private investment in the housing industry.

title: Foreign Exchange
description: Seling Prices, Now York Market

title: Photos of 1800's Depict City History
description: Looking back to an earlier New York is an everyday oc cupation for the NewYork Historical Society and the many researchers who delve in its archives. For the first time, however, the librarymuseum at 170 central Park West, near 77th Street, has mounted a major photograph ic show toward that end Eye on the City: The Photog rapher in New York, 1840 1900.

title: ARMY COURT TOLD OF RACIAL TENSION
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Oct. 27A United States Army prosecutor, opening his case against Sgt. James E. Hobson in a general courtmartial here, said today that he intended to show that the Vietnam battle field hero and onetime Chicago delinquent had only aided and abetted others in a bloody grenadethrowing incident.

title: Minnesota Orchestra Blazes a Trail
description: One summer weekend in 1964, a group of business men holed up in a hotel in Stillwater, Minn., to decide the perilous future of the Minneapolis Symphony Or chestra, whose fortunes they controlled as members of its executive committee. The de cisions they reached at Still water ran deep, and are still reverberating in the board rooms of some similarly trou bled musical institutions.

title: TORIES CUT TAXES AND OUTLAY IN BID TO SPUR ECONOMY
description: LONDON, Oct. 27Britain's new Government cut taxes, subsidies and public spending today in a dramatic affirmation of the Conservatives belief in a freeenterprise economy.

title: WORLD RIFLE MATCH IRKS U.S. SHOOTERS
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Oct. 27 (UPI) American shooters, beaten by the Russians in the 40th world championship, have let it be known they were not pleased with the operation of the match, the first one held in America since 1923.

title: Assembly Marks Time
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27The United Nations General Assembly marked time today in its debate on the Mid dle East pending another meet ing tomorrow morning of the representatives of the United States, the Soviet Union, Britain and France.

title: U. S. Aides Feel Cairo Admits Breaches
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 American officials are inter preting public comments by Mahmoud Riad, the Egyptian Foreign Minister, as tacit ac knowledgment by the United Arab Republic that it has vio lated the standstill ceasefire of Aug. 7 although Mr. Riad denies any violation.

title: Market Summary
description: (Volume 2,913,775 snares)

title: Small Soviet Plane Hijacked to Turkey
description: SINOP, Turkey, Oct. 27 Two Soviet students blind folded the pilot of a small Russian passenger plane to day and guided the aircraft across the Black Sea to this coastal town. It was the sec ond hijacking of a Soviet plane to Turkey in two weeks.

title: THIRD SIDE ARISES IN TEXTILE TALKS
description: LUXEMBOURG, Oct. 27 The European Economic Com munity signaled the United States today that it is pre pared to import an unspeci fied amount ofadditional Jap anese textile products to head off protectionist American trade legislation.

title: Four Guerrillas Reach Cuba In Exchange for Americans
description: MIAMI, Oct. 27 (UPI)The Havana radio reported today the arrival in Cuba of four guerrillas released from prison in Costa Rica for exchange for four Americans aboard a hi jacked Costa Rican airliner.

title: FIVE NEW AREAS LACKING IN JOBS ARE LISTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The Labor Department reported to day that Los Angeles and four other major labor market areas had been added to the list of those with substantial unem ployment, and that two others had been removed.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 27  The General Motors Cor poration will produce cars that emit no significant pollutants starting with its 1975 models, Edward N. Cole, president of the corporation, said here to day.

title: How to Lose Even If You Win
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27In a very practical sense, it is not too much or too early to say that President Nixon has already lost the election of 1970.

title: Donaldson, Lufkin Restructured
description: Donaldson, Lufkin & Jen rette, Inc., the institutional brokerage concern, announced yesterday a decentralization of management responsibility un der which William H. Donald son will relinquish responsibili ty for daytoday operations to Richard H. Jenrette.

title: Ossie Solem, ExFootball Coach At Iowa and Syracuse, 78, Dies
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 27 (AP) Oscar M. Solem, a football coach for more than 40 years, died at a hospital here last evening. He was 78 years old.

title: French Are Negotiating Trade Pact With Hanoi
description: LUXEMBOURG, Oct. 27 France is negotiating a five year commercial treaty with North Vietnam. This was dis closed today in a communique after a meeting of the Council of Ministers of the European Economic Community, or Com mon Market.

title: EXCORNELL PILOT LEADS WINGS HERE
description: Ned Harkness returns to New York tonight, not to visit an ivycovered schoolhouse but to bring a team into a steel and brick building on Seventh Avenue.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: Amer. Basketball Ass'n

title: Biaggi Is Rated the OddsOn Favorite Over Periconi
description: Representative Mario Biaggi, the Democratic incumbent, and his Republican opponent, for mer Bronx Borough President Joseph F. Periconi, share the belief that a strong conserva tive tide is running in the 24th Congressional District, com prising Upper Bronx and the lower part of Yonkers.

title: MAN WITH KNIVES KILLED BY POLICE
description: A 45yearold man who con tended that the owner of a Harlem bar owned him two bottles of champagne died in a barrage of 11 police bullets last night.

title: Credit Markets: Rates Raised on New Bond Issues
description: The taxexempt bond market bent yesterday but it did not break. Then it snapped back Quite vigorously.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: G.I. Says He Cannot Recall Shooting at Mylai
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Oct. 27 (AP)Specialist 4 Robert W. T'Souvas, one of 10 soldiers charged in the alleged massacre at Mylai 4, in South Vietnam, took the witness stand today at his pretrial hearing and said he did not remember whether he had shot two Vietnamese persons.

title: ST. REGIS SETS RISE IN PAPERBAG PRICES
description: The St. Regis Paper Company announced yesterday it would increase prices by 3 per cent on all multiwall and small bags, and by $6 a ton on all grades of multiwall bag papers, effec tive April 1, 1971.

title: Gromyko Heckled in London
description: LONDON, Oct. 27 (AP)The Soviet Foreign Minister Andrel A. Gromyko, was heckled here today by demonstrators pro testing treatment of Jews in the Soviet Union. Demonstrators followed Mr. Gromyko through out a day of conferences with British leaders.

title: A Man Who Lives With Himself
description: AMMANThe credo of Jordan's King Hussein, who is now trying to glue together a strifetorn country, is that in the end a chief of state must do what he considers right, regardless of consequences. He feels, therefore, that he had to take the hard decision to confront Palestine Arab guerrillas when they sought to challenge his rule.

title: PURSE FOR BOUT ABOVE ESTIMATE
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 27  Mu hammad Ali's eventual purse from last night's bout was pro jected today at between $800,000 and $900,000 by Robert L. Kassel, chairman of the board of Sports Action. Inc, the closedcircuit TV con cern. Jerry Quarry's share will he half that.

title: Con III Is Not the Answer
description: In his recent articles Mr. Charles A. Reich has made himself the spokes man for a condition of the spirit that has characterized the academic New Left generally in these last months.

title: MRS. FRANK H. KAUFMAN
description: GARRISON, N. Y., Oct. 27 Mrs. Euphemia Cornell Kauf man, a former social worker for the Brooklyn Bureau of Charities, died tonight at But terfield Memorial Hospital in Cold Spring at the age of 70. She lived here on Old Albany Post Road.

title: AGNEW CRITICIZES AN ANTIWAR GROUP
description: Vice President Agnew re newed his attack on Senator Charles E. Goodell and Other radical liberals in Congress last night, calling them neo isolationists who endanger the national defense.

title: Executive Changes
description: Dr. Pascal Levesque has been elected president, chief executive officer and director of the High Voltage Engineering Corporation.

title: Ambivalence in Moscow
description: There has been a curious ambivalencesuggestive intense debate at high Kremlin levelsin the Soviet re action to the accidental landing on Soviet territory of an unarmed plane carrying two American generals, their pilot and a Turkish officer.

title: Rates on Bills Show a Decline At Treasury's Monthly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last month's levels, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: Hijack Trouble for the Turks
description: The hijacking of a second Soviet aircraft to Turkey compounds a Turkish dilemma with world implications.

title: TimesMirror Will Purchase Outstanding Stock of Newsday
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27The TimesMirror Company an nounced today an agreement to purchase the remaining out standing shares of Newsday, Inc., to complete its acquisi tion of the Long Island news paper.

title: Senator Irked
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell, who has become increasingly bitter about the lack of sup port from Governor Rockefeller, tried to schedule a meeting with his Republican running mate yesterday to demand that Mr. Rockefeller publicly attack James L. Buckley, the Con servative party candidate for Senator.

title: $915,000 for Goldberg
description: ALBANY, Oct. 27Prelimi nary reports filed here today indicate that Arthur J. Gold berg's major campaign commit tees have thus far raised a total of about $915,000 to fi nance the DemocraticLiberal candidate's race for Governor.

title: WILLIAM E. HENDRIE
description: GREENLAWN, L. I., Oct. 27 William E. Hendrie, a retired New York City school principal, died yesterday in a nursing home in Huntington. He was 97 years old.

title: Theater: A Passage to E. M. Forster
description: The ANTA Matinee Series at the Theatre de Lys reached its 15th season yesterday afternoon with A Passage to E. M. Forster, a dramatic miscellany arranged by Wil liam Roerick and Thomas Coley from the writings of Forster.

title: Women's Back Pay Ordered
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)The United States Department of Labor ordered the City of Quin cy today to pay more than $65, 000 in restitution pay to the 262 female nurses aides who have been employed in patient care at Quincy City Hospital. The department said the differ ences in male and female pay at the hospital since February, 1968, violated the equal pay provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act.

title: Democrat Assailed
description: BUFFALO, Oct 27James L. Buckley, the Conservative can didate for the Senate, today accused his Democratic oppo nent, Representative Richard L, Ottinger, of supporting farout and extremist groups.

title: McDonnell Plans Expansion
description: The McDonnell Douglas Cor poration announced yesterday, that it planned a vigorous ex pansion of its computer service business, William R. Orthwein Jr. was named president and chief executive officer of the McDonnell Douglas Automation Company, a newly formed sub sidiary. He had been a vice president of the McDonnell Douglas Corporation.

title: THREE SCIENTISTS WIN NOBEL PRIZES
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 27Nobel Prizes were awarded today to an Argentine chemist who has explored the nature of body sugar and to two physicists for independent research in mag netism and the behavior of high energy conductive gases in magnetic fields.

title: Samuelson Contribution
description: Nine years ago, before there was any Nobel Prize in Eco nomics, Prof. Paul A. Samuel son of the Massachusetts In stitute of Technology said in his presidential address to the American Economics Associa tion, No one gets a Nobel prize for an essay on the relation ship of quantum mechanics to free will and God; but one who has already re ceived such a prize will get a better hearing for his ran dom or systematic thoughts on this topic. Now that he has become the first American to be awarded the Nobel Prize in Eco nomics, Professor Samuelson is presumably free to discuss the relationship of the business cy cle to free will and God, but it seems unlikely that he will.

title: U. S. CONSULS SEE 4 HELD IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27The pilot of the United States Army plane that violated Soviet air space last week with two generals aboard was reported today to have told American consular officers that he landed in Soviet territory because of heavy winds and his own mis takes.

title: Phillips Net Drops
description: Higher costs of manu facturing and marketing petro leum and chemical products without offsetting product price increases contributed to the lower earnings of the Phil lips Petroleum Company in the three and nine months ended Sept. 30, the report of W. W. Keeler, chairman, disclosed vesterdly.

title: EDGAR S. KATLIN SR.
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Oct. 27 Edgar S. Katlin Sr., retired president of the Pejepscot Pa per Company, a division of the Hearst Corporation, died yes terday in Regional Memorial Hospital here, after a short ill ness. He was 77 years old.

title: FRONT'S RESPONSE ON CROSS AWAITED
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 27 (Reu ters)The police today hoped for a response from the kid flappers of the senior British Trade Commissioner in Quebec, James R. Cross, to a radio ap peal made by the diplomat's wife for his immediate release.

title: IvyColored Nostalgia
description: These remarks are from a talk to the American Council on Education Samuel B. Gould, former Chancellor of the State University of New York, on what he misses about higher education.

title: Istanbul Still Panicky as Cholera Wanes
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Oct. 27 The cholera epidemic now receding in Istanbul, where the death toll stood today at 49, Continues to create panic among residents, political prob lems for the government and economic distress for export ers.

title: AMEX EASES AGAIN AS TRADING GAINS
description: The American Stock Ex change finished lower yester day in slightly steppedup trad ing.

title: ZOND 8 SPLASHES INTO INDIAN OCEAN
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27The So viet Union announced tonight that Zond 8, an unmanned spacecraft, had splashed down today in the Indian Ocean after a weeklong circumlunar mis sion during which it photo graphed the moon.

title: Rockefeller Says Poll Gives Him 8Point Lead
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 27 (UPI) Governor Rockefeller said tonight that his latest poll showed he was leading Arthur J. Goldberg, the Democratic gubernatorial candidate by 8 percentage points. He said the same poll showed Repre sentative Richard Ottinger, the Democratic senatorial candidate, slightly ahead of James L. Buckley, the Conservauve candidate in the threeway Senate race, but that Senator Charles E. Goodell still had a fighting chance to win the election.

title: Residency Law for Voters In Virginia Upset by Court
description: ALEXANDRIA, va., Oct. 27, (AP)Virginia's oneyear resi liency requirement for voters was struck down yesterday by a threejudge Federal court panel here.

title: Housing Authority Halts Eviction Proceedings
description: The New York City Housing Authority agreed in Federal Court yesterday to suspend all eviction proceedings for two weeks or until Judge Walter R. Mansfield decides it has set up new procedures that do not vio late tenants Constitutional rights.

title: Oil Concern Changes Name
description: TULSA, Okla., Oct. 27 (UPI) The Pan American Petroleum Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Standard Oil Company of Indiana, said today it would change its name to the Amoco Production Compa ny as of next Feb. 1.

title: Quebecker Held 3 Days In Error and Released
description: HULL, Que., Oct. 27 (Cana dian Press)Bernard Lortie, a 19yearold University of Ottawa student, was freed from jail here today, almost three days after the police first realized he was not the alleged kidnapper of the Front for the Liberation of Quebec whom they had been seeking.

title: LEARY AND THREE LEAVE LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 27 Timothy Leary, the drugculture advocate who escaped from a California prison last month, was ushered out of Lebanon with three friends today. The four were subsequently refused entry to the United Arab Re public.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: With all the immediate participants of the Mideast crisisEgypt, Jordan, Syria, Iraq and Israelsimultaneously going through major political readjust ments and the two superpowers in creasingly aware of the threat of uncontrolled escalation, now seems particularly appropriate time to re define the nature of the problem.

title: NIXON SIGNS BILL TO GIVE CITIES AID IN WASTE DISPOSAL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The White House announced today that President Nixon signed last night an act authorizing $463 million in appropriations over three years to help states and cities plan and construct sys tems for solid waste disposal and recovery.

title: Norina in Ton Pasquale Performed by Reri Grist
description: Illness forced Reri Grist out of the role of Norina in the season's first performance of Don Pasquale at the Metro politan Opera, on Oct. 20, but she was very much present in the first repetition of the Doni zetti work on Monday night. She was pretty to look at and pretty to hear.

title: DEMOCRATS KEEP GALLUP POLL LEAD
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 27 With the election less than a week away, the semifinal Gal lup Poll shows the Democrats holding their lead in the race for the 435 seats in the House of Representatives.

title: Money
description: Tuesday. Oct. 27. 1970

title: News Summary and Index
description: The British Government affirmed its belief in a freeenterprise economy yesterday by cutting taxes, subsidies and spending. The dramatic step was the beginning of what the Tories say will be a fundamental re form of the role of Government and public authorities. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Insurers Honor Official
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27The Na tional Association of Mutual In surance Agents announced to day that it had named George K. Bernstein, Federal Insurance Administrator, as its 1970 Fed eral Man of the Year. He was cited for his dynamic ap proach to the problem of flood insurance, development of a riot insurance program and his ef forts to solve the problems of crime and property insurance.

title: State Starts 50c Lottery Next Month
description: ALBANY, Oct. 27A quick selling, fastpayoff 50cent lottery with a top prize of $5,000 will be started by the state next month to augment the regular monthly lottery and the special milliondollar lotteries.

title: Only One of Nine Favorites Is Successful at Aqueduct;
description: Chalk players  those who put their faith and their green backs on favorites  put in a lonely vigil through almost all of yesterday's program at Aqueduct as they saw the first seven favorites beaten, two of them oddson.

title: BITTER HUMOR EASES TONE OF CAPRICHOS
description: Unrelenting tragedy soon fails to hold the attention and must be modulated with other elements to achieve its fullest theatrical effects. Herbert Ross's sardonic Caprichos, danced by the American Ballet Com pany last night for the first time this season at the Brook lyn Academy of Music, skillfully enlisted bitter humor as its catalytic agent.

title: Advertising: What Makes the Going Great
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 27 Undoubtedly the happiest man at the Homestead today as the Association of Nation al Advertisers reached the midpoint of its threeday meeting is not an advertiser at all but an agency man.

title: College and School Results
description: College and School Results

title: WALTER P. HAMILTON SR
description: SETAUKET, L. I., Oct. 27 Walter P. Hamilton Sr. of 2 Coraway Road, retired manager for worldwide lubricating oil sales for Penola, a subsidiary of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died today in Mather Hospital, Port Jefferson. He was 70 years old.

title: Dealer Says Federal Guarantee May Be Needed to Market Postal Service Bonds
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27A major bond dealer told nearly 3,000 delegates to the fourth annual National Postal Forum today that the recently created United States Postal Service would face tremendous com petition in a crowded money market when it issued bonds for financing.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Entertainment Events

title: Welfare Aides Protest Change Requiring Patients to Pay 20%
description: The city's Social Services Department said yesterday that it would put into effect Dec. I a longdelayed state legislative Medicaid change, and it gloom ily forecast more costs and more people driven onto the relief rolls as a result.

title: Aqueduct Entries
description: Aqueduct Entries

title: ABORTION HURDLES SCORED BY DOCTOR
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 27A pro fessor of obstetrics at Co lumbia University sharply crit icized today some hospitals and some of his physician col leagues for their attitudes in making it as difficult as they can for a woman to get an abortion.

title: Yahya Hopeful on U.S. Aid
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Oct, 27  President Mohammad Agha Yahya Khan said here today that he hoped the United States would increase aid to Pakistan starting this year. He was speaking to newsmen on his return from the United Nations general Assembly.

title: STRIKES AT 2 PAPERS TO BE SET BY GUILD
description: The Newspaper Guild said in a bulletin yesterday that strike deadlines at The New York Times and The Daily News would be announced tomorrow evening.

title: DR. JANOS VIKOL
description: GENEVA, Oct. 27Dr. Janos Vikol, chief of the World Health Organization's cancer unit, died at the group's headquarters to day at the age of 59.

title: Those Treats May Be Tricks
description: Those Halloween goodies that children collect this weekend on their rounds of trickortreating may bring them more horror than hap piness.

title: Treasury Statement
description: Treasury Statement

title: A Marchesa Went to Work And She Earned New Title
description: Her knits sell all over the world. Two years ago she was made a Cavaliere del Lavoro (chevalier of work)  an honor accorded few Italian women. And her fam ily used to say:

title: Peace Corps to Offer Environmental Advice
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) The Peace Corps announced today that it planned to send hundreds of collegetrained specialists abroad to help for eign countries with their en vironmental problems.

title: Mrs. Nixon to Visit Wyoming
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon has added a visit Friday to Casper, Wyo., to her preelection cam paigning. Mrs. Nixon plans oneday trip to Indianapolis and Anderson, Ind., tomorrow.

title: FIRST NEGRO MARSHAL SWORN IN BROOKLYN
description: With an avowal of faith that America is really where it's at. the first Negro United States marshal in the metro politan area was sworn in yes terday at the Federal court house in Brooklyn.

title: GOODBODY TALKS HIT AN OBSTACLE
description: The New York Stock Ex change disclosed last night that a complication had arisen in the efforts of Goodbody & Co., major brokerage house in finan cial distress, to raise the addi tional capital it needed for survival.

title: Teachers Ask Jury Inquiry Into Washington High Violence
description: The United Federation of Teachers asked yesterday that a grand jury or the District At torney investigate the repeated acts of violence that resulted in the closing of the George Wash ington High School on Oct. 16.

title: Brown, With but One Victory, Ends Quarterback Experiment
description: The experiment that turned Brown's fine running back, Bob Flanders, into a quarter back may have run its course.

title: Connecticut Sailor Killed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 27 (UPI) The Defense Department to day identified six servicemen killed in action in the Indochina war, including Radarman 1st Cl. Frederick L. Nutter, a Navy man from Oakdale, Conn.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: Tuesday, Oct. 27. Eighth day.

title: A Legal Aid Committee To Hold Supper Dance
description: The Junior Committee of the Legal Aid Society will hold a benefit supper dance in the Grand Ballroom of the Pierre on Friday.

title: Murphy's New Aide
description: There are many mornings In the life of William H. T. Smith that begin with song.

title: ALI'S HOMETOWN ANGRY ABOUT TV
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct. 27 (AP)  An angry crowd of 450 in Muhammad Ali's home town milled round Freedom Hall demanding their money back after they missed the first two rounds of a closedcircuit presentation of the AliJerry Quarry fight last night.

title: 3 Himmler Aides Are Put On Trial in West Germany
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Oct. 27 (AP)  Three former aides of Heinrich Himmler, the Nazi SS leader, went on trial today charged with complicity in the murder of 115 persons whose bodies were destined for a collection of skeletons.

title: PRICES ARE RAISED ON IRAQI CRUDE OIL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 27 (AP)Western oil companies operating in Iraq have agreed to raise the posted price of Iraqi crude oil exported from Mediterranean ports by 20 cents per barrel, the Oil Ministry an nounced today.

title: Russians Ride in Cable Car
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 27 (UPI)Maj. Gen. Andrian Niko layev and Vitali Sevastyanov, who orbited the earth 18 days in a Russian spacecraft, tried another conveyance todaya San Francisco cable car. The two astronauts tried the centuryold cables after a din ner at Fisherman's Wharf where they were guests of Mayor Joseph Alioto.

title: Youth Testifies Manson Urged Him to Murder Sheriff
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27A youth who was once a member of the hippie family led by Charles M. Manson startled the TateLaBianca murder trial to day by testifying that Manson had once urged him to kill a lawenforcement officer.

title: BARBARA BERNHARD PLAYS FLUTE MUSIC
description: Barbara Bernhard offered a pleasant program of flute mu sic Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. To give the concert a nice touch of variety, she chose to present herself in a number of different instru mental settings: as soloists (a piece by lbert), with piano (Schubert's Trockne Blumen Variations and Faure's Fan tasie), with oboe (a duo by Ginastera) and finally as part of a small chamber group (Bach's Cantata No. 209).

title: Bridge
description: For a partnership to win two events in a major New York tournament is a rare circumstance. For two part nerships to finish onetwo twice in a weekend is per haps unique. This result oc curred in the Metropolitan of the Greater New York Bridge Association last weekend.

title: Earnest of British Intent
description: LUXEMBOURG, Oct. 27The British Government announced today, as an earnest of its European intentions, a speedier than expected changeover in its system of farm support to align with the system in the European Economic Community.

title: Quarry Picks Frazier To Winby a Knockout
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 27Jerry Quarry's father and manager spoke like a father today in explaining the decision of Teddy Bentham, the trainer, to stop last night's bout with Muhammad Ali.

title: Guerrilla Injured in Amman After Gunfire Kills Soldier
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Oct. 27 (Reuters)A Jordanian soldier was killed and a Palestinian guerrilla was wounded in Am man this evening.

title: Market Averages
description: Tuesday, Oct. 27, 1970

title: G.E. Foresees Price Increases
description: MIAMI, Oct. 27The Gen eral Electric Company sees no way to avoid a continu ance of price increases for appliances. Fred J. Borch, chairman said here today.

title: JOHN B. DONAHUE
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 27 (AP) John B. Donahue, editor of Co lumbia magazine from 1928 to 1965, died at his home here yesterday. He was 69 years old.

title: Television
description: Morning 7:00 (2)News Report (4)Today: News ti (7)Listen and Learn

title: State Department Hopeful
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (Reuters) The State Depart ment reiterated today that the incursion was clearly acciden tal. It said that the United States assumed the men would be released fairly soon.

title: The State Assembly
description: State and local governments have grown unhealthily remote. In the races for seats in the New York State Assembly we are endorsing candidates who seem to us most dedicated to revitalizing state government and making it responsive to the public need. Incumbents are designated by an asterisk.

title: EASTERN AIRLINES SEEKING CARIBAIR
description: Eastern Air Lines, Inc., an nounced yesterday it had agreed with CaribbeanAtlantic Airlines, Inc., to acquire its routes, three leased DC930 aircraft and other airline prop erties for a $10, 395,000 note pay able over five years. The pur chase is subject to approval by the Civil Aeronautics Board and the President of the United States.

title: New Lisbon Activist Group Says It Sabotaged Ship
description: LISBON, Oct. 27A new revolutionary group appeared today on the Portuguese scene, claiming responsibility for sab otage of a freighter that regu larly sails the Portuguese African run.

title: CANUCKS VICTORIOUS OVER SABRES, 7 TO 2
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Oct. 17 (UPI)The Van couver Canucks got three goals in the first period and two each in the second and third tonight in beatirig the Buffalo Sabres, 72, in a National Hockey League game.

title: ExCity Aide Pleads Guilty To Kickbacks From Brokers
description: Isaac Glickman, a former se curities analyst employed by the City Controller's office pleaded guilty yesterday in State Supreme Court here to two counts of an indictment charging that he solicited kick backs and favors from broker age firms during 1968.

title: Girl Sitting in Apartment Shot in Neck by Sniper
description: A 15yearold girl was shot by a sniper last night as she in an apartment on the East Side.

title: U. S. RIDER TAKES WASHINGTON TITLE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27For the second time in the Wash ington International Horse Show, a United States rider, this one Carol Hofmann of El mont, L. I., became a winner in the combined international open jumper competition.

title: GERTRUDE S. ELY, HEROINE OF 1918
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Oct. 27 (UPI)Gertrude Sumner Ely, a winner of the French Croix de Guerre for bravery and the re spect of world leaders for her work in political and social causes, died yesterday at Bryn Mawr convalescent home. She was in her seventies.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 11:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: The Horror of the Prisons
description: The smoke that rose in New York City from five of its plundered, so called correctional institutions has cleared; and now everyone is back to business as usual.

title: Neighborhoods: West Indies Flavor Bedford Stuyvesant
description: Bedford  Stuyvesant, the nation's second most popu lous black community, is home to the nation's largest concentration of voluntary black immigrantsthe West Indians.

title: PSYCHIATRIC WORK OF EMPLOYERS CITED
description: Fountain House Foundation, Inc., 425 West 47th Street, nonprofit, nonsectarian psy chiatric rehabilitation facility, and 40 metropolitan New York employers were honored last night for a pioneering transi tionalemployment program for former psychiatric hospital pa tients.

title: ARGENTINES GET ECONOMIC PLAN
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 27 President Roberto Marcelo Lev ingston appealed to the Argen tine people in a televised broadcast last night to help reduce his nation's dependency on foreigners for technology, capital and industrial initiative.

title: JAPANESE CUT RATE OF DISCOUNT TO 6%
description: TOKYO, Oct. 27 (UPI)The Bank of Japan today relaxed Japan's 14monthold tight money policy by reducing the discount rate from 6.25 per cent to 6 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: Ali Declares He Is the Recognized Champion and Frazier Is Just a Contender
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 27Just as boxing's politicians stripped him of his world heavyweight title in 1967, Muhammad Ali deposed Joe Frazier today as the recognized champion.

title: Rogsevelt Results
description: Rogsevelt Results

title: Bronx Building Inspectors Balk Over New Office
description: City building inspectors, as signed yesterday to a Model Cities office in the South Bronx to inaugurate an emer gency repair program, refused to work therein part, they said, because the city had not yet approved the office for oc cupancy.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE SHARPLY
description: Widespread rains sent soy beans futures prices soaring yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade with prices pushing through seasonal highs in six of the seven deliveries.

title: 6 Nations Plan Purchase Of 55 Hercules Planes
description: The LockheedGeorgia Com pany, a division of the Lock heed Aircraft Corporation, has signed contracts or letters of intent with six foreign nations for 55 Hercules turboprop air freighters, it was announced yesterday.

title: AMEX 9MONTH NET TAKES SHARP DROP
description: The American Stock Exchange reported yesterday that net in come In the first nine months of the year plummeted to $399, 000 from $1,858,000 a year earlier.

title: Calley Returns to Vietnam to Prepare for His Defense
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Oct. 28First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. re turned to South Vietnam to day to gather evidence to de fend himself against charges that he had killed more than 100 South Vietnamese in the alleged massacre at Sonmy in 1968.

title: Royal Bank Cancels Tie; Lincoln Merger Barred
description: Two proposed bank mergers foundered yesterday, while third  which would end the separate existence of one of the nation's largest trust companies was announced.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: In Airlines Battle, Every Inch Counts
description: In a confrontation reminis cent of the sandwich war of 1956, America's transcon tinental airlines are em broiled in a seat war in which the weapons are inches of foam rubber. The stakes may run into millions of dol lars.

title: RentRise Filing Extended
description: The city said yesterday that it would extend the deadline for landlords to file their retro active rent increases in rent controlled buildings to Nov. 2. The original deadline, Oct. 31, falls on a Saturday. All increase firms portmarked by midnight Nov. 2 will be valid. The retro active increases were mandated by the city's new rent law, which applies to 145,000 build ings.

title: Aide of Allende Gets Key Post In the Chilean Security Police
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 27 A young Socialist leader was named to a key post in the gov ernment security organization today, in the first government appointment made by Dr. Sal vador Allende, the Marxist Presidentelect of Chile.

title: Home Study For Degree Supported
description: Alan Pifer, the president of the Carnegie Corporation of New York, yesterday en thusiastically endorsed a pro gram that would enable quali fied people not enrolled in college to earn degrees through independent study and examinations.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Mrs. Mennen Keefer Is Remarried
description: IDAHO FALLS, Idaho, Oct. 27Mrs. Mennen Keefer of Mantoloking, N. J., a great granddaughter of Gerhard Mennen, founder of the Men nen Company, was married here this evening to John Harkrader Jr. of Idaho Falls.

title: NETS ARE BEATEN BY CHAPS, 10399
description: FORT WORTH, Oct. 27 (AP) The Texas Chaparrals held off a secondhalf rally by the New York Nets tonight and came up with their first Amer ican Basketball Association vic tory of the season, 10399.

title: Honors for Diverse Discoveries
description: Three diverse and fundamen tal discoveries  about the chemistry of the human body, the nature of cosmic gases and the behavior of magnetism brought Nobel Prize fame yes terday to their discoverers.

title: LAWRENCE S. THEES
description: SEA GIRT, N. J., Oct. 27 Lawrence S. Thees, a former vice president of the electron tube division of the RCA Corpo ration, died here today at his home, 400 Crescent Parkway. He was 70 years old.

title: Leftist Killed and 2 Seized After Bombing in Montevideo
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 27 (UPI)  The police killed one leftist guerrilla ands captured two others in a shoot out here today a few hours after a bombing attack on of fices of communications com pany.

title: CANADA MAKES SALE OF WHEAT TO PEKING
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 27The Ca nadian Government announced today a new sale of 98 million bushels of wheat, worth about $160million, to Communist China.

title: NINE PERSONS NAMED TO COUNCIL ON ARTS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) President Nixon today ap pointed nine members to the National Council on the Arts.

title: Ziegfeld Ball Nov. 6
description: The Ziegfeld Club, Inc., will hold its 33d annual charity ball on Nov. 6 at the Pierre Hotel, it was announced yesterday by Ethyl Van Riper, ball chairman. The evening will include show, Revue Intime, pro duced and staged by Janette Hackett and the crowning of Miss Ziefeld of 1971. Tom Dillon, shepherd of the Lambs, will serve as master of cere monies.

title: NEW CAUTION ISSUED ON DRUG IN DIABETES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The American Diabetes Association officially joined the American Medical Association and the Food and Drug Administration today in suggesting cautious use of a widely prescribed dia betes drug that can be taken by mouth.

title: Military Is Under 3 Million For First Time in 5 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI) The Defense Department re ported today that the combined strength of the Army, Navy, Air Force and Marine Corps has dipped below three million for the first time in nearly five years.

title: Adams Asserts Conservative Vote May Influence State
description: HARTSDALE, N. Y., Oct. 27 Dr. Paul L. Adams, the Con servative candidate for Gover nor, predicted here today that the size of the party's vote next Tuesday would determine the nature and direction of the state government for the next four years.

title: Flood Is Said to Agree On Senators Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Curt Flood and the Washington Senators have agreed on a contract for the 1971 baseball season, the Washington Post reported to night in its Wednesday edi tions.

title: Southern Railway's Net Up3 Others Down
description: Four of the nation's largest and wealthiest railroads issued their September quarter earn ings reports yesterday and they showed sharply divergent trends.

title: All 5 in Family Found Slain In Beds in Their Utah Home
description: SANDY, Utah, Oct. 27 (UPI) All five members of a family were found shot to death in their beds today.

title: Panther Defendant CrossExamines the Detective Who Arrested Him on How Fast He Can Run
description: Michael Tabor, one of 13 Black Panthers on trial here, crossexamined the detective who arrested him for an hour in Criminal Court yesterday, in a dramatic confrontation mark ed by disputes over what really happened. Part of the testimony involved how fast each could run.

title: Miss Crowe To Be Bride
description: Philip Kingsland Crowe, Ambassador to Norway, and Mrs. Crowe have announced here the engagement of their daughter. Miss Phillippa Crowe, to David H. Neilson of Flushing, Queens. He is vice president and secretary of Adler & Neilson, Inc., an architectural iron works con cern of Woodside, Queens, of which his father, the late Henry C. Neilson, was a founder.

title: Fight Fans Invited To $100,000 Holdup
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 27A team of robbers took at least $100, 000 in cash and jewelry from dozens of affluent boxing fans here who had been invited to a party after Muhammad Ali's bout with Jerry Quarry last night.

title: Miss Calvocoressi Is Betrothed
description: MIDDLE HADDAM, Conn., Oct. 27Mr. and Mrs. John L. Calvocoressi have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss J. Zelie Calvocoressi, to Patrick R. Tourais of Plainfield, N. J. The future bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Germaine Tourais of Nice, France, and Pierre Tourais of Paris.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n

title: AMERICAN SUGAR CO. BECOMES AMSTAR
description: To emphasize its diversifica tion program, the 79yearold American Sugar Company has changed its name to the Amstar Corporation, William F. Oliver, president, announced yesterday at the concern's annual meet ing in the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: Saigon Forces to Push Deeper Into Cambodia in Search of Foe
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 27 (AP)  The comman der of a new South Vietnamese offensive in Cambodia said to day that his forces would push deeper into that country to try to force the North Viet namese to fight.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books:
description: A Life of John Keats, by Dorothy Hewlett, third revised edition (Barnes & Noble, $7.50).

title: Knicks Beat Sonics, 117104, Despite Dull Performance
description: In a backhanded sort of way, the New York Knicks showed one of their championship qual ities in beating the Seattle Sonics, 117104, at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: Couple Held Without Bail In Fatal Beating of Child
description: A young Bronx man and his wife were held without bail at an arraignment yesterday in Bronx Criminal Court on charges of fatally beating their 19monthold daughter.

title: Governor Is Too Quick For a Buckley Picture
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 27James L. Buckley, the Conservative party candidate for Senator, who has the implicit backing of the national Republican Administration, waited out side the Statler Hilton Hotel here for a chance to cross paths withand, perhaps, shake hands with, for the benefit of local political lead ers and photographersGov ernor Rockefeller.

title: East Germans Jail American and Briton
description: BERLIN, Oct. 27A 25year old American student and his cousin, a Briton of the same age, were sentenced to prison terms today by the East Berlin city court on charges of having distributed posters and leaflets described by the East Germans as Fascist.

title: The Pope and the Jews
description: Today is the fifth anniversary of the Declaration of the Jews promulgated by the Second Vatican Council. In it the Roman Catholic Church denounced antiSemitism with all its works and all its ways, affirmed a common pat rimony between Christians and Jews, and called for joint theological studies and fraternal dialogue.

title: JACOB QUALEY, 65, EDUCATIONAL EDITOR
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Oct. 27  Jacob S. Qualey, a retired newspaper man and former Nieman Fellow, died Saturday of injuries inflicted in the street near his home at 96 James Street. He was 65 years old.

title: Pacific Tests Announced
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27 (UPI) The Soviet Union announced today that it will carry out a new series of rocket launchings in the Pacific test area starting tomorrow. It said the testing of giant rockets would last until Nov. 30.

title: GERMANS FAVORITES IN HORSE SHOW HERE
description: Bill Steinkraus, the Olympicl individual gold medal winner, conceded yesterday that the United States Equestrian Team would be a decided underdog in the National Horse Show start ing next Tuesday in Madison Square Garden.

title: Students Help Campaign in New York
description: A heavy rain fell just be fore noon Monday at 79th Street and Broadway but Stewart Stoltz stayed at his campaign post cheerfully thrusting OttingerforSenator pamphlets at passersby. Stewart is 15 years old and is on a weekandahalflong leave from CrotonHarmon High School in Crotonon Hudson to work in the elec tion campaigns here.

title: MISS TURECK BEGINS BACH MUSIC SERIES
description: Rosalyn Tureck, the cham pion Bach Specialist of the Western World, opened a three concert series of music by that composer at Carnegie Hall Mon day night.

title: PRAISE BESTOWED ON FRONT SEVEN
description: The Jets might have a new look in their offensive back field, but it's the same old Jet defense that concerns Fran Tarkenton.

title: Theater: Misconception
description: Something called The Im maculate Misconception opened last night at the Cherry Lane. It is a work that does not even merit the title vanity production. Whose vanity does Is as suage?

title: Market Place:
description: If one truth was empha sized in the bear market that followed the bull market of 196768, it is this: Attempts to powder earnings results with the talc of roundabout accounting can lead to dis aster.

title: Surging. Mexican Fans on Track Nearly Halted the Grand Prix
description: The road kept getting narrower and narrower. This is the terrifying image evoked by, Jacky Ickx in de scribing the madness that surrounded the end of Sun days Grand Prix of Mexico, which he won; The Mexican Grand Prix has never been a model of efficiency, but Sunday's was one of the worst ever, one that came close to a calamity as the spectators got out of control and surged onto the 3.2mile track. Instead of running the usual Victory lap, Ickx parked his Ferrari at the startfinish line and rushed into the garage to avoid a mob of about 5,000 persons surging around the pit area. Only six drivers could finish the race properly because of the danger to the crowd. The attendance was estimated at 110.000.

title: PRESIDENT BEGINS FINAL VOTE DRIVE
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Oct. 27President Nixon em barked tonight on a weeklong effort to put some life into half a dozen uncertain Republican candidacies.

title: Crum & Forster Gains
description: Consolidated net income of Crum & Forster, the insurance concern, rose in the first nine months to $14,217,505, or $2.40 a share, from $8.86million, or $1.43 a share, a year earlier, B. P. Russell, president, report ed yesterday. Investment in come rose 20 per cent to $23, 481,775 from $19,506,439 the year before. He also reported a $10million loss before taxes as a result of Hurricane Celia in Texas.

title: Addicts Benefactor Views Their Squalor
description: W, Clement Stone, the multi millionaire philanthropist from Chicago who has given more than a half million dollars to New York addicts rehabilitation center, got his first look yester day at the life of a narcotics addict.

title: Business Records
description: Monday, Oct. 26, 1970

title: Auto Maker's Earnings Rise in 3d Period
description: DETROIT, Oct. 27The Ford Motor Company reported yes terday that its net income in the third quarter totaled $74 million, or 68 cents a share, on sales of $3.4billion.

title: RAY'S BROTHER HELD IN A BANK ROBBERY
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 27  The brother of James Earl Ray was charged today with participat ing in a $53,000 holdup yester day at a small, rural bank 30 miles northwest of St. Louis.

title: Thailand's Cabinet Takes Time Out to Watch Ali Bout
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 27 (AP)  Thai cabinet ministers, headed by Premier Thano Kit tikachorn, stopped state mat ters this morning to watch the Muhammad AliJerry Quarry fight on a telecast beamed to Thailand via satellite.

title: Edward O'Brien, Turf Figure And Former Polo Player, Dead
description: EUTAWVILLE, S. C., Oct. 27 Edward M. O'Brien, a thor oughbred race horse owner and trainer, died today at his home, Walworth Plantation, after a long illness. He was 63 years old.

title: BIG BOARD PRICES CONTINUE TO FALL
description: Wall Street's own ecology problem  the slow erosion of stock prices  continued yes terday.

title: Students Interest in Campaign Found Ebbing as Election Nears
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27 Student interest in politics has declined sharply since last spring, when hundreds of thou sands of young people demon strated against the incursion into Cambodia and the killings at Kent State.

title: ST. JOHN'S TO SHUT BROOKLYN CENTER
description: St. John's University plans to close its downtown Brooklyn center and merge with Notre Dame College, a financially be set Roman Catholic women's college on Staten Island, the Very Rev. Joseph T. Cahill, president of St. John's, an nounced yesterday.

title: CITY SEEKS TO AID ADDICTS CENTERS
description: A modification of the city's stringent 1968 Building Code to make it easier for drug rehabilitation centers to oper ate was urged yesterday by the Lindsay administration.

title: Murphy Calls His Police Aides To Meeting Today on Corruption
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy has summoned the top commanders of the New York Police Department to tell them to end corruption or face demotion or transfer.

title: Weicker Assails Two Rivals in Connecticut SenateRace Debate
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 27In the only scheduled debate for all three candidates for the United States Senate in Con necticut, the Republican lashed out today at both his oppo nents.

title: Tower Committee Spreading Funds Among G.O.P. Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 Senator John G. Tower's Re publican Senatorial Campaign Committee, which was under fire earlier for inequity in passing out campaign funds, spread its money a bit more widely and a little less thickly in the six weeks that ended Oct. 19.

title: Conservative Scored
description: Representative Richard L. Ot tinger, shouting into the chill air above Herald Square yester day, charged that James L. Buckley was a coward who had gone upstate to make the most vicious, violent attack since the days of Joseph Mc Carthy.

title: U.S. YOUTH HAILED IN U.N. COMMITTEE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27  An American Negro educator paid tribute today to youth as being the least racist element in United States society.

title: Yale, Dartmouth Differ Only in Color of Jerseys
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 27Both are undefeated. Both display explosive offenses and intransi gent defenses. Both have ex perience, size and speed.

title: Bonavena Describes All As Having Many Faults
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 27 (Reuters)Oscar Bonavena, the worldranking Argentine heavyweight, described Mo hammad Ali today as a mere myth and said his style had many faults.

title: Jets vs. Giants: Both Teams Are Wary
description: The New York Jets limped to the movies yesterday after noon, and what they saw did nothing to relieve their feeling that they will have a tiger by the tail Sunday when they meet the Giants in Shea Sta dium.

title: U.S. Girl Gymnast Takes Second Place In World Title Event
description: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, Oct. 27 (AP)Cathy Rigby of Long Beach, Calif., ended a long medal famine for Ameri can women today with a sec ondplace finish in the balance beam event at the World gym nastics championships.

title: G.O.P.'S CHAIRMAN ASSAILS LINDSAY
description: Republican National Chair man Rogers C. B. Morton, lash ing back at Mayor Lindsay's attack on President Nixon, charged yesterday that the Mayor has apparently re nounced all of his stated be liefs in order to further his own political ambitions.

title: Army Plans to Revoke General's Medals
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 27 (AP)The Army's Sai gon command is revoking two medals for bravery in combat that were awarded to Brig. Gen. Eugene P. Forrester on the basis of fictitious citations, an Army spokesman said tonight.

title: 2 States Sign to Take Over the New Haven
description: Sweeping modernization and a longabsent stability were all but assured for the New Haven commuter rail service yesterday with the signing of contracts by New York State and Con necticut to take over the serv ice on Jan. 1.

title: Births
description: SZANTONJonathan and Tziona (nee Tirem) of 1019/12, NetivotNegev, Israel, an nounce the arrival of a son on October 24th. Proud grandparents are Mr. and Mrs. Yafet Tirem of PardesHanna, Israel and Dr. and Mrs. Victor L. Szanton of Ansonia, Conn.

title: Congressional Reform Bill Signed Into Law by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)  The first reform of Congressional procedures since 1946 was signed into law yes terday by President Nixon.

title: Writer Assails WPIX News Handling
description: Colin Gibson, one of the for mer WPM news writers who accused the station of news dis tortions, said yesterday that the news broadcasting operation at the station from August to Oc tober, 1968, was a haphazard, procedure.

title: Cahill's Son Is Fined $500 For Possessing Marijuana
description: TRENTON, Oct. 27 (AP) Gov. William T. Cahill's 19 yearold son John has been, fined $500 and given a sus pended two  to  five  year jail sentence for possession of mari juana, the Governor's office said today.

title: EDWARD J. TOBIN
description: Edward J. Tobin, a home builder and developer in this area, died of a heart attack on Monday in Long Island Jewish Hospital, New Hyde Park, after a short illness. He was 61 years old and lived at 45 Bev erly Road, Great Neck, L. I., and in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Senior Executive Joins Herbert Arthur Morris
description: Marvin Davis, a partner in Davis Parker Vellanti, Inc., which is in the process of dissolution, has joined Her bert Arthur Morris Advertis ing, Inc.

title: Merrill Lynch's Earnings Rose Sharply in Quarter
description: Bouncing back sharply from a poor first half, the earnings of the world's biggest broker age house, Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., appeared yesterday to have more than tripled in the third quarter of 1970.

title: Its Ambiance Will Go From Snack to Posh
description: Ten years, a new setting, a shift in the public need and a fat twoyear contract can change the basics of a man's think ing. So here's Joseph Baum, elegantly frenchcuffed as ever, sitting deep in club chair in front of a scale model of the World Trade Center, talking with great enthusiasm about informal eat ing and exciting snack foods and differing kinds of mass eating.

title: Three Science Nobel Laureates
description: Prof. Louis Eugene Felix Neel (pronounced NAYell) is a distinguished physicist and a modest one as well. After hearing that he had won the Nobel Prize yesterday for his work with magnetism, he said with embarrassment, There are only a few Nobel Prizes, yet many good physi cists.

title: Economist to Wed Emily Shipley
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Oct. 27 Mr. and Mrs. Linwood Parks Shipley have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Emily Jane Shipley, to Dr. Eric Gillmor Davis, son of Dr. and Mrs. Richard E. G. Davis of Toronto.

title: British Football Results
description: British Football Results

title: For the Children: Places to Go, Things to See
description: For the Children: Places to Go, Things to See

title: COLUMBIA DAILY FIGHTS U.S.ON TAX
description: The Columbia Daily Spec tator, an undergraduate news paper whose taxexempt status is under investigation by the Internal Revenue Service, dis closed yesterday that it had refused to sign a statement for the service agreeing not to en dorse any political candidates.

title: Goldberg Calls Governor A Nixon Tellow Traveler
description: Arthur J. Goldberg asserted last night that Governor Rocke feller was at least indirectly aiding the candidacy of James L. Buckley, the Conservative candidate for Senator, and in that respect was a fellow tra veler of President Nixon and Vice President Agnew.

title: Nets Up for WarnerLambert, Merck, Johnson and Borden
description: Record sales and earnings were posted by three major pharmaceutical and finechem ical producers  the Warner Lambert Pharmaceutical Com pany, Merck & Co. and John son & Johnsonthat reported yesterday for the third quar ter and first nine months this year.

title: Gay Callan, Berkeley Senior, Is the Fiancee of Mark Litke
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 27 The engagement of Miss Gay Callan to Mark Litke, a graduate student in journal ism at the University of California in Berkeley, has been announced by her pa rents, Mrs. Georgina Hopkins Callan and Edwin C. Callan, both of San Francisco. The wedding will take place in the late spring.

title: Nixon Signs Drug Abuse Control Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP  President Nixon signed the drug abuse control bill today and called on Americans to help save thousands of our young people who would other wise be hooked on drugs by backing up law enforcers with moral support.

title: Parley of American Lutheran Church Backs Use of the Title Bishop
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Oct. 27 The American Lutheran Church overwhelmingly ap proved in principle today the use of the title Bishop by its top leaders.

title: BUCKS TURN BACK ROCKETS, 126113
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 27 (AP) A 39point performance by Bobby Dandridge led the Mil waukee Bucks to a 126113 National Basketball Association victory over the San Diego Rockets tonight.

title: ALL ON 747 SAFE IN LONDON MISHAP
description: LONDON, Oct. 27 (UPI)An engine of a Pan American Boe ing 747 jumbo jet burst into flames today during a landing at London's Heathrow Airport. The 89 passengers aboard evac uated the plane by way of emergency exits and slide chutes.

title: Assemblymen Say Methadone Users Are Denied Jobs
description: Four Assemblymen charged yesterday that there was wide spread job discrimination against herioin addicts receiv ing methadone treatment and said they were considering in troducing legislation to end the discrimination.

title: Union Theological Elects
description: Mrs. Horace Havemeyer Jr., a member of the board of di rectors of the Union Theological Seminary at Broadway and 120th Street, was elected chair man of the board yesterday.

title: Market Summary
description: NEW YORK STOCK EXCHANGE (Volume 9,680,000 shares)

title: Football Poll
description: Football Poll

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures

title: N. C. A. A. IN C. A. A. Urged to Place a Ceiling on Scholarships
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 27 (UPI)The National Collegiate Athletic Association received request today to limit the num ber of football and basketball scholarships and to grant schol arships on the basis of financial need instead of athletic ability.The request was made by the association's financial aid com mittee, as part of a program to equalize competition and to cut athletic costs. William J. Flynn, chairman of the com mittee, presented the recommendation to the 18member N.C.A.A. Council.

title: Stage: Light and Yiddish
description: An engaging and diverting Jewish musical entertain ment, led by Ben Bonus ar rived at the Belasco Theater last night. It is called Light. Lively and Yiddish and should delight those who still hanker for an evening de voted to Jewish song, dance and humor.

title: KIDNAPPERS SEIZE ECUADOR AIR CHIEF
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Oct. 27 (AP)The commander of Ecua dor's Air Force was kidnapped today and the Government de clared martial law in the search for his abductors.

title: Old Glory. Sale Attracts One Buyer From Wales
description: YONKERS, Oct. 27  Horse sales such as the Old Glory vendue in progress at Yonkers Raceway attract buyers from a number of areas. Many travel a considerable distance with the hope of finding a bargain.

title: Arms Cache Is Found
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 27 (UPI)The police seized a large cache of arms and explosives in a motel room today and were seeking two young white women who had apparently left the arsenal there. The weapons included a Chinesemade tom my gun, several other auto matic guns, grenades and sticks of dynamite. They were piled on a bed of the 55th Street Motel.

title: Women Honor Mrs. Straus for Service
description: Mrs. R. Peter Straus, wife of the president of radio sta tion WMCA, was named the 1970 Woman of Conscience yesterday by the Na tional Council of Women.

title: Ohio Heads for a Political Shift
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 26A new day is dawning in the poli tics of Ohio, thecountry's sixth largest state and one of the traditional battlegrounds among aspirants for national power.

title: JOSEPH BETTS POPE, CANNON MILLS AIDE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 27 Joseph Betts Pope, a manage ment consultant and former controller of Cannon Mills, died yesterday at his home, 71 Wayne Avenue, after a short illness. He was 75 years old.

title: F.C.C. Asked to Refuse A Wisconsin TV Renewal
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission has been esked to deny renewal of the broad casting license of station WISC TV in Madison, Wis.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 27s  As a longtime manager of fighters, Angelo Dundee is well versed in percentages of every description. As the trainer of Cassius Clay (also known as Muhammad Ali) from the time the 1960 Olympic champion turned professional, Angelo has a more profound knowledge of the man than anyone else.

title: J. & L. Steel Halts Item
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 27 (AP) Jones & Laughlin Steel Com pany today announced discon tinuance of shipments of gal vanized sheet in coils effective Dec. 31. The company said they were taking similar action to their competitors in halting shipments of the secondary item.

title: Ceausescu Ends U. S. Visit After Meeting With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27A United States Marine Corps hel icopter flew President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania on this gray autumn afternoon from the White House to Andrews Air Force Base in Maryland, where he boarded a Sovietmade airliner for the trip home.

title: Brazilian Bishop, Social Reformer, Symbolizes Trends in Latin Church
description: RIO DE JANIERO, Oct, 21 A small, delicate Brazilian Bish op with a dramatic speaking style has become an interna tional symbol for the growing shift of the Roman Catholic Church in Latin America from defense of the established order to advocacy of social reform.

description: Sports Today

title: Lawyer Will Wed Miss Fractenberg

title: Tax Evader Fined $22,500
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)F. Norman Peterson, 65 years old, of Carlisle, was fined $22,500 today and given a threemonth suspended term on charges of willful evasion of personal and corporate income taxes. The former president of the Concord Oil Company pleaded guilty Oct. 9 in United States District Court to three counts charging evasion of $36,413 in taxes be tween 1963 and 1966.

title: Delaware Heads Cup Poll

The Cup is awarded annually for outstanding performance by a middlesized college football team in the East. The Blue Hens received 79 of 80 points. Spring field was second with 73 points and Rochester third with 54.

title: F.P.C. Allows Price Rises On Louisiana Natural Gas
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) The Federal Power Commis sion ended today its moratorium on price increases for natural gas produced in southern Loui siana.

title: DiPaola in Nassau County
description: Nassau on Long Island is among the nation's fastest growing counties. Its choice of a new County Executive next month is accordingly of major importance, involving in varying degree the transportation, schools, jobs and environment of a community larger than all but five the biggest American cities.

title: John Fahey, Casual Virtuoso, Pleases With Guitar Concert
description: An audience some of whose members had come from Mas sachusetts and Pennsylvania for the occasion filled the Washington Square Church, 135 West Fourth Street, Mon day evening to, hear a very informal and disarmingly dif fident virtuoso of the guitar, John Fahey.

description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27  Mrs. Louise Mundheim Gersten feld, widow of the Rev. Dr. Norman Gerstenfeld, rabbi of the Washington Hebrew Con gregation, died yesterday at her home here. She was 60 years old.

Durham, trainer of the heavyweight champion, was asked today why he didn't go see the fight, either live or on closedcircuit television.

In late afternoon, the President flew to his Key Biscayne, Fla., home for the start of a political campaign trip that ends on Election Day at the Western White House in San Clemente, Calif.
